text:
This place has it all: a huge menu that's perfectly executed, loads of vegetarian/vegan options (yet plenty to keep the meat-eaters happy), local and organic options, and quick service... and all the while they keep the prices appropriately cheap for a diner. 

I've found everything there to be tasty, and the place is always clean. Their Heathen Vegan Shoplifter's Delight sandwich is possibly the best thing I've ever tasted. The only downside is that I'm always too full to try one of their great looking desserts!

If you have children you do NOT want to go here.

We went to the Blue Plate this afternoon for a late lunch after sledding at Olbrich Park. We were waiting for a booth and were invited to go to the counter so we could be seated immediately. Our four year old son sat down next to a heavy set women eating lunch. She proceeded to remark, "I don't want to sit next to a squirmy kid" and the hostess behind the counter look at us like we were bothering her and how dare we bring a four year old to the counter. It was uncomfortable and rather rude.

If you are not a tragic hipster or if you have kids, do not bother going to the Blue Plate Diner. The Daisy Cafe is right down the road is is very kid/family friendly. The food at the Blue Plate is mediocre at best and atmosphere stinks.

I just love Monty's for breakfast. I've taken the parental units there twice, and they agree. The ambiance is great (if a wee bit noisy): a throwback to a classic, 50s-era diner, with the requisite neon lighting, "lunch counter", and bar stools. The portions are huge, so this is truly "brunch"! So far I've tried the chilaquiles and the breakfast burrito (yes, I like my Mexican/Southwestern fare!). Both were fantastic, especially when paired with a Mimosa. The menu is extensive: from  humble "bacon & eggs" selections to omelets and elaborate ethnic creations. 

If weekend brunch is what you have in mind, I'd suggest arriving early--as in, no later than 8:30 a.m. After that, you'll likely have a long wait. (In the meantime, you can ogle the impressive bakery case.) The staff are friendly, and the service is fast. Despite its location in the busy Atwood neighborhood, I've never had issues finding parking at Monty's. The only slightly negative comment I'd make is that the booths, although they can accommodate 6 people as far as width is concerned, are a bit on the tight sight with regard to the distance from seat back to table. I'm a thin person, so I can imagine that this might be uncomfortable for those with a stockier build. 

Monty's is my new go-to breakfast joint. I highly recommend it.

Be sure to check in on Yelp for a free bottomless coffee!

I came in here with my mother a few weeks ago and the experience was positively wonderful. It was my mother's birthday and the blonde manager gave her a complementary piece of pie. She still mentions "that sweet girl with the pie" and the salmon hash (amaaaazing, try it) to this day. Thank you for great food and a great time!

I love this place.

I have gotten so many things on this menu that I can't even go into it in a limited space.  Everything has been addicting, delicious, and exactly what I needed at the time.  A few must trys: artichoke sandwich, grilled cheese with tomato soup, turkey club, pesto omelette, and GBLT.  Also, their cranberry muffins will completely change your life.  Best muffin I've ever had...and my mom makes a mean batch of blueberry muffins with crumble topping.

Also, I'm not sure why some people are saying the service is not that good...I've NEVER had a bad customer service experience.  All of the servers are extremely nice and will do whatever they can to give you exactly what you need.  They are always so much fun and I'm actually friends with a few of them now because I go so frequently.

Go to Monty's. NOW.  You will NOT be disappointed.
Went here with the family for lunch and was amazed! The food was very flavorful and the staff was so friendly. Also, the coconut cream pie was delicious! Would definitely come back here soon.

This place is so close to my house and I've been meaning to go to it for a long while, however I've never made it inside until a few nights ago.  Usually my husband and I will try to go for brunch but it is always VERY crowded.  The other night my friend and I decided to stop in for coffee and dessert because the chocoletarian had just closed.  We came in at about 7pm on a Sunday and the place was all but desserted (pun intended :).   We had turtle cheesecake and malt pie.  The cheesecake was dense and sweet, I'd give it 4 stars.  The malt pie was bland and tasted nothing of chocolate nor malt, 1 star.  The waiter was sassy and chatty which added to our diner experience.  For a Sunday night coffee and dessert spot Monty's has earned 3 stars.

One of my favorite brunch spots in Madison.  Good vegan and vegetarian options as well.  I'm a meat-eater and have had one or two of their all veggie dishes and been very impressed (I like the tofu scrambler)  Another favorite is whatever the scrambler of the day is.  Good reuben for lunch too.

The food is just good. I appreciate the variety. Consistency of quality and quantity is a problem.  Service is hit or miss. Great option for entertaining with lots of varied food needs and/or kids in tow.

Breakfast places are generally my favorite types of places to dive into in new cities simply because breakfast is my favorite meal of the day.  

I'd never been to Madison before and I must say it's a lovely city.  Of course we were there in late May when the temperature was a balmy 67 with nice breezes throughout.  

Monty's was good, very good, in fact.  So good that we went there 2 days in a row.  We were traveling with some vegetarians and they were able to find tasty eats on the menu as well.  

There was disappointment in their version of eggs benedict which had a mornay-type sauce that really tasted burnt.  Like burnt crap, actually.  Maybe I just don't like mornay sauce but ugh.  

Coffee was good, we tried some of their desserts and enjoyed the diner atmosphere from our cozy booth.  Well done, Madison, well done.

Ate here for my first time today and wow was it delicious! And not to mention fairly priced. They feature everything from all day breakfast to comfort food dinner entrees, creative sandwiches and soups, and more! They have a vegan menu for those interested and a wide variety of desserts. I will be going back!! If you haven't tried it yet, I highly recommend it!

I've been coming here since I was in middle school and it was the cool place to hang out on half-days. 6 orders of waffle fries, anyone?

We went last night for an early dinner and squeezed 7 people into a booth. I got blueberry pancakes (LOVE breakfast all day) and they were okay.  My friend's french toast came with apple butter though, and slathered on top of the pancakes = much better pancakes.  Around the table there were also a few types of burgers, a meatloaf sandwich, a fruit plate, and a whole lot of milkshakes and sundaes. Big let down: they were out  of over half of the mix-ins for the milkshakes/sundaes. You can't have a dirt cup without gummy worms!

Overall, I've always liked it here. Service can be hit or miss. Food is pretty good. Milkshakes are hurt-your-teeth sweet.

The host was top notch. The place was busy and he just directed that madness like Ditka in the 80's. The food was not memorable in the slightest. My girl ordered the Saturday special which was biscuits,sausage gravy, eggs and potatoes for 8.99. I ordered the two egg breakfast with a side of this sausage gravy and not only did I get more food but the cost was 2.65 cheaper. She felt ripped off as it was overpriced and biscuits implies two biscuits not one. Also whatever spice they dump on the potatoes leaves one with a mangled palette. Service was fair though I was out of water for over 10 minutes. Overrated in all aspects in my opinion. Im from Charleston,SC and somebody needs to visit there to learn a few things about making it right. Madison itself is a jewel!

I had a wonderful experience at Monty's. My server was incredibly kind, attentive, and friendly. He could not have had a more pleasant demeanor. The food was also quite good, and the prices are great. I ordered the breakfast burrito and enjoyed it very much. I would definitely go back to Monty's

Awesome dougnuts!
Great place to take the grandparents--there is something that everyone will like.
Great coffee.  
Nice new 'local meats' section of the menu.

Monty's is obviously a popular and beloved place, judging by the number of reviews, and rightly so. Hard to beat the combination of an old-school setting and really good food. The only knock against it is the crowds, especially for weekend breakfast. But do make an effort to have breakfast there sometime - the donut French toast is fantastic. They also have great pies and desserts, and they do all the diner standards really well.
My favorite used to be the DONUT FRENCH TOAST...It's no longer on the menu but I'm pretty sure they'll make it if you ask. Otherwise, go for a whopping slice of drumstick pie!
Yum & cool. Zucchini pancakes! Feeling like you want retro? Monty's is the place.  Madison has the best food, this place is should on your list to try.
The meatloaf in every form is superb. There are three options, meatless, sandwich, and entree, and they are all 'of the gods.' Absolute favorite place.

My girlfriend and I came for breakfast and were seated promptly.  It took a while for the waitress to come over with waters, but it was busy and she had tables with food coming out.  Once she did come over, she was extremely nice and asked if we wanted anything to drink.  We got some coffees and ordered a donut to share.  They have 3 types (glazed, sprinkles and cinnamon-sugar) and we got the glazed donut.  It was delicious and well worth it.  For breakfast we ordered the corned beef hash which was pretty good, although I wish the potatoes were a little burnt.  My girlfriend got eggs morney, which she enjoyed.  When the waitress brought our check she also found a coupon for a free donut and coffee which we appreciated greatly.  Altogether, the food was good (and there were plenty of menu items that I wanted to try) and at a great price (nice food to dollar ratio in both quantity and quality).  The servers were friendly and thoughtful and we will be returning again.

What an eclectic menu for a diner!  The ambiance is just what you would expect from a classic 60's diner.  I had a ruben and some fries and it was really good!  Most places use processed corned beef.  Theirs was real sliced beef...very tender and very flavorful.  Probably the best ruben I have ever had.  I had to try the pie too since they tease you with a great display right when you walk in.  The French silk was really rich and chocolaty.  Definately worth the stop if you are in the area or passing through.

Stopped here with family based on the reviews and were not disappointed!
I loved the variety on the menu including breakfast all day. I had the "meatloaf of the gods" others had Monty burger, BLT, Mac n cheese and kids had French toast.
All was super tasty and we loved eating outside.
I was only sad I was too full to try the pie.

Two thumbs for a great vegan menu. The vegan hash was really good. The vegan milkshake was delicious and huge. 
Fast and friendly service. Also kid-friendly.
The food was fantastic and the staff was extremely welcoming. The cook even came out and told a few jokes. I will return whenever I pass through Madison

Food is consistently good. We often go for weekend brunch. I'm from NJ, which has a lot of 24 hour diners. This is one of the only places in Madison that offers breakfast all day, so it's great in my book. Don't come if you mind long lines or kids; do come if you like yeasted doughnuts!

My wife and I used to come here years ago when we were in school. We came back for a weekend and thought we'd see how it held up. In a word: GREAT! We weren't vegans when we used to come here but are now and I'm happy to say that Monty's has a bunch of vegan dishes. And vegan pies. Holy hell, vegan pies with vegan ice cream. Super good. Will be back whenever we're in town.

The 'Heathen Vegan Shoplifter's Delight' is probably the single best sandwich I have ever had in my life. Make sure to spring for the waffle fries with it. Oh my god! This is what I get pretty much every time I go.

They also have really good vegan pancakes.

The servers I have encountered have always been extremely friendly and attentive.

I like Monty's food--breakfast, lunch, and dinner are all very good--but I just can't help thinking that it's overpriced when I go there.  It seems like it should be diner-priced . . . but almost $9 for a grilled cheese seems a bit steep to me.  Their desserts are to die for, though.

Very cozy and retro, really cool neon lighting fixtures. Really great mac&cheese and quesadillas. They have a lot of vegetarian and vegan dishes. They have a good beer selection with quite a few local beers to choose from. Really delicious pies and the other pastries, ice creams, and milkshakes sound good.

Honestly, I can't see what the fuss is all about with Monty's.  It's certainly a staple of the Madison community, and the food is decent, but I find it overpriced, and the waits too long for the quality of the food.  Classic diner feel gives it a slight bump, but really, I think it's an average place, with average food.
Meatloaf with red wine gravy and amazing mashed potatoes, followed by the best bumbleberry pie ever. Best place for comfort food. Did I mention the pie??

Everything here is amazing! Casual retro diner setting. The vegan/veggie selection is almost as big as the meat selections. Alcoholic milkshakes are great for sharing. I really like the outdoor seating and I've been there when they had a live band outside. Not a single complaint about Monty's! A favorite of mine.

Though the service was great, the food hot, and the coffee bottomless, I still considered Mickeys to be a disappointing breakfast because I felt their food just lacked flavor. I went for the salmon hash and think there was 1-1.5 ounces of salmon to go along with all the unseasoned potatoes. Just not very much balance or texture differences to standout enough.

Again, the place has a cool retro feel, folks are nice, prices aren't bad-- but I won't be back because the food just doesn't do much for me.

What a good find! Discovered this place after going to Olbrich Botanical Gardens and looking for somewhere close for dinner.  They have a little of everything, and it's all excellent! Not the cheapest, but great value for money, and all staff were very friendly and efficient!

I love this place! They have amazing cheesecakes, breakfast options and yummy sammies. My favorite thing to eat is the grilled chicken and goat cheese sandwich! The flavors are so fresh and work well. I also love to sneak raspberry cheesecake when I am done ;)

My boyfriend and I had my 11 year-old granddaughter for the weekend.  We found street parking near the diner. We put our name in for a table and had to stand in a very small area at the front of the restaurant (along with many others) to wait.  I know most breakfast places are busy on Sunday mornings, but we waited almost 40 minutes before our name was called. Once we were seated, it took a while before we even had water on our table.  We reviewed the menu, and made our decisions.  This place has a vegetarian menu, but they have all the Veg items on the regular menu, so not sure why they needed a separate menu. We each had a different menu item.  We all agreed the food was good, but nothing outstanding. Our server was slow, but apologetic.  Having more servers would be an option to speed up turnaround. I was told this was a popular place, but I'm not sure what makes it so popular.  If you don't mind waiting, this place is great.  I personally will look for a place with more seating so I don't need to wait as long.

Food was really good!  We were able to eat outside which is a plus when traveling with a dog. 

We had breakfast for dinner. Biscuits were amazing and I highly recommend the Florentine.

Been here a couple times now and its my go to diner for breakfast in Madison.  
The prices are really good, the food taste really good/fresh, and there are lots of classic and original options.
I really like the sweet potato hash and they have a great collection of pies.

It won't blow your mind and there can be a wait sometimes, but a really solid diner.
Traditional homemade diner fare with many vegan and gluten free options. Everything is good here from the coffee to the soup and everything in between. Great waitstaff and counter folks there too.

An old stand-by for me. It's not extraordinary, but it's usually quite good and pretty filling. Usually get very good service, but not always. 

My favorites:
Heathen Vegan (although it seems to depend on who makes it)
Chicken in a Pie  (be sure you are able to take a nap afterward though)
Blue Plate Special Omelet (biscuit quality varies)
Homemade Granola (the best!)

Not as good:
Mac and Cheese, Reuben, Chicken/Bacon/Goat Cheese, Artichoke Sandwich, Sweet Potato Hash.

I love both their regular and their waffle fries. Always seem to be perfectly cooked.

Coffee is usually weak, but at least it's bottomless.

Their blueberry pie was my favorite. I say "was" because they apparently took it off their menu. NOOOOOO!!!!!! I've been fed various lines by the waitstaff during different visits -- that it's seasonal, that they only have it certain days, etc. -- but alas, it appears they've removed it permanently. :(

My wife and I have been here twice and have loved it each time!  This is not only a nice place to go if you're craving something vegetarian.  They have great sandwiches and bowls that are enjoyable,  The pies are usually fantastic!  So many choices...I don't think you can go wrong.  For a place that looks like your classic greasy diner, it offers a more home-cooked feel with a veggie vibe.  Definitely worth checking out!

The food can be good here (not great but good) but the biggest problem for me is the AWFUL service.  Somebody teach these people some customer service.  I swear that the guy who waited on me the last time I was there was high.  The interminable waiting for refills on drinks and the check drove my blood pressure through the roof.

I've determined that the secret to getting good service from anyone here is to be a hot looking college girl...  that seemed to keep the waiter's attention focused on the table next to mine...  Maybe she was one of the more positive posters here.

Such a fun spot!  The service is always wonderful, absolutely wonderful!  I am a bit of a health nut but my father absolutely loves it at Monty's and they are always able to accommodate my silly veggie demands.  Love you, Monty's!  Keep being the nicest guys in town :)

I came here for the first time for a friend's casual birthday dinner, and I was pleasantly surprised. Their food is tasty, but not too greasy or heavy. There is definitely the typical diner vibe, which I liked. The serving sizes are generous, and the flavors are there.
One of my favorite places in Madison. You can never go wrong with an artichoke sand which and some crisscuts (they are worth the extra money).
Great diner--breakfast, pie, milkshakes?! Always a good experience. I recommend getting the breakfast burrito it is delicious.

Such a fun place to get an interesting plate of great food.  The neighborhood is awesome and you can see it in their customers.  Great selection of pies,  and will take suggestions on what to offer.  Love their raspberry cream pie! May seem hipster but this is the real deal.

Came in for brunch today and had a very nice experience.  I really like their décor, classic diner style.  I got the Meatloaf and oh my goodness it was so AMAZING! The homemade gravy was to die for!  My friend got the Egg Mornay I didn't try it but it looked delicious.  Our server Eric was also amazing! I will definitely be returning soon, for a first time experience I give five stars! 

As a side note as we were walking out every single employee that we passes said, "Thank you, have a great day."

Awesome food, very friendly to vegetarians and omnivores alike.  Service is a bit spotty.  I took my wife and two young kids here while on a short trip to Madison.  Every dish we had (vegetarian hash, chicken breast with salad, mac and cheese for the kids) was superb.

The slice of lemon meringue pie we shared for a dessert was also incredible.

And it's comparatively cheap.

This place would have gotten 5 stars except the service when we went was slower than we would have liked and they somehow gave away our 3 year old's mac and cheese.

Strengths: 
-easy parking
-outdoor patio
-vegetarian-friendly menu
-attentive service and unending coffee refills
-air conditioning
-proximity to bike paths
-lots of comfy booths

Weaknesses: 
-they could only *almost* find the gluten-free menu and weren't sure what was in some of the sauces
-the women's bathroom was about 120 degrees and stuffy
-desert options looked non-existent for the gluten-free crowd, though I didn't look very closely

It was still a fun place to have brunch with a friend, even if I ended up drinking way too much coffee.  I had an omelette and it was fairly standard.  Apparently people say it's overpriced for Madison, though since I live in San Francisco, I'm not really one to say.  

I would have happily given another point if only the staff could have found the gluten-free menu.
My dad and I both had the Heathen Vegan Shoplifters Delight. Basically portobello mushrooms, tempeh, and avocado. Amazing. Great section of vegan and non vegan options. Loved it.

Fabulous, just fabulous. Service is spectacular and food is beyond amazing. The wait was awhile, maybe half an hour or so but totally worth it. The breakfast burrito, salmon hash and potato and zucchini pancakes are delectable.

Since I moved out of the area, I miss a lot about Madison.  One of the things I really miss is Monty's.  I made a point to bring several friends here and their assessment of this diner-gone-upscale was good as well.  The food is diner classics with an updated touch as well as a few things that are probably best described as new American.  The food is excellent, especially the numerous vegan and vegetarian options.  The ambiance is clean and bright; the service good.  The only downsides are that the wait can be long, especially on weekend mornings, and parking is limited.

I like this place because they have so many vegetarian options. I loved the vege BLT with strips of tempeh yummy :) I love the atmosphere of the place as well. I do think their prices are kind of high, but the food hits the spot!

I have no idea what kind of Michelin 4-star restaurant some of these reviewers are used to, but their poor ratings of this Madison staple are not to be taken seriously. 

Coming from someone who's worked professionally in the food industry for the better part of the past decade, in bars, cafes, diners, organic kitchens, and hotels, this diner-style family eatery will always remain one of my absolute favorite places to go, for any meal of the day. This, more than any other restaurant in Madison, is what I missed when we moved away. 

Let's review:
1. One of the most creative, delicious, varied, and comprehensive vegetarian and vegan menus I've ever seen, especially for a place that specializes in heartwarming diner-style dishes. I'm a dedicated omnivore, and my favorite things to order off the menu were the Heathen Vegan Shoplifter's Delight, and the Zucchini Potato Pancakes (both vegan).
2. The person who complained about the terrible service...I have no idea what she was talking about. In the 4 years I lived in Madison, I ate there on an average of once a month, and my servers were always friendly, responsive, and as prompt as could be expected during varied levels of busy-ness. 
3. The cook regularly comes out to chit-chat and joke with the customers. It's always a treat. :)
4. They work hard to support local farmers, with dedicated local and organic specials featuring produce, meats and dairy from area growers. 
5. Their homemade biscuits are to DIE for.
6. Try the pies. And the cakes. Do it. If you can't eat another bite, take a slice home. I promise, you won't regret it!

I've never had a disappointing meal there. I miss it like a long-lost lover.
Always a solid choice. Well made food, family atmosphere, but the menu really doesn't change.

Another one of my weekend staples. Monty's is the best diner in Madison--mainly because of their great vegetarian selection (they have a whole vegetarian SECTION...a relieving site for hungry vegetarian eyes.) My carnivorous friend are big fans of Monty's as well, so it's not for vegetarians only. I like their overall ambiance and their waitstaff is good if not great. The deserts are a MUST. Their shakes are really something to drool over, and their pies and cakes are delicious as well. Oh, and scrumptious breakfasts!
Been going to Monty's for years! Recommend asking about the day's "scramble something or other" for breakfast! Exceptional diner! Fun!

Went for lunch about a month ago and was expecting a good meal, but I was mistaken.  My burger was dry and way overcooked and the waffle fries (which I payed extra for) were soggy and greasy.  May give them another chance to redeem themselves.

I ordered the Vegetarian Hash with tofu scramble (vegan). Came with a side of toast and vegan butter. Food was delicious and service was excellent. Very impressed with the number of vegan items on the menu- especially for breakfast/brunch items. I will absolutely be back to try other items.

Monty's is basically a shiny Denny's in the heart of Madison's Atwood neighborhood.  On the plus side, you won't leave the diner with an empty stomach. 

The portions are generous, potatoes seasoned just right and the servers keep your coffee fresh.  It's not worth waiting more than 30 minutes to sit, but smaller parties of 2 to 3 can get in relatively fast.  Decent menu selection and the pies look good by the counter...but saving room for pie is a challenge.

One of my favorite restaurants ever! 
I love the diner atmosphere & I've never ordered something I didn't like. I love how many vegetarian & vegan options there are- including the desserts!! 
The pie is outstanding...half of the time I come to Monty's it's just for pie.

We love this place! The food is great. The biscuits which I love the most is the best! I love the coffee. I come here once a week with my in laws and two sons. This is our spot in Madison for comfort food. It's just family friendly and the prices are great. Who doesn't like a hot cup of coffee and comfort food :) Yummo to this place!

I've been in Madison for 10 days or so and I've made this observation: Madison residents are spoiled rotten! ROTTEN! There is nothing like Monty's back home in Boston. I dare all you haters visit its counterpart in Boston, the South Street Diner. Have a meal there and report back to me. I will have a hankie ready to wipe away your tears of disappointment. 

At Monty's today, I accidentally dumped sugar all over my french fries. Even though I'm clearly a stupid klutz, they gave me new fries anyway. My chocolate malt was perfect. Once I slurped it all up, I felt a little sad...and then I discovered there was ANOTHER malt waiting for me and I felt like a winner!

And believe it or not, I'm a connoisseur of vegetarian reubens. I've tried them all over the country in CA, RI, MA, CT, NY and Monty's in the best I've ever had.
Funky 50's vibe... Staff was excellent and educated on ingredients and choices. Really the some of the best food I've had in Madison at a veryy reasonable price.

This place has classic American diner written all over it.  I have yet to have even a subpar experience at this place.

"So, tell me abou the food" you ask.  I've been to Monty's for breakfast, and lunch and have had a consistently great meal every time.  The breakfast menu offers up your standards.  Heaping portions of eggs and bacon accompany a decent cup of coffee early in the morning.  

Their sandwiches are delicious and massive.  The burgers offer a unique collection of flavorings and are made with beef sourced from Black Earth Farms... a big plus from any foodie in the city.  Definitely break the bank and opt in for the waffle fries... and by break the bank I mean scrounge your pockets for the extra quarter the cost.  They are YUMMMMMY

The only knock I have on this place is the overall vibe.  The staff always goes above and beyond what I would expect, but the whole 50s diner scene never really held a special place in my heart.  Even with saying that, I'll definitely be back many, many times.

Monty's, Monty's......I love you Monty's. I love your grilled chicken salad. I love all your sandwiches. I love the coffee and fountain drinks. I get frustrated when the wait is long....and I'm sorry..the pies are beautiful and the fillings are delicious, but the pie crusts are NOT flaky. You can't have a pie without a flaky crust. It aint fitting! I wish you would open up a Monty's in Fitchburg! I love you Monty's!

Holy Delicious!!!!!!!!
My omelette and my husband's pancakes were DELICIOUS.  My mom said the same thing about her egg sandwich.  I didn't even see what my stepdad ordered, it disappeared so quickly, so I'm guessing he liked that, too.  
Our server was sweet and quick.  She overheard my husband say it was my birthday and she told me I get a dessert for free!  I got this frickin AMAZING tin roof pie to take home, which I inhaled later that evening.  IT WAS SO GOOD WITH THE LITTLE MARSHMALLOWS OMG.  
Only complaint, and I'm really trying to find something to gripe about here, is that the high chair for my baby could have been cleaner, and some of the other diners...... the senior citizen crowd....... seemed very crabby which was slightly annoying.  
Staff here is great!  Food is the BEST!!!!!!

Monty's is AMAZING. I've lived in Madison most of my life and only just discovered them. Breakfast all day, and an EXCELLENT staff! Very polite, prompt, and friendly. The breakfast potatoes and biscuits are the best breakfast food I've ever had in Madison!

Try going there and NOT getting a piece of pie. It's hard.

They know what they are doing, and there is a reason that their pies are the first and last thing you see when you visit.

Have to add my voice to the chorus of MBP lovers.  I somehow missed this place in the many times I've been to Madison until a few years ago.

Great food, lots of vegetarian and vegan options.  They have breakfast all day and quite a few hot veggie sandwiches.   I finished my meal with banana cream pie, but they have vegan fruit pies and ice cream treats.

Food Fight has another faux classic diner, but at least it's a style they know how to do right. The white and blue booths are a treat to the eyes and the wide variety in the menu is a delight to the stomach.

As usual, I focus most on breakfast. They have comparable goodies to the Westside's Hubbard Ave, which does me well. I will have some of my favorite meals no matter which side of town I live on. Like most places, service is rough during the rush hours. Either come real early or real late.

And pies. Get some pies. Any style apple will be great.

I've been going here for years and intend to go for many years into the future. The menu has plenty of vegetarian and vegan options, all well prepared. Staff is always enthusiastic and coffee is abundant. I have omelets a couple times a week -- the Blue Plate with tofu substitue -- and on Saturday either the grilled spinach salad, the vegetarian 'meatloaf' or the goat cheese crepe.
So nice to see so many veg & vegan choices. But really- way way too much turmeric in the tofu scramble! Say it with me: nutritional yeast! Use it! Also great biscuits by the way. :)

In going with a common theme I have found in these type of diner establishments, I ordered a Fat Elvis Shake with Bacon (of course! also contains peanut butter, bananas, and chocolate) along with a country breakfast, eggs over easy and some gravy for the biscuit.

I wish I got a bit more adventurous with the main dish as it was a simple straight forward affair, just as described, and I'm not a big breakfast guy. But as I was going here for the first time, I wanted to go classic. The shake was good as well.

I can see see why this place is popular, as it has solid home cooking and the classic cozy atmosphere.

Excellent food! I had the chicken in a pie that was amazing! The crust was flaky and light. I also had a strawberry shake. It was all homemade food from local growers. I would highly recommend this place. The prices are a little high but the food and atmosphere was great.

Eh. This place is "fine". I'm not terribly impressed with it. I could probably get better breakfast somewhere else. Plus its ALWAYS so so so busy in there. I like that they have a ton of vegetarian options. Which is rare for breakfast places. But meh. Its not amazing food.

Breakfast is their best offering here. Burgers are also good, but I was disappointed in the lack of chicken on my sandwich. We had to wait for a table at 7:30pm. Shows their business is good but I was surprised at the late dinner rush. Other people waiting for a table stole it before the waitress got their tip. Not the restaurant's fault but disappointed in the guests.

Really cool & interesting veggie options, cool atmosphere, nice area, what more could you ask for? They even have a giant selection of pies! Voted best veggie restaurant in madison, but half of the menu or more isnt veggie, so everyone will be happy. Check it out.

In my opinion, almost all restaurants in the Madison area are bland. People may hate me for thinking it, but I don't care. There's no spice, little flavor, and it's gotten to the point where I just don't really go out, because I'm sick of wasting my money on mediocre food.

It got to the point where I thought my tastebuds were dying.

Enter Monty's Blue Plate. I had the meatless loaf sammich, and it was awesome, though it tasted nothing like meatloaf. The waffle fries? delicious. The dipping sauce? Don't even think of stealing a dip. I will bite you.

There was so much I wanted. I will be back, perhaps tomorrow. I will find excuses to wander to the east side, then say "While I'm here, I might as well hit Monty's".

All-in-all, Monty's is making my life better. Thank you Monty's.

After seeing old friends at the last Latin Night at The Cardinal (http://www.yelp.com/biz/cardinal-bar-madison#hrid:KfYiEWXAc-SlP_qEiUO6Hw) we agreed to meet here for breakfast on Monday morning.

Well, not all of us made it but good times were had while eating.  This is the closest to a 'real' diner that Madison has that I've been to but they have some truly kick ass pieces of fat French Toast.

I had bacon & eggs, french toast w/ coffe & cream and my daughter had the Blue Plate Omelette w/ home fries and orange juice.

Good place to come with a group of old friends or your kids (if they know how to act right in public...)
I love this place because besides their really good menu, they are local and use local food. People is friendly and their desserts OMG!!

Lunch on a Saturday afternoon, with 2 small kids? No problem. Monty's provided chalk outside for use while you waited (15 min was quoted, actual wait time was...well...who pays attention to the clock when you're busy chalking?). 

Kids menus and cups were also provided, and the waiter didn't bat an eye at the mess the kids made. 

The menu is varied - breakfast, entrees, sammiches - but steps outside of the 'normal' fare to throw a few curveballs. My spinach/feta burger tasted fresh and not mass-produced. 

Only downside is that the place is loud - but then, that turns into a positive when you're with a hungry 11month old. :)

This is my absolute favorite restaurant and anytime I come home for a visit I have to stop by to have some Meatless Loaf of the God's or a Gobbler!

Top it all off with a Cup of Mud or an off the hook slice of pie or cake and you have one amazing meal that can only be found in Mad-town.

A diner with Food Fight style and warm service is my go-to for breakfast all day. Beloved: corned beef hash, TNT BLT, waffle fries. A year and a half of regular visits has revealed the staff to be consistently friendly and efficient, food quality to be consistently high and prices to be reasonable.  Monty's is worth the occasional short wait for a table.

Monty's is one of my fave brunch-or-lunch places, especially on lazy weekends when I want breakfast food at 2pm but do not want big-chain food.  They have a wide array of something for everyone from vegan offerings to biscuits and gravy to slices of cake taller than your head, and it's all tasty.  

It does get really crowded at peak times, and the service can be hit-or-miss to an extreme:  sometimes I've gotten a server who hangs around making hilarious jokes and sometimes I've been in parties that were actually forgotten about after we were seated and then have the orders wrong when we finally did get our food (although the bad service is definitely more rare than the good).  

All-in-all the tasty food and the kitschy atmosphere make it worth the wait.

Amazing local and organic selection, with a greasy diner feel. Reasonably priced, kid friendly, but like all unique places, expect it to be fairly busy. It is worth the wait, especially if you are GF, vegan, or vegetarian. Not into that food? No worries, they have something for the traditional diners.
Breakfast heaven. Grab the French Toast and a side of hash browns.

Food, decent.   Service, eh.

We were on the way back from Chicago and decided to eat in Madison.  I found Monty's online so we checked it out.

The neighborhood couldn't be cuter.  It was noonish on a Sunday, so it was busy.  We waited a short time for our table.  I liked how the person cleaning the table also put the silverware and water down.  It helps turn the tables over quicker and it satisfies those of us waiting.  But don't drink it all right away, you might not get more.

I wanted the egg sandwich, but I also wanted lunch, so I decided on the Roast Chicken, bacon (none for me thanks) and goat cheese sandwich with bean salad.  Dining companion had the Turkey Club with bean salad.

Food arrived pretty quick and my sandwich was excellent!  The bread was toasted perfectly and the chicken was not at all dry and the smear of goat cheese was great.  My dining companion liked his sandwich was well.   The bean salad could double as a chip dip, in fact I have a recipe just like it that I will now be serving as salad.

What wasn't great was the service.  The food got dropped off and she never came back.  She was going to bring me more water, but we had with our glasses empty the WHOLE time we were eating.  We never saw her again.  We took out our credit card so if she did swing by she could take it and we could go.  If it weren't for the service we receive I would consider going back.

I have only been here a few times. Service is pretty good but my big problem is the shakes. First time I got a shake it was really thick and almost worth the 6 bucks. I looked forward to having another some day. Last Friday I went there for another shake and it was really thin. Like chocolate milk! Maybe when teenagers are making milk shakes for minimum wage you get varied results. $6 is way too much for a watery shake. Get it together people.

Monty's used to be one of my favorite places on the near-east side.   I've long loved their Meatloaf of the Gods, fat and calories be damned.  However, our last 5-6 experiences have been exercises in frustration, with such charming features as a $100 overcharge on my debit card for a $23 meal.  (yes, you read that right).  Yes, the server was new, yes they corrected it, but still.

We ate there again last night- I'm a firm believer in the power of the 19th chance-, only to leave with a renewed resolve that there are many better options available.

Stopped here on the way to Madison Art Fair for breakfast as it's been on my radar screen for a while. I guess for me I just don't think it's a 4 star place.

I had the "Saturday Special", biscuits and gravy. The biscuit was really quite good, but when you have biscuits and gravy, that should be the star of the show. It was off to the side of the plate kinda pushed off. While the gravy was good, there wasn't even enough to cover the biscuits. There should be enough to mix with the potatoes even. Made for a rather dry dish all in all.

Potatoes.. the flavor was decent, a bit spicy which I like, but really kinda of undercooked. They should have been crispy, but they were soft.. not crispy at all

Good flavors, but poorly executed. Maybe I just hit them on a bad day, but for me, it was three star at best. I may try again next time I'm in town...

What a cute little place.  Doesn't seem like the smoothest run location.  The food we were served was good and served as requested....they serve breakfast all day, which is really nice.  I thought the food was well priced and the service was efficient.

So, it's not like this place was ever gonna make it outta my e-gutter, cuz there's nothing really redeeming about it. You know, sometimes a craving makes one act desperately... sometimes against one's better knowledge. Nevertheless, I make my way to Monty's one fine day, craving some sort of ice-cream based treat, similar to a beverage, but of a thicker consistency. Nothing special, just some plain old ice cream and say, caramel. It was $6.38?! Okay, so I go into a Vincent Vega state of mind, zoning out while the shake's bein' made thinking to myself "Did I just order a six-dollars n' 38 cent shake? Sure did. A shake? Milk, ice cream, caramel? Uh-huh. Six-dollars n' 38 cents? Yep. They don't put bourbon in it or anything? Nope. Just checking... smh... Whoa, WHAT?! When it came up, it was in a small, flimsy styro cup, with a sad lil' wafer sticking out the top. Wait... did they just charge me like that much for this??? Ugh! I was so pissed, I told em' keep it, n' got my money back. I can get Culver's or Michael's for like, way better... Even the Chocolate Shoppe, or like, buy your own pint and a gallon of milk, stir in some Smucker's flavoring and have change to spare... I don't even know why people like this place. Dude, seriously...

great vegetarian fare. my meat-eating friends tell me the meat options are okay, nothing to write home about. but, as a recent transplant from the south, and as a vegetarian, i cannot get enough of their meatless loaf of the gods. and the seitan vegetarian BBQ is fantastic. love it.

so, if you want a good meaty burger or fish or something else that once had a face, you should probably eat somewhere else. if you're a vegetarian, though, this place should make you happy.

Monty's is one of the many mind-boggling Food Fight restaurants that is a Madison favorite despite serving mediocre food. 

I've eaten one good dish here: the TNT BLT (tempeh and tomato). And the chocolate shake is good if you need to consume an extraordinary number of calories on any given day.

The last time I went, I did so because a friend told me the restaurant is attempting to make a switch to more sustainability-conscious, organic food. I ordered chili that was pretty much inedible. On another night, my boyfriend ordered a soup that was, again, inedible. 

I can imagine that people like to come here because the restaurant resembles an old-school diner and has booths, which are fun for kids to sit in. But the food quality is generally average to poor. The brunch I've had is tasteless and limited, and you are not getting fresh eggs unless you order them over easy. 

The only reason I give Monty's two stars is because its pies are great. And once in a while, I can stomach a TNT BLT because someone I'm with persuades me to give Monty's one . . . more . . . try.
I love the food here. I am a vegan and there are many options :) I can drop in any day to eat here :) Keep up the good work guys.

It is absolutely what you want it to be. It embodies the era of diners so well. The food was delicious. I have had the Grilled Cheese and the Mac and Cheese (I added bacon, yum!) both were wonderful. The milkshakes and malts are amazing as well. It can definitely get loud and sometimes there's a wait, but either way it is definitely worth it for this Madison gem.

Guys I did not want to leave this place.
Usually I can decide what to order relatively quickly. As a psecatarian, I don't have a lot of choices and I pretty much know what I like. This place, though. I could have ordered 10 different things and been equally happy I'm sure. I had to close the menu and stop thinking about it or I would have never been able to get out of there. As it was we ended up with way too much delicious food - wish was a shame because I wanted some pie and ice cream so badly when I first got there. 
Really, I'm going to have to come back and plan better. I also want to come for breakfast (our meal tonight was dinner) so I can try their coffee and sit at the counter.
What a friendly place, don't leave Madison without at least once visit here.

Nice atmosphere and fantastic food!  And I love their gluten free options.  They made things as we ordered them and the service was prompt and friendly.  This is a really nice "diner" with nice decor and a very friendly atmosphere.  The line was very long on Sunday morning but that's the sign of anything good because everyone wanted to eat there.  Nom nom, we'll be back! :)

Monty's has started to bake their own doughnuts and they are without a doubt the best doughnuts in Madison.  One day they had a cake doughnut with oreo crumbles and icing and it gave me flashbacks to Voodoo Doughnuts in Portland, OR.  If I had a higher metabolism I'd stop and pick up a couple of doughnuts every day before work.  I can't do that but I do enjoy one once or twice a week.  Caveat emptor, these things are addicting. I only hope they broaden the variety of flavors.

Not great but not bad. On the healthful side, I had a Mediterranean platter that was quite tasty. It had hummus, quinoa salad and pita with cucumber salad. I enjoyed the fact that while this is something of an old-fashioned diner, my choices were not restricted to burgers and shakes. Although they do have shakes. Good looking ones at that, made with Sassy Cow ice cream. I opted for blueberry pie and was very disappointed. The blueberries were of the frozen variety and sour. There was nothing to hold them together, so they fell out of the flavorless crust individually. I was glad I asked for it a la mode, because the ice cream was the only thing that saved it. I had been really excited by the variety of pies and cakes at the counter but either they are not homemade or they are made by people who don't like to bake. Either way, I would not order pie here again. But I would come back for breakfast all day or some of the other menu items. Fun ambiance, particularly for kids (I was with one who thoroughly enjoyed his Mickey Mouse pancakes!)...Oh, and they have booze.
I like coming here often, it is easy because you know what they have each time. The dinner entrees are always hearty and the shakes are good :)

It's always fun to take people to Monty's. The parking lot is a good indicator of how busy the place will be. Be aware, though, that the booths have very little tummy room, especially for those of us who aren't so svelte. If you fall into that category, try to get a table on the left side of the restaurant. Your ego will thank me later. :-)

WOW! Monty's is now my go to place for catering! They catered an incredible, fresh & tasty lunch for 40 folks Downtown at the State Capital and everything was just as I hoped it would be. Working with Valree was a total pleasure! Great attention to detail and even with last minute changes everything was perfect. All of the sandwiches were fantastic! My fave was the BLT with guacamole! Guests were raving about the slow roasted turkey clubs and the flavor the falafel wraps had. The hummus was amazing along with how it was presented with fresh veggies and olives. The Everyday salad was fresh and had tons of beautiful avocados and tomatoes to enjoy! The large sugar cookies were perfect to finish with and a bonus that they had our company logo on them! I've always loved eating in the diner and I'm so glad that I reached out to have them help me with an off-site event. Valree and her team made the planning easy and really delivered, literally, an incredible lunch!

Monty's is a great diner-esque restaurant. I couldn't even imagine counting all the times I've been here in all my years in Madison. Hungover, bright eyed and bushy tailed, ready for bed, and otherwise. Want breakfast? Go to Monty's. Lunch? Monty's. Dinner? You guessed it, Monty's. 

The food is consistently good. The cook will often come out to the tables and joke with the customers which is pretty refreshing. If you're looking for weekend breakfast, there may be a line, but at least you can sip coffee while you wait. Good coffee, at that!

Monty's will always hold a special place in my heart. 

Oh! And lots of vegetarian options, also.

I've never been to Monty's Blue Plate Diner and not seen it full of people, so prepare yourself. We waited for about half an hour for a table and then sat down and our waitress was extremely friendly and attentive to our needs.

I had the zucchini and potato pancakes served up with some applesauce and sour cream, a truly great hangover remedy! I would have liked my pancakes to be a crispier because they kind of melded together and the applesauce was overpoweringly sweet.

The real winner for me was the banana cream pie; although it's $5 for a slice, it's a pretty yummy slice and I was glad that the portion wasn't huge. The banana cream wasn't too sweet the crust was flaky, and it capped off a good meal. 

I saw they had some pretty extensive vegan options, so this is a great place to swing by if vegan food is your jam!

My old supervisor took me and my ex-fiance' here shortly after I started working for her. It was really good diner food, and was very easy on the pocket book. I haven't been back since, but I wouldn't hesitate to stop by if I was in the area and craved diner fare :)

Zucchini potato pancakes with Apple cranberry compote were Delish. Good coffee. Friendly, attentive staff indoors.chicken in a pie was good as well, but could be better if the crust were more pronounced as a flavor. Mashed potatoes were great and abundant. Rosemary.

We had a wonderful breakfast here but the most wonderful thing was that the manager sang for us... We loved it--- the place brought back all the warm fuzzy feelings that we get for Madison and Wisconsin and we were here with our son and girlfriend and had a great time...

I recently visited Madison and went to Monty's.  Monty's is honestly such a great diner.  I especially love their chicken pot pie...very filling and so, so good.  The turkey soup is really yummy as well.  And the pies...absolutely amazing!!  

I really like the feel of the restaurant.  It's a great a place to go to and meet up with friends for sure.  Great service as well!  (Leslie is an awesome server:-)

Overall, a great diner all around.  Highly suggest (especially the desserts!)

Can't do animals, can't do dairy, yet am a food warrior. Indeed, Madison abounds with options for a gal like me, but Monty's marks my favorite eatery in the city. Intentionally old-school in its decor and prices, it's a throwback that appeals to anyone with a frontal cortex. 
My waitress brought me a gratis cup of the home-made veg soup as I was sitting at the end of the counter an she hadn't seen me for a few minutes (aaaaand the tip started to go up).  I had the meatless meatloaf thing also mentioned here, and good LORD the portion size was outta control. The roll was the size of a Yorkshire pudding and the mashed potatoes were actually made of potato, fancy that. The meatless loaf itself was solidly good (shredded root veg with a cheesy binder - wish I had known that prior to ordering, but should've asked) but a bit oily and the cashew gravy was goooood. So many great-looking options for veg-heads like myself, hallelujah a-MEN, and they even have a small wine list and beer. 
I couldn't get through the entire pile of food, despite being a hormonal food warrior that day, yet I craved a sweet and Monty's has soy ice cream. WTF, OTHER DINERS? I nearly wept at this one. I had the mint chip, 2 scoops, which again were more like two grapefruit spilling over the sides of the bowl. That, I could do. 
My total bill came to $8. EIGHT. I added a 50% tip and blew Monty's a kiss as I left; I shall RETURN! Waitress was a sweetie, the staff all seemed to be pretty happy, and the place was approaching fullness when I left. 
My fondness for Monty's justifies the caps.

This diner offers an unexpectedly large number of vegetarian options, including a fantastic "Sheldon" sandwich--their veggie analog to the Rueben.  Fresh hot fries would have nudged this rating to five stars.

After searching Yelp for the best diners in Madison we found Montys! Fantastic food and service... if we lived closer we'd definitely be regulars (from CT) 
Thank you for a great meal!!

I really enjoyed this restaurant. I went here a couple nights ago on a mommy/daughter date with my 7 year old. I knew it was across from the Barrymore and I was expecting to have to park a bit away. So I was pleasantly surprised to see that it had a parking lot. It was a beautiful night and we chose to sit outside. Our waitress, Jennifer, was great. She brought out a kids menu and crayons for my daughter right away which kept her busy. My daughter and I went to Monty's because they serve breakfast all day and we wanted breakfast for dinner. I got decaf coffee and the eggs mornay. I had never had mornay sauce before and I found it absolutely delicious! Move over hollandaise! Also, it was the best tasting decaf I can ever remember having. Can't wait to go in the morning sometime when I can get the caffeinated coffee.
My daughter got the Mickey Mouse pancake and she loved it. It was a great price and came with juice and I was thankful they put a lid on it! It drives me crazy when I go places and they give little kids adult glasses filled to the brim. It's just an accident waiting to happen. So the lid gets a thumbs up! Also, REAL maple syrup. It's all we use at home and my daughter turns her nose up at imposter syrup so that was also a big plus.
I can't wait to go again. Truly, that neighborhood has to be my favorite area of Madison so I know I'll be back soon.
Almost forgot, a great bakery too! Took home some delicious pie. I loved the Mississippi mud. Chocolate overload! Mmmm!

Had to come to the Capitol of Cheeseland to take care of a little bizwax with my Mum. Wife-unit assisted her with the affairs at hand, while I researched YELP to find out where we were going to eat. Monty's was close and looked well-reviewed.
Find every 5 star review here about this place and believe them.
Incredible food, great service. I'd give this place 10 stars if I could. 
Go eat here NOW!

My husband and I love Monty's! It is one of our favorite go-to dinner spots in Madison. The atmosphere is very fun and though it's usually busy we don't usually have to wait too long to eat. Also, as a gluten-free eater they have a good selection of options, specifically because they have gluten free bread that can be used to modify almost any sandwich. The diner atmosphere is really fun, and their milkshakes are delicious!
Best biscuits and gravy in town. Meatloaf? Meatloaf of the Gods! Haven't tried the meat(less)loaf of the Gods. Bakery? Delicious! Always great service.
Yummmmm is all I can say. Diner breakfast turned up a notch. Arrive early or you'll be waiting for your food.

I love the vegetarian Rueben and stuffed myself with the potato pie, but I haven't been thrilled with my breakfast experiences here.  I had the Scrambled Something or Other on the day that it happened to have asparagus in it.  I never did find any asparagus, but the eggs turned a horrendous shade of gray.  The potatoes were hardly cooked all the way through, but at least the biscuit was good.  I'm convinced the Mornay sauce is sausage gravy - I used to live in France and never had Mornay sauce like the stuff at Monty's!  Still - I give the place props for having so many vegetarian options.  It's fun to go out and have more to choose from than an iceberg lettuce salad or grilled cheese.

ah Sunday brunch back in Madison. I was really excited to try this place but I think I got slightly disappointed. First of all, not enough parking! Probably a total of 16 stalls in the tiny one way parking lot.. so do plan on car pooling here. I circled around the street 2 times before finding a parking space on the side street about 3 blocks away. It might just be Sunday though.. who knows. I do think the building and decor is kinda cool.. felt like a good old diner with a retro kick. so here comes the food part.. I ordered corn beef hash.. food was lukewarm. I usually like my hot food hot.. not like somewhere between hot and cold. It was greasy too. not a fan. I did like the side fruits that came with it..def gave my greasy hash a little break. I think I would come try their dessert next time. The pie and bakery goods look more yummy.. until next time. Oh btw our waiter was really friendly and unobtrusive so if you are the type of person into good table service.

I live down the road from Monty's and it's being in walking distance helps give it a half a star. I also tend to go at off-peak times which I think has helped me have a better experience (mid mornings on the weekends can get very crowded and you'll have a wait). I've tried many things here and have never had anything bad. Some things though were just meh. I really enjoyed their french toast. It was big and fluffy on the inside and cooked just right on the outside. Their omelets and other egg dishes I've tried were pretty standard. The serving sizes are pretty big. I'm not a veg, but I appreciate that they had several options available for those who are. Overall I think it's a fun place to take friends who are visiting from out of town before heading down to the farmer's market early on a Saturday morning.

Yummy, yummy, yummy!  Has always been one of my favorite diners in Mad-town.  Delicious veggie chili, spicy cornbread, malts and desserts, as well as the amazing array of other veggie options.  Just yesterday, I tried the new Spinoccoli Quiche with fruit, which was pretty darn good...coffee is always hot and refills frequent.  Still have yet to try the famous zucchini pancakes, but next time, I must.  I must also remember to save room for dessert!  Look forward to returning sooner than later to try some of the other new lunch options on the menu.  Only downer is the wait/lack of parking on a busy day.  Overall, two thumbs up from me, Monty.

Excellent food.  The biscuits are amazing, the fruit fresh and ripe, and I had the best piece of French silk pie I've ever had at this place.  I've only ordered breakfast, but they do have an expansive menu that includes a nice selection of foods (including vegan).  

The atmosphere is probably what stops me from going there more---it's just not my cup of tea.  The lighting is harsh and the seats can be kinda uncomfortable.  Last time I went, I was freezing!

But don't let that stop you.  There's an amazing bakery display case in the front that is worth a stop alone.

I've eaten at the Blue Plate so many times I can't count, even with my shoes off. Ok, I'll give it a try - I've eaten here about 65 times, give or take. From all of those experiences, I can remember possibly 4 or 5 of them being less than perfectly pleasant. Granted, one must make sure to manage their expectations when walking into Monty's. The wait can be up to a half hour most nights (no reservations accepted), and weekend brunches can find you standing in cue for over an hour, easily. 
With those caveats in mind, one should know this: there is nothing at Monty's that isn't homemade. Everything is fresh and, if not delicious then, supremely passable. 
Soups rotate daily and have never let me down (though I wouldn't dare order fish chowder on a Monday lunch break). Specials are always, well, special. While most dinners are content to pass off a standard entree as a special so long as it's adorned with added bacon or served on a different style of bread, Monty's really goes all out with their daily's. 
Prices are a little high, but not outrageous. As a general rule prepare to pay $1-2 more than you would expect for almost every sandwich or entree. 
Amazing options are the chicken pot pie, meatloaf (seriously), Reuben, Feta-Dill Burger, spicy chicken sandwich, and literally any cold entree salad. 
Everything else is merely good to great. 
Also, I've found that it's a great place to bring kids. Just try to avoid the supremely busy times of the week, it's loud enough in there without little Kailyenne (God, kids names suck these days....amirite??) throwing a tantrum. Although, should young Owlivêr throw a fork at a server, busser, or host, it would be deflected by the force field that is the hardest working and most amazingly kind service staff in the city. 
Seriously, the people here are rock stars. I hear they can even endure the occasional 47 year-old, hyper-entitled, west-side residing, trust funded man child from hell. (Food Fight already gave you people Hubbard Ave. Dinner and Bluephies, please mind the gap and maybe they'll throw a new, soulless, place your way soon enough. It will likely come pre-soaked in hand sanitizer.)

What a great place for brunch, not to mention filling!

I've only been there once, but had to try it because I kept getting so many recommendations. I had the chicken salad sandwich, not to saucy or creamy, and fresh. It had chopped chicken and salad on a ciabatta roll. it had a great flavor. I also switched out the fries for the house potatoes, which were also very good!

My boyfriend decided to go with breakfast and had the Huevos Rancheros, he loved it and said he would definitely get it again. He's a picky eater so if he says something like that I trust that the food is good. 

I also ordered one of their specialty milk shakes with coffee in it. What an amazing drink!!! 

I would definitely go back over and over again! And I'll wait with no problem because that usually means that the food is worth it...

I have been hearing about Monty's Blue Plate Diner ever since I moved to Madison because some of my co-workers absolutely LOVE this place.  It took me almost 5 months to get here which is kind of unfortunate, because it is GREAT!

The first thing I was told about Monty's was that it is like an upscale diner that serves vegan and vegetarian food.  This is kind of true, because it is a diner, it is nice inside and not super divey and you can order lots of dishes as vegan, vegetarian, or gluten-free.  However, I would definitely not describe Monty's as a vegan/vegetarian restaurant because half of the items contain eggs or bacon, as any good diner should.

The first time I went I ordered blueberry pancakes, the short stack, and a simple glass or orange juice.  I passed on the free bottomless cup of coffee that you get when you check in because I had already had my coffee for the day.  The pancakes were good, nothing fancy, but solid.  Two was plenty for me as they were a large-ish size.

Second time I ordered the Monty's breakfast sandwich which had bacon, avocado, fried egg, herbed goat cheese, and something leafy I think on cheddar jalepeno bread.  It was served with their American potatoes which remind me of the potatoes I got at Grampas brunch.  The sandwich was tasty, though I was disappointed a little by the bread as it didn't have much jalepeno or cheddar flavor and mostly tasted like toasted white bread.

Third visit I went with the Blue Plate Special Omelet that had bacon, avocado, and cheddar inside with salsa on top served with American potatoes and a biscuit.  I also finally got one of their mimosas that are very popular among Saturday brunch goers.  The omelet was really tasty, only needed a little salt and pepper on top and as always, the potatoes were awesome.  I also had an outstanding biscuit, warm, moist, flaky and crumbly at the same time with a nice crust on top.  Nomnomnom.  

Overall Monty's is an excellent choice with solid diner food, friendly service and fairly reasonable prices.  Perfect for people that have different dietary choices as there is seemingly something for everyone!

I didn't think the food was anything too above average, but the service was really great. The server helped us understand the menu and made it very clear what was vegan or not. I had the almond French toast which tasted good, but was pretty small and left me wanting more. My partner had the tofu scramble and it wasn't anything I couldn't make at home, but still good. However, they do offer vegan shakes which is so hard to find and that is my favorite thing about Monty's.

Monty's is our absolute GO TO. First of all, the staff are attentive, friendly, and accommodating. The food is well priced and always comes out quickly. Oh, and by the way, it's delicious!! Every time. It never disappoints. We've only been for breakfast but we cannot wait to try their dinner sometime!

The food is great, but the dining area is unbelievably loud, the indoor seating is cramped and they are incredibly busy. Half the time when I come here, I end up waiting for 20 minutes for a table, giving up, and going across the street to Lao Laan Xang. If you have the time to sit around for half an hour waiting for a table, and don't mind a loud environment, you will at least enjoy some pretty good "elevated diner food".

My local greasy spoon.

I love the milkshakes here.

Breakfast and lunch food has all been good as well. I've never ordered anything to be disappointed.

I tend to go for sandwiches and burgers for lunch, but the chicken chimichurri kabob are out of the world and I have had it at least a half dozen times.

Breakfast wise chilaquiles, any of the omelettes, or the breakfast burrito will treat you right.

Service is good, and the current check in offer of bottomless coffee will get you well caffeinated if you find yourself in need.

Descriptive phrase: quaint, local diner.

Monty's Blue Plate Diner is located in a quiet but neat part of East Madison, not far off Willy Street. It looks like an old gas station (could be), and there was a 25 minute wait for Saturday brunch when we came. There's space to sit outside, or shops nearby to wander to. Inside it's classic diner, through and through. We (4 of us) were seated at a small booth. It was cozy to say the least. 

Katie K. and I split a Chocolate Shake ($6) to start off. It's what you'd expect from the setting, served in a metal tin and absolutely delicious. I as good as chugged mine.

I leaned toward lunch this time around and got the Roast Chicken, Bacon & Goat Cheese sandwich ($9). This dish was just missing a wow-factor (in addition to the Oxford-comma). I love goat cheese, and expected so much with it melted between two pieces of sourdough and chicken, bacon, and tomato. But none of the flavors that should've been present stood out. The salty bacon was lost in the grease of the bread. There may not have been any tomato. The chicken was bland.

I loved the shake, and the sandwich was by no means bad, but there was no warm-feeling deliciousness I expected from a meal in such a diner. I'd return, but get something else.

After posting my 2-star review, I received a message from a manager at Monty's, asking if he could send me some vouchers and if I would be willing to give them another try. I happily did that, and got the vouchers soon after! I have since been back to Monty's twice, once for breakfast and another time for dinner. 

The service has been great both times; prompt and friendly. The food is pretty good, and is definitely a good value. The prices might not be super cheap, but you get a lot of food! I've gotten poached eggs twice since I wrote my more negative review of Monty's, and both times the eggs have been cooked perfectly.

This is my favorite resurant in Madison. I have a two year old son, so friendly fast service is a must and this place delivers everytime. Everything on the menu I've tried is awesome and yummy too. My son gets the mac and cheese and it is so good that I've even ordered it for myself after I tried his. It's not only a family place though, young, old, kids, no kids everyone can enjoy yummy food in a fun relaxed environment. :)

Everything here was okay. The food was okay, the service was pretty good, and um... the atmosphere was okay?

There's nothing particularly compelling here for me to write about. My food was enjoyable, but nothing to write home about. There seemed to be a lot of vegetarian options, but since I'm not vegetarian in the least, that didn't make much difference to me. Again, the service was pretty good and our server was friendly, but overall nothing too exciting.

There was nothing bad about our recent trip to Montys,   Driving home from skiing decided to off the beaten path, tired of bad chain restaurants.   So glad we did.   Started off with Bloody Mary's while we waited for a table.  We had a group of 10 and it was a little cramped while waiting, but drink in hand-so who cares?!   I ordered the burger and fries,  excellent.   Melted cheddar in top.   Hubby ordered the meat loaf stack- he cleaned his plate.  Several of the others ordered Mac and cheese and milk shakes!   I had no idea they were so large,  you may want to consider sharing a milk shake, seriously enormous.   Friendly service,  excellent food!

Disregard the sniffy reviews by food snobs; Monty's is great at being what it is, a nouveau diner with an eclectic menu, welcoming to old and young, hipster and square, LGBT and straight,etc. Great breakfast items (French toast,omelettes, scramblers, pancakes) available around the clock, lots of comfort food veg and non-veg dishes ("meatloaf of the gods" enchiladas, chili, etc.). Everything is freshly prepared with good ingredients. Not to mention the delicious pies and cakes..coffee is meh but that's par for diners. Prices are reasonable, two can be stuffed for $30. Friendly service by the mostly college student/artsy young person staff. If you're looking for a good solid (but not fancy-shmancy) meal on the E. Side of Madison, can't do better than Monty's.

If you have poached eggs on your menu and do not know how to poach an egg do NOT offer it as an option. I got the breakfast item with spinach, mornay sauce ,and poached eggs, only to receive hard boiled eggs. It completely ruined the dish and my want to ever come back. Not to mention that the food is always mediocre. Not happy and not coming back.

There are so many fabulous reviews about this place, I had to check it out for myself. When I walked in, I really liked the look of the diner. It's bright, colorful, and clean. I wasn't sure if I should seat myself or wait to be seated. In many diners, you simply seat yourself, but that's not always the case. Also, there's usually a sign that says "Seat Yourself." I didn't see any signs, so I waited a couple of seconds hoping one of the staff would tell me. They didn't. They didn't even acknowledge that I'd come in. So, I took a seat at the counter. 

There were two members of the wait staff there. Neither acknowledged me. I waited to find out if someone was going to take my order. One woman eventually got around to it. I ordered the meatloaf dinner. It didn't take long to come and it was flavorful. Luke warm, but flavorful. My waitress never checked to see how I was doing (you know the check I mean, the one that comes a few minutes after you're served). She did stop by when I was nearly finished. I told her I was thinking about dessert. She said she'd give me a few minutes. In the meantime, a man sat next to me at the counter, ordered, received his order and was about to get his dessert before she remembered that I wanted to order dessert also. I ordered the peanut butter malt. Best I've ever had!! 

All-in-all my experience was OK. The diner truly is straight out of the 50's. They have an interesting tea pot collection on shelves in the counter area. The menu choices were varied, and my food would have been really good if it had been served hot. A little more attention on the part of the wait staff and this review would have been five-star. Having experienced Monty's once, the next time I'm in Madison, I'll try another diner.

It is about the most vegetarian-friendly diner I've ever known. Some things on the menu are stellar -- like the tofu wrap and the yummy waffle fries -- and others are so-so. Is suppose that, as far as "diner" food goes, it's better than average, but you're not really paying "diner" prices... 

The staff always seems sort of out of it and not thrilled to interact with customers. We regularly wait long stretches to get some attention from our server once we are sat. But the faked-up old diner feels groovy and you always leave painfully full.

Monty's has great food - specifically the meat loaf and the mac and cheese. But the desserts are fantastic. The other night my wife and I wanted something sweet after 9 p.m. and stopped by to pick up twk cupcakes and two pieces of tge German chocolate cake. The price was just $14, and those cake slices were enormous! We ate desserts for days. A piece of cake that big (oh, and it's fantastic) would cost you $14 for one slice anywhere else, and that's without the second piece and the cupcakes. Monty's is not to be missed!

I found my self here for breakfast and it was packed so waiting was going happen if I wanted in. The place is an Art Deco theme from a lost general that you don't see anymore and I liked it.

Waiting must be part of the dining experience because there were tons of out door seating with people waiting to get in. I never even looked at the menu because there is a weekend special of biscuits and gravy.

Service was on the slow side but every seat was in service and the place was busy. I ordered the biscuits and gravy weekend special which came in a timely manner given how busy they were. The plate looked pretty good as you can see in my pictures. While waiting for my food I noticed that they grind the Coffey beans for the fresh Coffey they serve.

The meal was a home made biscuit with fire roasted pepper gravy, two eggs and breakfast potatoes. The eggs were perfect sunny side up. The potatoes were fried and tender but not seasoned so a little salt was needed. I didn't know what to expect of the fire roasted pepper gravy but it worked and it was good. The whole plate was very good and hit the spot.

Over all the breakfast was good and the place is worth the wait for the old school dining experience they offer. I can see why it is so popular with people waiting to get in.
The best! A classic which includes a variety of food options, delicious bakery items, classic décor, and friendly workers. This place has been a favorite since I was a kid!
Great old school diner with some tasty comfort food.

Delicious food and very low prices. The iced coffee and sweet potato frittata that I ordered were on point. My fiancées breakfast burrito was super tasty too. Expect to wait in line on for weekend brunch - this is a popular spot!

Whenever I get the chance to stop over in this great city I always try to swing by Monte's. The service is friendly but don't expect to be looked into every 2 minutes. Which personally I prefer. This has a very local feel and the prices are just right.

I had the Blue Plate special with egg whites. It was wonderful. Not greasy. The artichoke sandwhich is also off of the hook! Very good down home food all the way around and extremely reasonably priced. Especially coming from the West Coast.

The other added bonus is Monte's is located in the Willy Street area...the more eclectic part of "downtown".

Having heard only good things, I had pretty high expectations for Monty's but I felt let down by the service and really let down by the food. The meals ordered, chicken in a pie and salmon cakes were both luke-warm and tasted like they had lived under a warming lamp for quite some time. This place it not worth the reputation.

We ate dinner there today and we loved everything about it.  The food was *delicious* (my husband had the broiled cod entree and I had the roasted spinach salad.  His came with seasoned home fries & steamed broccoli and mine included eggplant, quinoa & mozzarella cheese.  The vinaigrette dressing was particularly good, too).  The prices were *very* reasonable, the portions were generous, our server was super-friendly, the manager was very pleasant (I complimented him afterwards), we liked the interior and the restrooms were very clean.  A great experience in every way!

I have been in Madison for three weeks, and have been looking for a place like this. The food is amazing, and the prices are low. I had an amazing goat cheese ravioli with a creamy pesto sauce evening special. It was probably the best meal I've had in Madison. I am sorely disappointed that I'll be heading home for good on Thursday.

Stopped in this morning for breakfast and pie. They make great corned beef hash and home fries. The meat is hand cut from locally sourced beef, and all the ingredients are fresh and tasty. 
For pie my server Kim surprised me with strawberry rhubarb ala mode. Again fresh and delightful.  
Monty's offers fantastic diner food and a wide range of fruit and cream pies. You can't go wrong here.

Fabulous food and AWESOME atmosphere. Perfect place to take your kids or have a little date. ;) The only thing that is upsetting is that once you fall in love with something on the menu, it always gets taken off. I have had probably 3 or 4 dishes that I have loved over the years that are just no longer available.
Hate the wait, but love the place all the same.  Great, great food and convenient to Olbrich Gardens.

I was very pleasantly surprised about the quality of the vegan food @ Monty's. I got the Almond Milk French Toast and the Sweet Potato Hash for my first Madison vegan experience, figuring this would tell me all I needed to know.

The French Toast is made with Cinnamon bread and is delicious. My only issue with this dish is it's basically an a la carte item--not even a fruit garnish! For the price they could have easily slid on some tempeh to make a complete meal. After licking my plate clean, I moved on to the sweet potato hash (which came with a wonderful tofu scramble) and was pleasantly surprised. It has a spicy kick that I wasn't expecting but loved.

My friend got the Blue Plate Special Omelet and had nothing but positive things to say--so good job Monty :)

The diner itself is very nice and the service was great. 

What would be awesome? Veganize MORE dishes!!
Adorable gas station turned restaurant.  Popular breakfast spot.  Huge desserts.  Smiley staff.  Boozy malts and shakes.  What more could you want?

Monty's will never let you down. Unless you're racing the clock to get pie before they close at 9:00pm. Breakfast, lunch or dinner... it's always good.
