I'm a big fan of all their omelettes, made even better because a biscuit comes on the side. Expect a bit of a wait if you're there for brunch... though certainly worth it if you have the time. 

P.S. Check in on yelp and get free coffee!

Yeah, it's nice there are a lot of veggie options, but I feel like they are spreading themselves too thin.  No one I went with was really impressed with their food, and the weird thing was that the waitress brought out half the table's food, making a few people wait.  Anyone who's been a waitress knows not to do that.  I do appreciate tempeh, seitan and tofu on menus, but it would be nice if they did it well.

First, the decor and the building itself is super cool. It really gives you that diner feel. The pies and desserts right when you walk in are also a great touch - they look absolutely divine!

We came on a Saturday at about 1:30. We had to wait for about 15 minutes, not too bad considering how small the space is. Service was okay. Our server was friendly but we had to ask about 5 times for silverware until we actually got some. They have a great selection of breakfast items, I honestly didn't pay much attention to anything else on the menu. They are really good about marking what is gluten-free which was super nice. 

I ordered the corned beef hash and it was very good. The hash had great flavor and the eggs were cooked perfectly. The biscuit looked delicious but I of course couldn't eat it (devastating). One of my biggest pet peeves though is when there is food on the plate that isn't meant to be eaten...and they put the fruit on a leaf of iceberg lettuce. Not a deal breaker obviously but something that has always annoyed me. My boyfriend ordered the country breakfast with bacon and scrambled eggs. He said it was really good, especially the potatoes. 

This place is officially on my radar as another great breakfast option!

Monty's is always great for comfort food. The vegetarian/vegan options are terrific (especially the sandwiches) and the pie is amazing. Sometimes it's a little lacking in consistency, but I'm always happy to go back.

Love this place. Gets crowded around the normal brunch time, so go early or go late. Otherwise, it's probably going to be at least a 30 minute wait.

Huge portions. Love their omelets. Lots of vegetarian options (if that's your thing - not mine). Haven't tried their desserts, but they always look tasty.

Service: Good. I've always had very nice servers. And I'm willing to cut them slack since they're always really busy. Plus they're pretty quick with the coffee refills.
Environment: Old school diner feel - with booths and stools! Doesn't feel cramped even when it gets crowded.

Side notes: I LOVE diners. Also, if you eat the biscuit, you're a fatty.

I am a HUGE fan of the Food Fight Restaurant Group, but wasn't a fan of Monty's Blue Plate Diner. The host was friendly and despite being busy, they sat us quickly. The waiter was nice, but not attentive - our drinks sat empty most of our visit. I ordered Chicken Pot Pie with mashed potatoes. Both of which were really dry. 

The overall cleanliness of the store is also something that needs some attention...

Yum.

Have been here a few times, and have never left disappointed. It's an easy choice on my "vegan" days when I still want something that feels sort of bad for you and diner-y (versus Green Owl, which is fantastic but sometimes feels TOO healthy). All the sandwhiches I've tried have been great, and the pie is SOOO good - especially any one with peanut butter in it. Service can be a little slow and invisible, at times, but the food makes it totally worth it. Looking forward to hitting it up again in the fall.

Been here three times in a month and I just want to keep going back and back and back! 

Had something different every time I've been there and every dish/plate/meal was DELICIOUS! Can get kind of crazy for weekend lunch, but if you have a chance to wait, I highly suggest you do, it will be so so so worth it!!
I love that this diner offers vegetarian/vegan options. Perfect for me and my omnivore hubby. Our waitress was great, too.

I can only speak to my one experience, but unfortunately it'll probably be my only.  We came in late Saturday morning.  It was busy as expected, we were seated after a bit.  Then it took quite a while to get menus and even longer to get coffee, which was old and cold.  We finally ordered and my egg yolks were hard and the whites were runny.  No seasoning on the eggs, I'm not sure what the sausages were made of, but I hope it wasn't pork.  The potatoes were well seasoned, but cold.  My wife's breakfast was totally dry, unseasoned and cold.  I think it was supposed to be a frittata.  I'm giving two stars instead of one, because I'm sure my experience wasn't typical.  I did see a few other plates go back to the kitchen though.

My wife and i love this place for lunch or dinner. Not so awesome on the breakfast end unfortunately. But there's a great selection for vegans and vegitarians alike. Our favorite is the Heathan Vegan. One of the best sandwiches ever! And that it's served with waffle fries makes it only more appealing. The veggie meatloaf is also fantastic as is the gravy that's served on it. Service can be a bit iffy at times. But the one time it was so terrible for us we ended up complaining we got a $25 "we're sorry" coupon. Not bad. Over all though you can't go wrong at Monty's.
Food was delicious. A touch pricey for a "diner" but worth it one we were eating. Service was good too, even when my daughter went into meltdown mode because she didn't want to leave.
Amazing! They have a whole vegan menu and so many options to please whoever is in your group!
Consistent food and service.    Breakfast is the favorite in our family.   Oh,.  maybe its  the pies....

After this morning BK breakfast fiasco, I still wanted breakfast.  This place is like Campbell's soup good mmmm mmm mmmm. I had country breakfast plate eggs  and bacon cooked perfect. Don't judge but also had blueberry pancakes. My gf had the blue plate omelet( the yummy one with avacados). I can't say enough how great the food and service was. Love great diner's like this.

Monty, thank you for saving my restaurant foody soul last night.
After a disastrous meal at another restaurant, I was crabby, mad, moody and wanting to go home.  Luckily we drove by the shining light of the Monty's sign and pulled in to the parking lot.  
Grabbed a seat at the counter and ordered a piece of pecan pie a la mode for myself and my husband.  Your hostess, waitress, bus staff were all polite, welcoming, and doing their jobs.  They refilled our coffee, checking on our food, did we need anything else?  THANK YOU!
The pie was delicious, the ice cream melted slowly into the pecan crust and became a delicious consoling comfort food. 
My congratulation on being a place that I have visited for over 10 years and still makes the mark of having great staff, great food and ambiance.  That turquoise counter has never felt so good to lean my elbows on as last night.

How have I never written a review for Monty's? 

Very often full of hipsters as well as old ladies having pie and coffee, Monty's is a Madison staple. A long-time fan of their french toast, I recently discovered their zucchini and potato pancakes. While I expected them to be small and dense like latkes, they were really more the size and shape of buttermilk pancakes. So much food! But really good.

While I personally loathe meatloaf as a rule, my sister stands by their meatloaf and meatloaf sandwich as being the best around. 

Always popular with the veggie/vegan crowd for the multitude of imitation food offerings, I stick with the bacon.

Awesome, Awesome, Awesome!

I had stopped here before just for some desert awhile back, this time it was for some good food.  Stopped here right after work, and was extremely hungry. 

Our group of four sat down in a cozy corner booth. A few of us got some seasonal specialty drinks, I tasted each, all were fantastic. I ended up getting the Blue Plate Burger with Fries, so great! Blue Cheese, caramelized onions, lettuce,  and tomato..yum! I was so hungry I ate the whole thing...which is so abnormal for me to finish a whole plate of food..but it was too fantastic to put down. 

After the filling meal, we ended up getting some desert, a few of us got some ice cream, pie, or a shake...I ended up getting the Orange Cream Shake. It really was great. Not too over overpoweringly orangey, or sweet. It was a perfect balance of both. 

The atmosphere here is great, 50's diner feel, this time of year they had Christmas music playing. Staff all fantastic, our host was so sweet, and our waiter was extremely attentive, and personable.

Very busy and the for the floor show, I watched a small child dash back and forth from the dining area into the kitchen area and back again. Multiple times. I didn't like the floor show, so that was the last time I went there.

I walked in here not knowing what to expect. I sat down, and ordered a coffee, and then breakfast. I couldn't choose through all the delicious sounding names so I chose the dish with their name in it, Blue Plate Special Omelet. 

Overall, the breakfast dish was excellent. The Fried potatoes were done just right. The service is top-notch! I didn't wait long to get my large portion of well prepared and affordable food. 

I tried to eat all of it so at the end, I had a stomachache. Too much food in one sitting. I think it's a nice problem to have. Don't you?
Monty's is a place you can go where the veg selections don't feel like an afterthought.  Order "The Sheldon"...  Trust me.  Also, amazing waitstaff and very good coffee

If I had a friend from overseas come to visit, and he asked me to show him what good American food was like, I know without a doubt this would be the place that I would display to him with great national pride. Actually, I take all my friends who come to visit Madison to Monty's. I once had a friend visiting who was on a very strict diet (gluten free + fasting for lent) with me and she had a good three pages of vegetarian and gluten-free menu to choose from.

This shouldn't scare off those looking for a greasy spoon, however, because you're free to order something at the complete opposite of that spectrum. Bacon grilled cheese, donut french toast, chicken fried steak, alcoholic milkshakes...You name it, they probably have it. My one piece of advice is that you should probably look at the menu ahead of time because it is so expansive that you could spend as much as a half hour just trying to make up your mind.

Be prepared to wait a long time if coming in during the weekend brunch rush. Do not be deterred, it is completely worth every second.

For what it's worth this is probably my #1 favorite restaurant in Madison, if not my favorite restaurant ever.
I love monty's.  I mean really on a deep personal almost sexual level.  I love you monty.

I've been wanting to try Monty's Blue Plate Diner ever since I moved to Madison. But every time I've tried to go, there's been a line out the door, so I've gone elsewhere. However, on Mother's Day at two in the afternoon, although there were people sitting outside, we were able to get in without a wait.

Inside is a definite retro diner feel. There's also a display case w/amazing looking pies.

Our waitress escorted us to a table, brought us waters, and took our drink orders. The menu is heavy on the breakfast items. However, my brother and I were both in the mood for lunch. I ordered the Meatloaf Stack and my brother got a burger with a side of fries. He made a comment to the waitress that he wanted the fries really crispy. Crunchy he said.

While waiting for our meal we continued to peruse the menu. Their desserts and dessert drinks look and sound amazing. When I go back, I will be sure and save room for those.

It took awhile for the food to come out and when it did, it was sans fries. But the waitress explained that she had sent the fries back because they were definitely NOT crispy enough. When she did bring them out a few minutes later, they were PERFECT! Crispy, crunchy, really fried. Kudos to the cooks and kudos to our awesome waitress for taking care of us like that. The rest of the food was also quite good. My meatloaf was perfect. I could have used more gravy for the mound of mashed potatoes, the onion rings were thin and crispy. My brother said his burger was excellent.

We left stuffed and pleased. I definitely want to go back. I just need to find a time when the line is not out the door.

Maybe I'm jumping the gun with a 5 star review... oh well, life's short.  I tried this place for the first time the other week when my grandparents were visiting me in Madison.  It was just wonderful!

The decor is adorable, the servers were friendly and prompt, and the food was fabulous.  I went with the Heathen Vegan Sandwich, which is piled high with mushrooms, tempeh, and avocado.  For my side, I chose the bean salad.  Both of these items were delicious.  The sandwich was HUGE.  I could not eat it like a regular sandwich, so I ate it in an open-faced sort of way with a fork.  A little messy, but totally worth it.  The mushrooms and tempeh were perfectly seasoned and tender and the avocado brought it all together with the toasted bread.

I got a bit nervous because at the *very last second* my grandma changed her order to the exact same thing I got (she's not vegan) because she "trusts me".  I was pretty nervous, but she ended up loving it!  I was so pleased.  My one complaint might be that my bean salad had a bit too much dressing on it, but my grandma's did not share that problem and it wasn't difficult to just eat it with a fork instead of a spoon.

My grandpa ordered some sort of breakfast platter and was very pleased.  He basically always orders the same thing at diners - two poached eggs, bacon, potatoes, and toast, so if he is impressed I feel that it is a good sign. He said the eggs were cooked perfectly.

They seem extremely accommodating for allergies and preferences as well, which is always a huge plus.

Overall, I was very happy with my first visit to Monty's.   Not only because I loved my vegan options, but because you made my grandparents very happy too and that rocks in my book.  I will definitely be back!

Monty's Blue Plate and the Holy Grail of Corned Beef Hash. 

If I were to write nothing else, I think the previous sentence sums up my new found appreciation for the place. 

"Your mother was a hamster, and your father smelled of elderberries" will never be uttered to an employee of Monty's. 

The service was great, my coffee cup stayed full the entire meal, and the food was 'da bomb.' 

I'm eyeballing the Chorizo for my next visit, which will be sooner rather than later.

Monty's is one of those places where you start going to as a little kid, and continue going to well past your 70s. I could definitely see myself here years from now shaking my head disapprovingly at the rowdy young'un's over my newspaper (aka some form of electronic tablet at that point).

Monty's serves up some classic breakfast items, including the standard buttermilk pancakes, bottomless coffee (sorry millenniums, no mimosas here) and various omelets.

The servers here are extremely down to earth and friendly, and their chefs cook a mean meatloaf (highly recommended). 

What to get away from the glitz and glamour of most brunch places these days? Come by Monty's for some ultimate comfort food!

Sometimes I read reviews for an establishment that make me sad for Madison. The reviews on this site for this "institution" spring to mind. Like all other Food Fight restaurants, this place is devoid of anything that would make it interesting or enjoyable. The decor looks like it was purchased out of Good Time Fifties Oldies Diner Catalog and the food ranges from passable to embarrassing. 

Skip the soul-less chain and go to any family-owned business in the area instead. Stalzy's comes to mind.

Great diner style/comfort food with a wide variety of vegan and vegetarian options. They had a huge selection of pies and cakes (we had the German chocolate cake & strawberry rhubarb pie) and thought both were amazing, very large portions too!!

Fantastic affordable diner! My wife and I went here and we're able to enjoy our time. I ordered a breakfast platter, and my wife had the chicken pot pie! Our waiter was nice attentive even though he was clearly busy. Maybe one day I'll come back for their dessert!

Monty's is easily one of my favorite diners, and for good reasons:
1. Boozy milkshakes.
2. Meatloaf. Holy moist meatloaf with mounds of mashed potatoes and gravy. As a sandwich, comes with tomato and little fried onions.
3. Herbed goat cheese. You can get this on their bistro burger, chicken sandwich, BREAKFAST SANDWICH (this is friggin amazeballs), and probably other things if you ask.
4. Waffle fries
5. Huevos rancheros. I love them here!!
6. Biscuits. I may or may not have brought my own honey from the farmer's market and slooped it on a buttery flaky biscuit.
7. Vegan and veg options that are just as desirable and delicious.
8. Their pie.
9. The service - they are attentive and nice and overall awesome at Monty's!

Other notes: I've never had to wait long for a table. In colder weather, order the hot buttered rum. Love Monty's.
Best food ever. Spicy yam soup great!! Can't wait to come back to try the Other entrees!

We went for a late dinner around 8ish, so it wasn't crazy busy like most of the other reviews stated. We sat down right away because it was late. First impression, this place is awesome total 50's diner style. Loved the look, the classic long counter with stools, dessert counter to look at all the pie options- it was great. We sat in a booth and began looking at the menu. If you're a vegan, there's a ton of options. I've never seen a Diner with so many classic foods made vegan, so even though I'm not I thought that was something worth noting. They also serve alcohol and have spotted cow on draft. Some of my friends tried the raspberry Moscow mules, reported they were great , and I tried some and I agree. But upon receiving the second drink, it tasted extremely different- less raspberry flavor, more vodka. So their drink consistency is off or it was the end of the night. Another thing was that our waitress was not super attentive, she spent a lot of time in the kitchen talking to the cooks which we could see from the cook window. Maybe because it was the end of the night? But we were looking to get in and get out before they closed and it didn't seem like she was in any hurry. I chose the meatloaf (meatloaf of the gods) for the entree because of reviews. It was very good! I liked it a lot, but huge portion! Couldn't finish it, but that's definitely not a complaint. There was a side of marinara sauce? Maybe a nicer sauce instead of ketchup to serve with the meatloaf ? Tasted like cocktail sauce almost- I put it aside, didn't need it and also didn't like it. The mashed potatoes were good as well. The broccoli florets were huge. After dinner we shared a piece of coconut cream pie, which was amazing! Loved every bite, extremely good. Not sure if it's homemade or catered from somewhere- regardless I'm sure all pie is a safe bet here. My friends shared a peach cobbler milkshake and it did not even taste like peach. It almost tasted like strawberries or cherries. So that was odd, it definitely wasn't as good as the pie. But overall good diner style food, wish I tried the breakfast.
Monty's is where I went on my first date with my future husband. I love Monty's and always will.  The milk shakes and vegetarian fare are outstanding.
Their food is ok.  I would not call it special or extraordinary, but it is not bad.  The service is less than desirable.
solid place, good breakfast food. Shake is usually a bit much/rich, but great to share.

I have a love/not love relationship with Monty's. I used to love them for b-fast when I ate omlets. Now that I'm vegan, it's kinda hard to love them. Many of the items can't be changed, so if you're not a fan of onions or even allergic to them, they can't come out of items because they are pre-made in batches. They are my last ditch place to go to if Lazy Jane's, The Green Owl or any other place is busy or closed.

Going to see a show or concert across the street at the Barrymore? Well, we all have to eat somewhere, why not Monty's? The first time I laid eyes on this joint, it was a few weeks ago after skipping dinner and going to Bo Burnham. I wondered if it was a bar or a restaurant, a week later, I found out that it's kind of both! It's a classic diner that happens to serve alcohol. I ordered and enjoyed the mushroom and swiss, but I came in on a mission. To order a burger. Their menu almost distracted me from my mission by offering breakfast all day. Oh, I shall return to conquer the idea of Breakfast for Dinner another time!

Waffle fries! need I say more on this topic? Well, its Yelp, so yes. Just the right amount of crispy and not too many. I also managed a dessert on my first visit, that portion size of the Oat Fudge Bar was enough for me to have skipped the fries or the burger, it was huge! Sadly there were nuts mixed in (personal preference), but that didn't stop me.

I didn't opt-in for a shake, but I should have. All I've learned about my visit is that I will have to make another trip before my next Barrymore concert!

I can't wait to go back to this place to have breakfast! My bf ordered the special for the day which was the biscuits and gravy. The biscuits were homemade and oversized. The gravy was also homemade with their homemade sausage and various spices. The gravy wasn't too thick and it was very flavorful, it didn't seem like it came from a box. 
I got the Florentine which was also very delicious. 
The place was very cute and set up like a diner. Oh and Coffee was also good. 
Def a place to go for breakfast!
Fantastic vegetarian and nonvegetarian food alike, great ice cream, adult beverage selection is to die for. Bloody mary's on a sunday morning? Yes please.

The food is delicious! The seating isn't the best, but they make due. The wait isn't too long, but Sundays are always busy. There are many options for what your "belly monster" is screaming for..... I enjoy the liquor options. Staff is awesome.

Only complaint,  lack of parking.

We went here over the summer and I still dream about the biscuit that comes with the breakfasts.

The wait for brunch was long, but the free papers and indoor/outdoor waiting area made it entirely bearable. 

The menu, as others have mentioned, is very very vegetarian friendly. We tried the pesto + mushroom omelet, which was original and delicious, as was the spinach + feta omelet. 

We also tried a recommended milk shake, which was worth the splurge. 

This will be the first place we stop next time we are in Madison.

Our server was friendly and everything we ordered was delicious.

My friend said that whenever vegan or vegetarian friends visit, they want to go to Monty's so I was interested in trying it. We went for dinner. 

I got a peanut curry vegan dish that had a lot of vegetables and peanut sauce over rice. My paleo friend got grilled chicken skewers with grilled veggies and rice, while my other friend got chicken pot pie and a milkshake. 
All of our food was delicious, hearty, and reasonably priced. Obviously some of the food is not exactly what comes to mind as diner food. Due to their wider menu that suits a variety of tastes, I'd say it's a few steps above just 'diner,' nicer than Hubbard or Mickey's but not as fancy as Bassett Street Brunch Club. The dessert bar looked good but I was so full. 

Despite going on a weeknight, it was still buzzing with people. 
The service was great. I look forward to returning.
Really wanted to like it but I won't be back, the restaurant wasn't very clean, and my food was soggy. It was weird

I have been going here since the 90s and it has been up and down.  Some ok food, some terrible.  Once found fatty masses in my meatloaf.  Recently it has been just ok.  Inexpensive, pretty fast but low quality compared to other places on Willy street and mediocre compared to the many good options in Madison.

I went here with some family from out of town. The food was delicious. I highly recommend the Monty's Cristo sandwich! The shakes and malts are a tad bit pricey for what you get, but the entrees are priced more reasonably.

I am a vegetarian and this is the only place i can get good comfort food!
Me and the bf started with the oreo shake.  We ordered one but they were nice enough to split it for us... and we didn't ask... bonus points there.
I ordered the meatless meatloaf sandwich, which was served open face with mashed potatoes and cashew gravy... It was weird looking but so so so delicious.  Made of carrots and cheese and other goodness the whole plate was fabulous!
BF got the TNT BLT... he was not a fan but I loved that too... just a basic veg blt, with the spicy waffle fries.  I do not like their ranch dressing though...it's like the generic brand.
For dessert we got some of the carrot cake and raspberry cheesecake to go... I will from now on always get dessert, it was the best part!!!
Next time I am trying the FAt Elvis Cake!!!

**update.***
Tried the Fat Elvis Cake... AMAZING!  Banana bread-cake layered with peanut butter frosting topped with chocolate frosting... Will definately get this again!

Monty's is a classic diner in Madison. It offers lots of options for vegetarians so it draws a big crowd. I went with my girlfriends on Saturday @ 10:30 AM and we waited about 35 minutes to be seated. 

The wait staff was very good and attentive.  We had a toddler with us and the server made sure to place things out of her reach. It was quite considerate. 

The food was just ok in my opinion. I had Eggs Mornay and it was good but not amazing. The poached eggs were overdone so that there was no liquid egg yolk oozing out when I cut into them. It lost the creamy, velvetiness of the dish that I was looking for when I ordered the dish.

My friends said their food was ok too but not the best we've had.

This is not a brunch place you can sit and talk with your friends for an extended time. They have a huge wait list and we were asked politely to leave.

Not a place you can take extra time to catch up. This is a get in eat your food and leave place. 

Not sure I'd go back given there are so many other amazing brunch places in Madison.

This diner aims for a 50s diner aesthetic. I really liked the blue interiors and the bar/booth style seating inside.

The food was okay. I ordered a scrambled, which had tomatoes, onions, and bell peppers mixed in. I appreciated that the breakfast potatoes were not too salty. Coffee was decently strong too.

Overall we had a relatively pleasant experience here and I feel relatively neutral about the place, hence the 3 stars. I've heard the pie and donut game is strong here so I'll definitely be back to try.

I have returned again and again for Monty's eggs mornay. When I first ordered it I thought I was getting a typical eggs benedict for breakfast but then something so much better came out. Eggs mornay is eggs benedict made with a mornay sauce instead of hollondaise sauce. The mornay sauce is creamier and peppery! It is so good. I once met a man who ordered a different breakfast but asked for a side of the mornay sauce to dip his potatoes in...that's my kind of breakfast!

I've had their burgers and meatloaf as well, both are equally good but I keep coming back for the eggs mornay! I've also had their red velvet cupcakes which are pretty great too!

Classic diner and menu style with modern twist (includes vegetarian/vegan options).  I love going here for breakfast.  The breakfast sandwich (with goat cheese) is divine.  My family always wants to come here when they visit.  Food is always fresh, staff is always on top of things, and it's a cool environment.

Everyone already knows how awesome Monty's Blue Plate Diner is, so I don't have to tell you that. Your carnivore and herbivore friends will love the menu. They source local ingredients, cook "real" food and even bring in local products such as YumButter and create extra, super-duper healthy menu items by partnering with Jon Hinds at Monkey Bar Gym.

However, I write this review because I recently ate the most amazing curry dish there. I've been craving it ever since and cannot wait to return. I'm serious, it was a hot, steaming bowl of freshly steamed vegetables with rice and a fantastic curry sauce. I want to eat this every day! Our server even told me that she actually DOES eat this every day and has since they put it on their menu. It was a huge bowl, so I took half of it home with me so I could enjoy a second meal of leftovers. 

Now drop everything and order this curry!

And order a piece of pie or enjoy an iced sugar cookie, too.

I came here for brunch on a saturday. I got the GLBT: Guacamole, lettuce, bacon and tomato. It was delicious! I love that this place serves Sprecher root beer. Seems like that's a standard for Madison, but I love it and I'm thrilled whenever I can order it. Yum! We also got one of their delicious pies to go, and it was killer. So even if you're full after breakfast or lunch, grab one of the desserts to go for later enjoyment. I thought service was good here; we got our food in a decent amount of time. 

Be warned, it can be hard to get to via car, since the street arrangement in that area is totally wacky. However, it's worth the hunt, since you get Monty's at the end. Now that the weather is nice, check out the botanical gardens afterwards, since it's close to this restaurant.

A solid diner specializing in scratch-made breakfasts and sandwiches. The local who brought be here said that Monty's tries to use local meats, veggies, etc. and I applaud that (especially in Wisconsin where all the local stuff is typically top-notch). I tried the Wisconsin salmon breakfast hash that was tasty and I cleaned my plate, but the dish was just a tad dry and needed a little something extra to make it more than the minced and griddled sum of its parts. Breakfast potatoes were solid and didn't provoke the usual request for Cholula/Tabasco. I appreciated the fact that fresh fruit is offered as a side with most breakfasts. Definitely hit the spot. Our server was very attentive and was exceedingly patient with our sleep-deprived indecision before ordering.

After glancing at the dessert case filled with ultra-decadent delights (cupcakes, cakes, etc.) I think I'd be up for returning on a future trip to Madison. A late-night sugar fix might be more in the cards than breakfast next time, though.
Hash was a smash for me. Also Tim the owner sang us a Dylan song. Great biscuits, also liked the potatoes. It is a must try if you are in Mad-town.

Cool!!!  Really enjoyed my meal. I had the Ruben sand which with a side of the corned beef hash. The sandwich was good. The corned beef hash was great. Didn't have room for desert this time but will definitely save room next time.

I've been here for dinner multiple times now, and have yet to be disappointed (not that I expect to!). The staff is very friendly and service is fast. I think I've been in and out in less than an hour when we had a show to catch nearby!

The food is delicious and there are plenty of vegetarian/vegan options to choose from. I've had the mac and cheese at least twice and absolutely love it!

The ambiance here is very home-y and low key - what you'd expect from a family-owned diner. I love it.

We dont live on that side of town any more but when we do go there on a Sunday, we like to stop there for lunch. And few times this summer even with gas price,we drove there for lunch.  You cant leave there without trying one of their pies or cakes. Usually,I wont have room after the regular food so I end up taking home the pie. Never been there without having to wait for 20 minute or so. But it's all worth the wait. I just wish they make the place just a little bigger or do soemthing about the noise level.  I'm a meat eatter but I tried their bean burger there and now that's all I eat there. Besides the dessert.

I really loved this restaurant! Homestyle, diner food with a twist - including lots of options for vegetarians. The service was outstanding, as people beyond my primary server helped ensure that my drink was full and needs addressed.

I had the Ultimate Mac, and it sure was ultimate! The best mac n' cheese I've ever had. The portion size was definitely enough for two to share. I tried not to think about the calories that I was consuming when I downed the entire bowl plus the two pieces of garlic bread that came with it.

Monty's is a retro diner. We originally went there because it was one of the few places open on new years day, but I was pleasantly surprised. They have a lot of classic American breakfast dishes. I had the tempeh hash with scrambled eggs which was quite good. It was flavorful and tasty.

This was 1 of my final 2 breakfasts in the great state of WI as I am leaving for Seattle on Wednesday this week. My mother and I came here on her request to go someplace new before I left town. I had not been here myself so I took her up on the offer. Our food was great! Good service, great coffee, fast food prep from order to plates on the table as well. Had a decent flow of people coming in the whole morning as well which must say something about the place. I highly suggest the sweet potato hash for breakfast and do try a biscuit or 2 as well, great with some honey and coffee! Great prices as well.
Fantastic pie! And food. And the servers were awesome. Now there's needs to be one in Indiana. And Ohio. In general they should just be everywhere.

It's a cute place.  The service was excellent. It was hard to choose from all the great-sounding items on the menu.  For the first ten minutes of my visit, I was really happy with it.  Then the food came.

Ohmigod, it was GROSS!  I ordered fettuchini with goat cheese, expecting a pile of noodles, some alfredo-ish sauce and cheese over the top, and maybe if I was lucky a few pine nuts or tomato bits or herbs.  Nuh-uh.

It was like somebody took a huge glob of cafeteria noodles, rolled them around in a cup of grated cheese, put a stick of butter on top and microwaved the whole mess on high for a minute.  The garlic bread was the kind of roll you'd use to make a sub sandwich dipped in some garlic butter.  My dog has deposited more appealing piles on the back lawn after gorging on leftovers.   Checking out the other tables, I doubt anything else would have been a better choice.

This is what they call comfort food--what Mom would give you to cheer you up after your Little League team lost or something.  I suppose people like this stuff because of the emotional connotations, I don't know.  My actual mom knew how to cook.  She would have called this stuff "white food."  The servings are huge, except for the side salad which could have fit in a teacup.

Many people love this diner.  If you're a mac-and-cheese type person, you may very well love it too.
I always have awesome food here. I am ready to start tryign out awesome coctails

I haven't been to Monty's in at least 15 years, so it was really nice to visit Madison and return to find it just as great as I remember.  Great atmosphere and excellent service.  Really excellent service. I had the Blackened Salmon Salad, which was great - I love that they have some healthy options.  My kids opted for pancakes, eggs and bacon - all good.  My husband, who usually comments on how expensive a meal outside McDonald's is, actually made a "hey reasonable price" sort of comment.  That's sayin' something for the value!

This place has fantastic food and lots of vegetarian options. I have had many meals here and they are consistently tasty. My go-to sandwich is the TNT BLT. Fabulous. Besides the good food, the building has a fun and clean throwback diner atmosphere. Generally, the staff are very friendly. The only bad thing I can say about this place is I don't like their homemade ranch. It's not for me. Everything else is great.

Part of the Madison based Food Fight Inc (16 restaurants currently?), Monty's was the first, or one of the first.  They are all different, yet are the same in one way.  They are good places to eat.

Monty's is styled after a 50's diner - counter, chrome, lots of "traditional" diner foods, and a lot that you never got at a diner.  Service is fast, food is good, prices are reasonable (but not cheap) and wait staff is friendly.  Feels neighborhood friendly, although they bring in people from all over the area.  Plenty of good vegetarian options also.

Food is interesting, with lots of things not found in your typical diner.   Coffee is from Just Coffee (that is a bonus feature people - if you like coffee, this is a great place) and many of the specials are made with organic foods.  Want a burger but don't eat meat?  Swap out the Walnut burger - which, as a meat eater, I can say is good.  Certainly better than their hamburger.  Speaking of which...

What is up with that hamburger?  First off, it comes medium well done - no burger should ever be cooked to that.  Second, it is heavily, and funky seasoned.  As in, if I ordered it, it would go back.  A good burger needs salt and pepper.  They add a bunch of stuff.  However my niece who ordered it liked it, so we kept it.

Deserts are very popular at Monty's, but that was our disappointment.  Cheesecake was rubbery and the carrot cake was dry - stale dry.  Really?  I am almost tempted to go to three stars just for that.

Overall, I have to stick with four stars.  Great coffee, mostly really good, and interesting, food, fast, good service.  Without a doubt I will be back if in the area.  But I will skip desert.

Vegan food options!
Okay so I walked up to this place and was pleasantly suprised - it is a REAL diner! So cool! I ordered on the phone and was just stopping in to grab food. It is a busy place, decent size inside but it seemed full up. My food was ready and although busy the waitress was pleasant. I ordered the Sheldon (their vegan reuban) and strawberry rhubarb pie. Prices are fair! It is in a good location. Many other restuarants, bars and little shops around. I would have loved to have been with a gaggle of girls, dressed in 50s clothes to fully enjoy the diner atmosphere. They have a few different vegan options available. 

The Sheldon was okay, not really a rueben. I would eat it again just not with such high expectations (sorry nothing has yet to come close to Chicago Diners amazing rueben). Bread  was good, the meat was just slices of tofu... and they tasted lemony, then the sourkraut and the sauce was just... veganaise. I havent tried the pie yet but it looks good!

Id try it again. Happy to try new foods and cute places!
Decent food and mediocre service. We heard the waitress tell her coworkers she doesn't like talking to people. A little unprofessional but the vegan menu is awesome!

Super Vegan/Vegetarian friendly, and can will accommodate any and all tastes!

The menu is pretty much impossible to choose from, since there are so many delicious items on it. I usually break down and get one of their awesome burgers. I only travel to Madison once every couple years to visit family, and I frequently think back to how yummy their Walnut veggie patties are.
My Grammy always orders a chocolate malt and the waffle fries (which are top-notch). She's 93, and she knows what's up.
This is the place to be.

I'm a regular for their omelettes, which are amazing! As well as their salmon hash, but recently I stopped by for dinner. Their meatloaf of gods was pretty good. It was a tad bit salty for my taste but the gravy was on point.

I'm a sucker for good breakfast, and Monty's does not disappoint. Their menu includes all of the classics: omelettes, pancakes, etc. along with a few unique options. 

I'm somewhat of a traditionalist, so have stuck with the country breakfast and omelettes on my trips here. Each time, the eggs and potatoes have been perfectly cooked. Another thing I love about this place: my coffee cup NEVER goes empty. 

If you're looking for a diner atmosphere with friendly service, I highly suggest stopping here!

Still 5 stars, but I am disappointed.  Some of my faves are no longer in the menu (Vegetarian pot pie?  Gone?  Wtf!).  Some of my faves have changed (Tnt, for example).  I see what's going on.  They are trying so hard to use local food that the quality has been sacrificed.  Not cool. If I wanted tempeh from some head-barely-above-water Indonesian restaurant, I would drive the 2 miles and go there.  Just use the tempeh you used to use!  Better taste (and probably lower cost too) is the way to go. Don't worry about supporting other local businesses if their products don't deliver.

It's impossible to have a bad meal at Monty's. I've never actually met him... but he is on to something! 

Why do I love it?
1. They have vegan shakes! Yes, vegan... now as a lactose intolerant vegetarian this was music to my ears. I ordered a vegan shake with walnuts and banana's. Oh em gee.... they give you a glass and a half. It's a lot. It could put you in a diabetic coma but who cares. I took it home and it took me 2 days to finish. Yes, it was a cheat day but I wasn't going for a setback.
2. They have/had vegetarian gravy. It was a special item on the menu one day - one of the best biscuits and veggie gravy I have ever had!
3. They have a TON of vegetarian options.... in fact too many. My indecisive excited brain just can't make up my mind. My hubby dare not order the same thing I do - because we have to share. 

We have brought our friends from Chicago here and they loved it as well.

Really love it here, I would come here a lot more often if it were easier to get a table during meal times.

The space is totally retro, very comfortable and has the chill feel of Madison. There isn't really seating for groups larger than about six people, and even then it can be a squeeze.

I've always considered their meals to be very consistent, which is key. My favorite thing is their GBLT and waffle fries. The sandwich has some awesome chipotle sauce that gives it a special kick and the guac is always fresh tasting.

Another highlight: alcoholic milkshakes, hell yeah! 

I like the range of the menu, there are many vegetarian and vegan options, and breakfast is served allllll day!

The staff is always very friendly, service can be a little slow, but it generally isn't an issue because the place is pretty small.
Very yummy.  We brought out of town friends here who have food intolerances and they were very happy to be able to pick from several items on the menu.  Very cute restaurant.

Monty's Blue Plate Diner is one of those funny contradictions-in-terms that is a restaurant which is both good but overrated.  Overall, though, it is far and away my favorite Food Fight place and a fairly reliable spot to get a good meal.

Monty's food is better than hit-or-miss but not quite consistently good.  Most of the things I've eaten there, especially the breakfast foods, have been delicious (and huge), but I've had a couple of very sub-par meals (one was so bad I literally could not eat more than a couple of bites).  The things that I ate and disliked are now off the menu, so that does say something for their ability to identify what's working and what isn't.  What I can say is that the egg-based breakfast-y menu items are almost universally good.  The "scrambled something-or-other" never fails to disappoint, nor does the newer Blue Plate Omelet (the one with cheddar, avocado and bacon... good lord!).  And the breakfast burrito is especially good, even without chorizo (which is how I usually order it).  As for the breakfast side items, the potatoes are just okay; the biscuits are great.  Most importantly of all, the coffee is superb (even my mother thinks so and she drinks a hell of a lot more coffee than I do).  Unfortunately, I tend to shy away from the lunch and dinner items so I can't really speak to their quality.  The pies, though, are heaven.  And it's certainly worth noting that the menu pays special attention to including veg*n options.

The atmosphere is pretty awesome.  Outdoor seating is spacious and comfy.  Indoors, the blue-topped tables are fun for making patterns with the wet bottom of your water glass.  Get a booth if you can; the tables are a bit cramped.  The waitstaff are generally friendly and attentive.

The upshot is that if you think you'll enjoy eating at a diner that's 70% greasy spoon and 30% hipster hot spot, and if you like breakfast foods and are a "good orderer" (you choose from menus wisely), Monty's is an excellent choice.
Great food! I love the breakfast burrito. Service is excellent. Easy parking. Great vegetarian selection for my veggie friends.

Situated in a cutesy little piece of the Atwood neighborhood, Monty's Blue Plate Diner is a great place for breakfast. A cozy little diner with a muted 60s feel, Monty's offers the usual diner breakfast standbys: pancakes, french toast, omelettes, etc. while also offering more trendy choices such as breakfast burritos, chilaquiles, and huevos rancheros. Check in with Yelp and get a coupon for free bottomless coffee. Their mimosas are top notch too. I highly recommend the huevos rancheros with black beans and chorizo- they are awesome. Get there early if possible because this place is usually hopping.

Iconic Diner and true Madison experience. Great for breakfast or brunch if you can get a seat. The only reason I am dissuaded from going is the wait, which speaks volumes about popularity. The menu choices are wonderful.

We arrived today at 11am and were told that the wait was 10mins. 30 mins later and we were finally seated. It's been 40 mins now and we still don't have any of our food. The table next to us arrived 15 mins after we sat and they are now eating. Unbelievably bad service and only a weak apology aren't going to cut it. This will be the last time I ever eat here.

This is by far my favorite diner in Madison.   We've been eating here for years and it always a good meal.   I've enjoyed their spinach, feta and mushroom omelet, Mediterranean platter, meatloaf of the gods, and chicken in a pie (to name a few meals).   All were yummy each time I had them.  The service is always great no matter what time of day.   During the dinner rush and weekends you might have to wait to be seated but it's well worth it.   
My kids enjoy the kids meal options and usually finish all of what they order.   
They have vegetarian, vegan and gluten free options as well.   
And you can't forget about the pies.   So much goodness!  In fact on occasion my friends and I meet up there just for pie. 
Perfect location for friends, family and even a casual date night.

The Food Fight group never disappoints, and Monty's Blue Plate Diner is no exception. We loved the extensive brunch menu here. We did have to wait around 20 minutes, but there's some nice outdoor dining space and so we didn't mind waiting outside in the warm weather. Once we were seating, the waiter was extremely efficient. Our orders were taken right away and we probably didn't wait more than 10 minutes for our food. They have a large variety of brunch choices. The bloody marys come with a side car of beer as well. The booths were cozy and overall felt like old fashion diner. Would definitely visit again!

Had a great meal with some old friends who adore this place, and I can see why. Imagine a retro diner that serves breakfast all day ... and lots of sandwiches, burgers and other entreees ... and several vegetarian and vegan options ... and has a killer bakery ... and allows kids to play with sidewalk chalk outside. What's not to love? I really wanted to try the TNT BLT or the GBLT (clever), but they ran out of tempeh, so I chose the almond milk french toast, which was divine, and a biscuit. I really wanted a slice of pie, but was worried about drifting into a food coma on the drive back to Chicago. Next time ....

I don't understand why this place is popular.  The food was bad and the service was bad.  I ordered a burger medium well and got it medium rare.  After sending it back and getting another it was still medium/medium rare but I was too hungry to send it back again and lost all faith in their cooks.  I think they served it on the same plate with the same cold fries as before.  My friend ordered a breakfast dish and it was terrible.  The scrambled eggs were so overcooked they were hard and rubbery, the potatoes were very undercooked, and the biscuit was dry and literally had no flavor.  None.  The service seriously lacked as well.  No one was unfriendly, just incompetent.

We thought the dessert would redeem them but after paying so much for a single slice of cheesecake we couldn't even finish it.  One slice was dried out and the other cheesecake had too much sour cream - it was actually mushy and very sour, almost spoiled tasting.

Bottom line, I found this place to be mediocre at best, and that's being generous. There's tons of better restaurants in the area and in the city.  Never going back, and I think the food has made me ill.

Been here twice. Comfortable spot with great booths for that diner feel. I got the corned beef hash twice because they use hand cut (not canned) corned beef. 

The coffee is great. The jalapeño toast is a nice touch. Also, they have plenty of vegan and vegetarian options if you're into that kinda thing.
I've eaten there dozens of times. Their eggs mornay is the best in town. Kudos to Tim and his excellent staff and the great waitstaff..

I want to slap 2014 me in the face for only giving this restaurant 3 stars. 

There was a time that I ate here almost weekly, primarily ordering the same couple of things: the chicken pot pie or their breakfast sandwich. 

The chicken pot pie is served with mashed potatoes and a yummy roll, and the pie itself is stuffed with tender cubed chicken, lots of creamy gravy and an assortment of fresh veggies. The breakfast sandwich is uniquely served on spicy grilled jalapeno bread, with goat cheese, applewood smoked bacon, spinach, egg and tomatoes with a side of fried potatoes. It's a messy sandwich, but deliciously so.

Monty's is always the go to spot when I have family in town. It's perfect for the picky eaters, or vegetarians/vegans. Everyone can find something to enjoy here.

Don't even get me started on their desserts.

Great diner with tons of vegetarian and vegan options.   They even have the Trempeleau walnut burger!! My husband got the Elvis shake, which was beautiful and he must have liked because he gobbled it up.

We went here for breakfast on a Sunday. It was very crowded, but we only had to wait 20-30 minutes. I'm not gonna lie, some of the staff seem incompetent, but they are nice in general. I am giving it 3 because:

-Cool, old style, but generic diner interior
-Reasonable prices
-Food was decent
-Crowd was good, chill
-there were a good number of veg options, but not too many for us meat eaters (yum)

Lots of good vegan and vegetarian options if you're in the mood for diner food. It can get really busy here on the weekends, so it's best to go at off-peak times.

Also, your phone won't get service inside their building.

Monty's is a Madison must go to! It always has a wait, but the staff does an excellent job getting tables flipped quickly. I almost never have to wait the full time they say. I went there today and the food was fantastic. The service was amazing, they kept our drinks full and made sure to get everything we needed. My group got both breakfast and lunch/dinner options. All meals came well prepared and tasted yummy! I can't wait to come back!

Loved the breakfast options and want to try lunch sometime. Classic diner feel with excellent twists, and amazing vegan-friendly options. I also had an old-fashioned cinnamon sugar donut; almost as good as Greenbush's (so that's saying something). Can't wait to come back!

My husband and I went to Madison for a trip, we came here for lunch. It looks like vintage american dinner. I ordered Roast chicken & goat cheese sandwich (without the bacon), it was really good. I don't remember what my hubby ordered I was busy making love with my sandwich. But I do remember him liking my food more. 

Check in on yelp and you will get a free coffee.
If you need a family friendly good old American diner than look no further. Enjoy!

This is a diner and should be treated as such- the service is hit-or-miss, the atmosphere isn't anything special, and everything on the menu is pretty good. A few tips for enjoying all this place has to offer: 
1. Share a malt or shake with someone- they are delicious and HUGE, so way too much to eat with the well-portioned meals, but half of one is perfect and satisfying.
2. Find something that you like on the menu and stick with it- there are a number of exceptional things on the menu (i.e. the Meatless Meatloaf), but everything else is average.

I'd probably give this 3 stars, but the amount of vegetarian options is fantastic and deserves another star.

I was told this place had great food and killer chocolate malts. I have never been so disappointed in looking at food. I ordered corn beef hash and since I was on a job a block away I figured I'd get the food to go. Literally a 30 second walk to the office. The corn beef hash was more small cut up potato hash with a bit of square pieces of some meat that had no taste. The entire thing was nasty. Let's get to this awesome chocolate malt. I pulled off the paper from the straw after walking out the door only to get a chocolate milk not a chocolate malt. Considering it's 26° outside this couldn't have melted from the door to the street. I really like eating in different cities each week but this was the worst experience I've had in years.

My review would probably be higher, had I not just the other day had one of the worst meals of my life at Monty's Blue Plate diner. My meatloaf sandwich was so salty is almost inedible. At first I thought it was the gravy that had the excessive salt, then I figured it was the meatloaf. After plodding through this sodium-induced nightmare I realized that the whole damn thing was pure salt, like that one episode of the Original Series Star Trek, the one with the salt beast, that's made of pure sodium. 

This place has a varied menu with a good selection of vegan or vegetarian dishes. I would recommend the Palomino or Comet in MIlwaukee, both vegan and vegetarian friendly diners, over this place any day of the week.

Breakfast this AM. Tempeh with potatoes , onions green peppers and eggs was a disappointment!! I think I found two pieces of tempeh which would both fit on my little finger nail. A spec of green pepper, same for onion. Lots of diced potatoes. Good flavor. 

My friend had the zucchini potatoes pancakes which were incredible.

Would return but would no order the Tempeh. Again.
Always enjoy a good meal every time I go here. All day breakfast is great and there are some great healthy options to choose from too. I really like the Tex Mex Omelet personally.

Monty's is awesome.  Their vegetarian comfort food is great and there are lots of choices.  Get the spicy waffle fries with your sandwich; they are not actually spicy, but they're delicious.  I also love the milkshakes!

Great homemade soups, Such a tasty place. It was crazy busy but once we got seated everything flowed at the right pace. 

Always try the soups!

Monty's Blue Plate is a local gem.  Expect unique menu items that focus on tasty, healthy, and fresh.  They have things like burgers that you would expect at any diner but they do their own unique spin on standards.  My latest meal was a burger with carmelized onions, herbed goat cheese, and spinach..  Sooo good.  They are also sort of famous for their bean salad - even my two year old goes for that one.

After your meal you have an array of some of the best cakes and pies.  Their carrot cake is the best I have ever had and sometimes we will go there just for that!

I've eaten at Monty's probably 3 dozen times over the past two years and I've noticed that while the quality of ingredients remains high, the preparation consistency is low.  One of my favorite items is their breakfast potatoes and sometimes they're perfect but often they are either raw or burnt.  Today I ordered a breakfast sandwich and  specified the egg over hard...it was almost raw.

The service is also hit or miss.  Some servers are EXCELLENT, but there's this guy there that is just BAD.  He's stuck up, doesn't refill coffee (i literally had to get up and get our own), and didn't' even bother to give a damn when my wife mentioned that the zucchini pancakes were bad (they were gross).  

I'm done with Monty's.  There's plenty of good breakfast places in Madison to give my money to.
Great food, good service, fun vibe, always busy for weekend brunch. Worth the wait.
Loved going to this place. As a night shift worker, this was the best place for a good breakfast and good drink. Recommend highly!

East siders love this place. I have always thought it highly average. My wife wanted to go recently. My reaction, "Meh." But I went. She had the veggie hash, which she really liked. So I boosted my otherwise 2-star rating by 1. I had the salmon hash. My reaction? It was cooked. The little cubed potatoes were not the least bit crispy. But they were cooked. The meal was not bad. It was bland. I didn't make a disgust face or anything. The booths are remarkably uncomfortable. The place looks good. The coffee was pretty good. We were served food. We ate. When we finished, we were no longer hungry.

I have been going to Monty's ever since they opened, lately not as much as I could simply because of an increasing budget, but when I get the chance I am there! 

If you are veg or vegan, this place treats you right, Meatless Meatloaf of the Gods, Vegan Shakes Etc...this place does it like Mom & Grandma did, simple yet delish comfort food!! 

Have to mention the amazing staff always watching to make sure your soda or coffee is refilled. I have to stop now, I am getting a bit teary eyed!!

So good!!! Fun diner atmosphere. Great service! Had the sweet potato hash with two over easy eggs... substituted the Silly Yak jalapeño cheddar bread for the brisket! Everything was fresh -- the sweet potato veggie blend hash was wonderful!! Stop by if you are in Madison!!!

Monty's is the epitome of decent/average diner food. They do ok corned beef from scratch, ok breakfasts, ok meatloaf, all with nice portions. It's a good place to sit and talk and eat. 

But what really makes Monty's a recommended location is their attention to gluten-free, vegan, and other dietary lifestyles or restrictions. Instead of having to ask, the menu offers many alternatives to regular meat/wheat fare. In this way, their 'ok' everything approach is elevated to specialty diet destination. Finally, a place to go without worry to have a normal diner experience for those (such as a couple of my family members and friends) with food allergies. Highest recommendation if this applies to your experience. Genuine place for 'something for everyone' eating.

great diner with good veggie and vegan options.
overall very nice staff, friendly, prompt
great desserts!
Still not a good restaurant. Variable quality of food and service, still overpriced. I tried to give it a few more chances, and its still mediocre at best.

Great diner with a very creative menu.  You can certainly get your traditional eggs-and-bacon breakfast, or you can opt for a tofu scramble or zucchini potato pancakes.  What more could you ask for?  I have only eaten here for breakfast, but the desserts are tempting, too.

This place is overall fantastic. There is a hip diner atmosphere, the servers are always very attentive, and there are so many options for food!

There are several vegetarian and vegan options, for both breakfast and lunch/dinner. If you are (or aren't!) a vegetarian, try the Vegetarian Hash or the Meatless Loaf of the Gods. Both are insanely tasty and huge!

We arrived about 1 on a Saturday.  It was really busy as expected.  20 minute wait, but then we were seated in a nice booth.  Our server was great.  She offered suggestions and didn't seem rushed.

I had biscuits and gravy and two eggs.  Potatoes on the side.  My wife had oatmeal, a muffin and fresh fruit.  The biscuits were particularly good.  The gravy had some green pepper in it.  Not my favorite.  And the potatoes were overseasoned with something like a cajun spice.  Gut buster for me.

Overall, a really good lunch, fine service.  We'll return.

Oh yeah, dessert.  I had a hard time deciding between the strawberry rhubarb pie and the carrot cake.  The server assured me the carrot cake was fresh baked, not a frozen somewhere else dish.  I took it to go.  

Good choice.  Moist, full flavor.  Next time...the pie!

Came here for a pre-movie dinner with my girlfriend (who is vegan, I am not), and I was delighted by the cool, 50s-esque atmosphere of the building, and their commitment to serving all with their extensive vegan/vegetarian menu. We were able to both eat and be full for just under $20, so the prices were fair. Higher for the vegan items, but that's to be expected. I also enjoyed their commitment to serving local products in their food. The plates might not have been blue and I may not have gotten thousand island with my tofu Reuben, but that's excusable. The service was excellent and friendly. Would come back.

My husband and I came here on the recommendation of an employee of the hotel we stayed at. We were kind of excited, because the person who recommended it seemed pretty cool and knowledgeable. And he may very well be knowledgeable in a lot of things, but I'm not sure food recommendations should be one of them.

My husband does not recall what he had, but I had the "Scrambled Something or Other" (I think that's the name?) It was so-so but nothing to write home about. The coffee was pretty "meh," as was the service. Also, our table and the tables around us were kind of messy and... gross.

Not feeling it. Probably wouldn't come back.

Moderately long wait, but what an adorable place! Got and split corned beef hash and the salmon hash and a bloody.. whew! Delish! Very different and yet amazing. Great service too.

Need to come back and get the boozy milkshakes and the cake!

Pro tip: free iced tea refills!

I always associate this place with the airport in Madison; I always eat here either when I arrive or when I leave. It's a greasy spoon kind of institution, but done really well. As an example, biscuits and gravy is one of those dishes that's good just about anywhere, but Monty's manages to kick it over the top by including marinaded peppers or the like that give it a little extra flavor. All of the dishes are like that: fresh ingredients, nicely spiced and seasoned, etc. The prices are also very reasonable, so you basically get the low prices of a typical diner, but the food is actually really good.

Honestly, the only downside seems to be the wait for seating: I don't think I've ever gotten a table right away, but I can't fault them for being popular.

The food was ok! Prices were reasonable. I got the almond French toast. It was simple, came with a side of fruits. Coffee was really strong and just what I needed for the morning. My boy friend got the steak hash. It was alright for the price, nothing special! Would I come back for breakfast? Nope!

If your vegetarian or not you will LOVE this place...  I think they put crack in their food its so good! I like everything here, but I take it to go.. I hate being the creep lone diner - no Table for One ... There is on weird waiter I must admit but the food is so good .... I like their hash and their tofu scramble ...

This place is cool, I went today after a horrible experience at bassett..... I had the scrambler it had pesto feta mushrooms and came with potatoes and a biscuit, oh mylanta do these fuckers know what they're doing. The plate was absolutely stunning I had to fight myself not to order a second. I skipped the dessert case but I definitely took a gander and it looks like they know what they're doing there too. Coffee sucks though.
I always try and get here at least once when I go to Madison.  The food is always good.  I love the tofu scramble.  A great mix of traditional diner food with some great healthy alts.

Going to Monty's can feel like coming home. The place is warm and welcoming, the booths tall and spacious, staff gracious, coffee poured and refilled to your heart's delight... They're not reinventing the wheel with most of the menu but the breakfast dishes hit the spot, especially if they come with a warm, buttery biscuit. The GLBT (guacamole, lettuce, bacon, tomato) sandwich is the BEST. (Caveat: you might need to drink a gallon of water afterwards.) But really, it's a tremendous place. And you can ogle the pies and cakes on your way in or out.

The great thing about this diner is the diversity of the menu. There's tons of options to choose from so it's hard not to find something that you like.

I'm guessing that it was just a fluke, but my biggest complaint was that the diner was cold! It was colder inside than it was outside. My wife and I (the people at the tables around us) had to wear our jackets the whole time. I had to scarf down my food, only couple minutes after arriving at the table it was already getting cold.

I ordered the Wisconsin Salmon Hash and it was pretty good. I was expecting a nice fillet of fish with my hash, but the salmon was pretty skimpy. Small pieces scattered throughout. It came with some pineapple, melon and a biscuit. The fruit was fresh and complimented the hash well. The biscuit wasn't bad but would have been much better if it had been served warm.

5 starts for being one of the few places I have ever been that has full on, decked out vegan breakfasts!  No wimpy smoothies or oatmeal here.  I'm talking tofu scramble and vegan hash.  I'm in love...

Monty's is a great place to go if you like breakfast. Service is friendly and I didn't wait very long for a despite going on a Sunday morning.
The portion size is generous and coffee + free refills is inexpensive!
I ordered Sweet Potato Hash and enjoyed it!

My classmate recommended this place to me and I recommend it to all of you!

Great food! I've gone here a few times and have never been dissatisfied. The first time was before a show across the street, it was busy for sure! We were seated promptly and our server was friendly. I ordered a wrap and fries. Pretty great! The second time was more recently and it was a great time. No line, no wait. The server was slow but the food was amazing! I got the veggie meatloaf with mashed potatoes. This was to die for! I've never had something like this and it was flavorful, creamy, and delicious. The food came out in a timely manner, which was great. We sat for awhile until it got busy. The overall experience was good. This dinner feel reminded me of Middleton's famous restaurant. This one is right up there, and I will definitely go back!
Won best greasy spoon in Madison, yet has vegan options and bean salad as an alternative to fries! Yes, a great retro diner, but with modern options. And a dessert case. Awesome!

I have been going to Monty's for years and I have always had the same thing to say:  the service sucks.

The food is okay, I mean, it's a diner.  There is a wide variety of vegetarian options which is nice.  I also have to mention that I won't be eating here again soon as they have very recently taken my 2 favorite items off the menu; the tuna steak sandwich, and the cajun chicken sandwich.  The cumin chipotle mayonnaise on the tuna sandwich was one of the only reasons I would even still go to Monty's.

The service is always terrible.  you can count on a long wait for your waiter to take your order, for them to bring your drinks, and your food, and the longest wait of all is always for the check.  I have contemplated a dine and dash many times.  I counted the minutes one time, and it was 45 minutes from the time I finished eating to when the check came.  It wasn't because the waitress didn't see me from behind the counter either, she was talking to another server.  Once, I was eating with a friend, and we were waiting for 15 minutes to even have our waiter come to the table, so we just left.   Believe me, the service being slow is never because there isn't enough servers or too many diners.   

The food is decent, but it's not great by any means. It is still pretty okay, although I've had some bad meals.  The meatless meatloaf is only saved by the cashew gravy, and the salmon cakes are awful.  The tuna sandwich was really good, but the size and bun has changed over the years, and recently been replaced by 3 kinds of pastrami sandwiches.   The grilled chicken salad is good, as is the feta dill burger.

I'm doing my due diligence and belatedly reviewing some of the restaurants that have treated me well as a resident of Madison, and Monty's is one of the best. I discovered Monty's when they had a food cart on the Library Mall a couple years ago. Though I sadly haven't seen it there since, that was where I was first introduced to their sublime meatloaf sandwich, their amazing Just Coffee Co-Op coffee (a big plus, for those of you from outside the area, some of the best coffee in town and they're ethically sound to boot), and their donuts. Oh, the donuts.

Soon after repeated good experiences at the cart, I visited their location across town. Monty's has become my standby breakfast and lunch recommendation to anyone who comes into the area, and I've been there with family multiple times. To begin with, there are the donuts. Fluffy, fresh, and perfect for dunking in the awesome coffee. Then there's the biscuits. They come with many of the breakfast dishes and they are mouth-wateringly awesome, particularly with a little butter and honey.

But the main event is even better than the side dishes. Monty's offers some of the most vegan and vegetarian friendly choices in town short of the straight up veggie restaraunts. They use fresh, local ingredients, and that adds up to some of the best eating you can get in the area. While I recommend their breakfast sandwich heartily, my real suggestion for an egg lover at breakfast time is their Eggs Mornay. It's the best Benedict-like dish I think I've had anywhere. Savory sauce that's not too heavy, and, that most important of things - perfectly cooked eggs with slightly runny yolks. Basically anything I've had has been amazing.

If you can't tell already, I'm a bit of an evangelist for Monty's, but I can't help it. It was one of my first great foodie experiences in town, and I keep on coming back for just that reason. Keep in mind that they are well-loved and busy, so I recommend getting their early, particularly on Sundays for breakfast, but I've never waited longer than 20 minutes to sit down. The awesome retro ambiance and neon appliance sculpturing are just added bonuses, as are the super cute waiterati of both genders who've given great, speedy, professional service every time I've gone. Go to Monty's. You'll be a happier person for it.

Tried this place for the first time. The food was great and filled me up which normally doesn't happen when I eat out. The waitress Peach was really friendly and very attentive to our table. Will definitely make a return trip here for a 2nd round.
Friendly staff and nice selection of vegetarian options.  Food is just okay, not great.  Makes me wonder why everyone likes Food Fight so much.

Shut your mouth!  Meatloaf of the Gods!  There are three types of meat rolled into this meatloaf.  It comes with a red wine gravy, mashed potatoes and veggies.  All of this for $10.  Yup, a complete, well-rounded, mouth watering meal for just $10.  

The broccoli was blanched rather than steam.  So it was not mushy.  

The service is incredible.  The people are friendly and the food comes up fast.  I have nothing but good things to say.  On a date?  With family?  Have a small child?  Check this place out.  

They get desserts from a local bakery.  The carrot cake is ridiculous.  Are you full from your meal?  Take cake or pie to go.  Seriously, you will not regret a snack for later.

Tried this place a second time, as we had out of town guests who wanted breakfast, but it was after 1 PM (late sleepers). Food was a bit better this time, but the service was atrocious. I'd skew my review more towards three stars on this visit. Basically, I still think this place is a bit overrated but it's a decent place for breakfast or lunch- IF you can find a time to get in when it's not too busy.

Adorable decor.  This diner has history and a lot of character.

Excellent, knowledgeable and experienced waitress Jennifer recommended the vegan Indian vegetable curry with rice, and I liked her recommendation.  The coconut-flavored sauce was very tasty and extremely filling.  I wish the dish had less rice and more vegetables.

Went here for the first time and we loved it!! 

My husband and I are vegan and finding places to eat without just ordering a salad and fries is very difficult. For our anniversary, he scouted out some Madison vegan/vegetarian-friendly places and this restaurant's menu compelled me to pick it for our date. Why else we loved Monty's:

-Plenty of parking available (in their own lot) in what I thought may be a crammed downtown area
-Delicious menu of breakfast served all day, sandwiches, and desserts (regular or veg/vegan friendly!!)
-friendly staff
-FAST service--we waited maybe 10 min for our food
(He ordered a sandwich with fries and I ordered banana walnut pancakes) with water refills
-Reasonable prices (a dinner bill at $20?!)
-Cute diner feel 

Even though this place is a bit of a drive for us, we will be back!

I picked Monty's for dinner because I was on the road with a co-worker and had no idea what his taste in food might be.  I go for healthy and/or veg fare whenever I can, and since Monty's has an extensive vegetarian section on its menu as well as traditional diner dishes, I figured we'd both be happy.  

And we were!  My dish was roasted vegetables with spinach, quinoa, and fresh mozzarella which I liked but found a little oily (too much dressing).  It was also not quite enough food for me, and I don't have a big appetite to begin with.  Co-worker had some sort of turkey dinner that he liked enough that he trusted me to pick the restaurants we ate at for the rest of the week.

Service was ok but there was a bit of a wait for a table.  The wait was worth it, though, and I'd definitely be a regular here if I lived in Madison.

Friday night in Wisconsin and we couldn't resist the fish fry. It didn't disappoint. Fast, flavorful, perfectly crisp and just the right amount of food. I love that they have a local beer selection on tap and in bottles. Service was attentive and friendly. While waiting, we had the opportunity to observe their operations and I was suprised. The man that appeared to be the manager or owner, was helping in any way that he could. I think we watched him take reservations, run water, bus tables, greet guests, seat guests, basically anything to help offer excellent customer service. The highlight was the PIE! Oh my! I had a slice of oreo deliciousness that rocked my world! Light and fluffy with an oreo cruble crust and a huge slice. I savored that one piece three times! Worth every calorie! I can't wait to go back and try others dishes! 

Oh and they also have an extensive vegan menu if that's your thing.

I've never been even remotely let down by Monty's.  Is it busy a lot?  Yes.  Are you probably going to have to wait 30 minutes to sit down?  Yes.  Is the service slow because it's so busy?  Yes.  I've never been under the impression that the service is slow because they're incompetent, but just because they're busy.  Besides that, I've never noticed it being *especially* slow... just kind of slow, which doesn't really bother me.

Let me take a moment here to recommend the Meatloaf Sandwich: Get it served cold.  Just trust me here.  Do not get it hot.  I've had it served both ways: Cold, it is a sandwich so delicious that fireworks go off in your head; Warm, it is an open-faced abomination with gravy and mashed potatoes poured all over it.

Their cheeseburger was surprisingly good (I'd even go so far to say that it's one of the best burgers I've had in Madison).  They had a special entree one evening, "Cheeseburger Mac & Cheese," which was out of this world.  It really tasted like a cheeseburger over noodles!  They serve a great chef salad, have awesome spicy waffle fries, and I would die 100 times over for the buttermilk biscuits they serve with breakfast.  Their expansive dessert case is as tasty as it is impressive looking.

I was beyond sold on this place one time when I ordered a piece of german chocolate cake for dessert.  It wasn't a piece so much as it was a towering slab.  It was so tall, in fact, that it wasn't until I'd eaten enough of it that I noticed that the waiter (who was wearing a mohawk and kilt) had written, "Das ist Deutsch" in chocolate on the plate.  

I've had questionable service twice: Once was when I reserved a pie for a dinner I was going to and they did not have it when I got there, but tried to placate me by selling me a larger, more expensive pie.  That was after I approached the counter and saw several staff members stare at me for 20 minutes before I was finally helped.  The other time was when I was there for coffee and dessert with friends, and we paid with a card.  The waiter told us, upon picking up the card, "You know, if you can, you should really give me my tip in cash.  We don't see it on our paychecks for another 2 weeks otherwise."  Um...thanks for the advice on how we should tip you.  How about we don't tip you at all?

But those two experiences aside, nothing has been able to lessen my love of Monty's and all its glory.

I hate to admit this because I fear the stone throwing that will occur, but I'm just not a fan of Monty's food.  Madisonites love this diner and I certainly understand its charm.  Its interior is quaintly decorated with very much a 50s diner feel. There's a pie and cake display case up front.  They're always popular for brunch on the weekends.  Service is friendly and this is a great neighborhood spot. 

BUT, I've yet to have anything from Monty's that I like.  I've been there many many times, for brunch, for lunch, and for dinner, and each time, I've been disappointed in the food.  I really want to like this place, but I seem to be unable to find a dish on the menu that keeps me coming back.  

My most recent visit was with a friend from out of town.  I ordered their pozole which was an item I hadn't seen before on their menu and it sounded intriguing.  But when it came out, I was disappointed.  I found the chunks of pork a bit tough, the dish heavy on the hominy and the dish itself lacking in flavor.  It felt one noted.  It wasn't bad; it just wasn't for me.  I was really hoping that this would be the dish I'd be excited to come back to Monty's for but I came away disappointed. 

I ate less than half of my dish but I decided that the rest wasn't worth a takeout box.  Unfortunately, this is how I often feel about Monty's food.
