The curry is amazing as well as the malts, pie and pretty  much everything else on the menu.  We live the atmosphere here too, reminds me of NYC style diners. Blue Plate is always busy, but you'll  always fi d a table. I highly recommend going  here any time of day. Great options and good service.

Tried this place based upon the Yelp reviews. My girlfriend & I had hamburgers. I also had a salad with the best 1000 island dressing I've ever had.  My girlfriend did not want onions and her burger came out with them. They quickly brought her a new one. We finished up with a huge Turtle sundae we shared. Caution: this sundae is not for only one person.

Our service was satisfactory and we arrived before the dinner rush (430pm), so seating was easy. At 6pm, the place had a significant queue, but it was a Saturday night and the Barrymore had an event. 

Overall, the fare, the cost and the atmosphere make this a must try.

Driving back from Wisconsin Dells to Illinois hungover and following a strict vegetarian diet, can be a little tricky. I hadn't been to Madison in a few years, so we decided to try a place in Madison (I also figured that they would be more likely  to have restaurants that cater to my needs). My boyfriend did some yelping, and shortly we were on our way to Monty's. There is a private lot which is always nice when you're in a busy city. We did not sit outside because it was a little chilly but the patio looked pleasant and relaxing with beautiful flowers. When you go inside the ambience is a funky little 50's diner with amazing looking pies. Even though the restaurant was crowded, we were able to get a table fairly quickly. As I opened up the menu, I almost died but before that I even thought of moving to Madison right away! There are so many vegetarian, vegan, gluten free options that it is the majority of the menu, which is so rare to find at a breakfast diner. We both ordered the sweet potato hash and it was to die for! Just what we needed that day! I wish there was another one in Illinois. My only suggestion is to serve the fruit on a separate plate instead of piling it all on one big plate, that makes the food messy and crowded.

We absolutely love this place!!!  We were in Madison Friday night for a show and breakfast is a must at Monty's...excellent service...superior food choices and amazing coffee!!!  Takes you back to the 50's and 60's with the decor!!!

We've eaten at Monty's a number of times and have always had good food there.   Service has also been good to excellent.   The veggie quesadilla is quite good.   Their prices are a little higher than we would like.
Bathroom and restaurant is very clean. 
When we are in the mood for something vegetarian Monty's is a safe bet.
I wouldn't really say I'm a fan but they do enough right to get 4 stars.

The Sweet Potato Hash breakfast is FAAAABulous!!!! The ambiance is great with the sweet, retro diner feel. I've popped in late mornings, during the week, and have gotten right in, no wait, fast service!! I love the bottomless cup of Joe...it's fair restaurant java, but always hot and always rapidly refilled! This place is hoppin' come the weekend, so plan well and expect a bit of a wait...but it's worth it!!!

I went to Monty's for brunch on a Saturday morning around 10:45am. Shockingly, there was not a long wait and the service was very quick and helpful. I loved the fun, 60's diner atmosphere, and the food was delicious. My brother had French toast, while I had the classic country breakfast. I highly recommend the biscuits; they are worth the calories! 
Even though it was brunch, we heard the pies were impeccable so we each tried a slice. We tried the chocolate malt and tin roof pies. Both were unbelievable! Do not leave without trying a slice of pie.
I have nothing but good things to say about this diner. I wish I lived in Madison so I could try their lunch and dinner menus (as well as try more pies, of course)!

My partner and I came with two friends who were from out-of-town. I had heard really good things about Blue Plate, and I wanted to try it out, but I wish we had left when we saw there was a wait.

We ended up waiting for a table for around 45 minutes. While waiting I had to use the restroom--disgusting. There was no soap in the dispenser, water all over the counter and floor, and paper towels crumpled everywhere. I realize this is largely because of the patrons, but you would expect somebody from the staff to pop in every once in a while to make sure everything is neat and in stock. 

When we finally got a table, service was rushed and impersonal. I was a little dismayed that a manager never came over to at least thank us for waiting for so long, but who knows if a manager was even there? It seemed totally chaotic and like nobody was in charge. Lunch was okay, but nothing special. I had an omelette that was pretty good, but the breakfast potatoes that it came with were soggy, and while some of the potatoes were heavily seasoned, others didn't have any seasoning on them whatsoever and tasted horribly bland. I also had to wait several minutes before I could even eat because the server who delivered the plates (not our server, who spent approximately two minutes at our table in total) brought everyone else's meals out first and left mine in the kitchen. 

Will not be back.

A few weeks back my brother and his wife were in town.  They are from the northeast where local diners are the place to go for breakfast. Monty's definitely received thumbs up from both of them.

Their comment, and pet-peeve about breakfast, is they want it fresh made.  Breakfast food is too easy to be mass-produced and set aside for reheating.  Everything we ordered tasted fresh and it was all piping hot.

I ordered the corn-beef hash (from a recommendation from my son who frequents on Sat mornings) with an over medium egg: delicious.  The over medium was runny enough to wet the hash and it all went together so well.  
Our coffees and soda never suffered during the visit. 
Parking was easy (I parked on the street on a Sunday morning)
Wait time was minimal

I will be back!

1st off, Breakfast all day 24/7. Who doesn't love that!
2nd, The pies selection is fantastic. I found out that they come from the Market Street bakery in Sun Prairie. Hats off to them!!!!! 
Burgers and dinner menu- Great home cooking! fresh well made food that gives mom's at home cooking a run for it's money! 
"If you are hungry for a great filling meal, just head to Monty's" is my new Motto. 

Love the huge parking lot! Easy in and out every time (if you can find a spot due to me being not the only other person loving this joint)
Wish they had later hours. They are only open to 10pm, which I'm kind of confused with considering they are directly across from the Barrymore theater. 
But...I still have a solid 5 stars for this new love of my life.

Visited this place on a rainy and relaxing weekend of typical Madison September. We had to wait 30 minutes to get seated so we just went out for a nice walk. When we came back, it was at the peak of lunch time and even though the place was crowded, it had a friendly and home-like atmosphere.

Food - the three of us all skipped breakfast on a Sunday so everyone wanted to get a breakfast dish, I had the blue plate special omelet, which came with bacon, mushroom, cheese, diced onions and green peppers, and even guacamole, accompanied with a biscuit and cooked potatoes. The serving size is great, I had to carry a third of it home. Everything tasted just like they should, with the guacamole/cheese melting in your mouth along with the soft texture of the egg, it was great.

Price - for the price we paid, I felt like this place is better than most other breakfast/lunch options in Madison. Definitely coming back one day to try out the other options (burgers for the most part) since I couldn't help but notice how delicious they looked when people around our table got them.

The only few inconvenient things about this place are: parking, if you come during brunch or lunch hours, don't expect to find a parking right away. They have a pretty small lot and the place tends to get very crowded. Also expect to wait up to half an hour before you can get seated...

They also don't accept American Express, which I find peculiar since most restaurants do.
I like Monty's! Great atmosphere, yummy desserts, and good burgers.

Monty's came onto my radar after reading an article that listed this Madison diner as home to the best milkshake in the state of Wisconsin (and the unofficial cocktail).  It made my Sunday brunch pickings pretty easy.

Some advice for fellow Monty's Brunch amateurs: 
(01) Come before 10:30 AM on a Sunday.  We were getting "the eye" by waiting customers by 11 AM.  This is a coveted spot for sure.
(02) Order breakfast "appetizers" to start aka a pecan roll and zucchini muffin.  Both tasted like home, which is the way baked goods should always taste.
(03) Include an order of potatoes with your main.  The seasoning makes them the best side.
(04) Don't fret about there not being options for your vegan friends.  There's an entire menu devoted to them.  In fact, four out of the five of us had either the vegan scramble or the zucchini pancakes.  Of the two, I would recommend the scramble.
(05) Decide on the salmon omelette if you want every bite to be a fishy bite.
(06) End your meal with a Fat Elvis milkshake aka the best in the state.  Vanilla ice cream blended with fresh banana, peanut butter, and chocolate sauce is the way to go, brunchy folks.

To sum it up, Monty's is a solid spot for Sunday brunch, and folks must save room for the Fat Elvis milkshake and a baked good or two!

My meal was just okay. Had the Chilaquiles. Not what I was expecting. My sister loved her biscuit and veggie scramble. our waiter was awesome and attentive. Think I'd go back and try another dish! 3 Madison motorcycle cops were in there eating. If the cops go there, you know the food is good.
One of my favorite breakfast places in Madison.  The salmon hash is a dream.  And Tim bakes the best biscuits in town!

Looking for a big, hearty breakfast? Then look no further because this place has got exactly what you're looking for (and for a pretty reasonable price). I went here with my friend after a night of *ahem* good old Madison weekend fun, and this was exactly what we needed. I got the eggs mornay, which has this sausage patty and poached eggs with this very nice sauce on top of an English muffin. And if that wasn't enough carbs for you, it comes with a generous helping of fried potatoes. Good stuff.

Also a random note: despite its appearance as an old fashioned diner, I got a very hipster-y vibe from it once I got in.

Monty's Blue Plate Diner is an overall good diner with a little bit of a hipster spin. They have good sandwiches and breakfast items you'd expect to see at a diner like burgers, montecristos, or french toast, but they also do a lot with vegetables to keep thing interesting like their sweet potato hash or the caponata and pesto omelet. They also feature a lot of classic dishes with international inspiration, and they bend over backwards to meet dietary restrictions. They have lots of pie and other desserts available, reminiscent of the late Bluephies (RIP). Throw in a full bar featuring boozy milkshakes, and you have a solid brunch spot if I've ever seen one.

I went with a salmon hash because i was in the mood for something different while still getting my hands one of their biscuits. I found the salmon scramble to have a tame amount of fishy salmon flavor that fits in well with the potatoes since they finely chop the potatoes and salmon into the same size. I was hoping for dill or some other herb, but I didn't notice any.

The biscuit was pretty nice. It's big, warm and pillowy with a relatively neutral flavor. I prefer a crusty, hard, and flaky biscuit, but this was nice and really satisfied my craving for a good biscuit.

Because of the gaudy display of desserts, I couldn't resist getting something sweet. I went with a sprinkle doughnut and a boozy mudslide milkshake. The doughnut was good enough; nothing amazing but not bad. The milkshake was pretty great. It's big and will probably give you a stomach ache from all that ice cream, but it's real good if you like tasting booze in your shake.

Overall, I didn't find Monty's to be a favorite, but I will probably be back for some boozy shakes at brunch.

The visit the bf and I made to Madison remains one of the epic tales of our relationship, maybe because Chicago annoys us so much.  Oh, Madison: the low sales tax.  The inexpensive street parking.  The street parking that becomes free at like 6pm.  The cool, liberal people, the delicious food everywhere.  I have a suspicion I've sighed over all of this in another yelp! review.  But I can't rave over this city enough.

Ah, the food.  A former professor of mine, who got her Ph.D. in Classics at UW, recommended this place for us.  Perfect, because we're a pair of frail little vegetarians who need to maintain a high level of soy (and ice cream and all other goodies) in our diet, and the Blue Plate Diner's menu does a great job of not only having veggie food, but food that was more interesting than 'grilled cheese' or 'house salad,' stuff that vegetarians are usually stuck with.

After getting lost as soon as we dumped our things in our B&B and getting into my car, we called this diner a few times, desperate for directions and food.  The girl who repeatedly answered the phone was very patient and very helpful.  I really appreciated it: driving in the dark in a new city isn't pleasant when you have no idea where you're going and you're starving and you have a hungry boy on your hands.

It's a typical diner, though it was surprisingly empty on a Friday night (though we were relieved to see it packed with hipsters when we drove by two days later), in that it had weird diner lighting and old-timey furniture and decor.  But the food!  I had a tofu scrambler and stole as much of my boyfriend's avocado-and-portobello sandwich as possible.  If I'd had room, I would have topped it off with a milkshake or something decadently diner-y like that.  Next time, next time.  Especially now that I'll know where I'm going the next time I'm in Madison.

I have been coming here since it was still Bob's Blue Plate dinner, which was almost thirty years ago now. The food is always great. 

For mains, they have old and new classics, and a good variety of things for omnivores, vegetarians, and vegans; so it's great if you have a group of people who are all on different diets. For desserts, everything is delicious and amazing. It can be hard, but save room for dessert if you can! It's worth it.

I've been to Monty's at least once for every meal. The omelettes are to die for, huge in quantity unique in ingredients- highly recommend the spinach and feta. The salads are the same thing, definitely large and delicious. Last night I went for dinner and got the meatless loaf, and now I want the recipe for the cashew gravy (if my memory serves me correctly, it was cashew...) to put on EVERYTHING. Amazing shakes and malts complete the perfect comfort/diner food experience.

Diner food for the younger generations. Everything is pretty yum, but I would just stay away from the salads. Salads at diners seem to always be a let down and Monty's is no exception. But seriously good stuff here. Pie and milkshakes mmmm

We stopped in here for breakfast Saturday morning and were lucky enough to have no wait. Our service was great and the menu is has a lot of great options! I had the sweet potato frittata and it was excellent! TONS of food!! My finance had the salmon hash and I snuck a bite, and that was just as delish. It was a great start to our day.

THANK YOU, LAURA (freshman year resident cool girl) for introducing me to Monty's all those years ago. Back in the day, I went often enough to know the staff by name and to have pretty much sampled the whole menu. The consistency is crazy. For having such a big and varied (vegan, vegetarian and uhh... carnivorous?) menu, everything I have ever tried has been really incredible.

They have options for everyone, sweet and savory breakfasts, filling dinners, boozy shakes and tons of delicious cakes and cupcakes. I usually just go for a sandwich, sometimes the Artichoke sandwich, or Farmer John's. My absolute favorite from back in my vegetarian days is the Meatless Meatloaf of the Gods. I would usually ask them to make it into a sandwich and they would do so, no problem. I've heard incredible things about their regular meatloaf, but I can't stop ordering the meatless version to ever get the real deal. They also have incredible sides. The Three Bean Salad is sooo addictive, the Mashed Potatoes with Cashew Gravy (!!!) is really comforting and their Waffle Fries... I could probably just order a plate of those fries and call it a day. Other must tries include the Brandy Alexander shake, biscuits with jam and honey and the zucchini/potato pancakes. 

The diner itself is always impeccable, very bright and clean. Choose a seat at the bar to get a glimpse into the kitchen or sit at one of the comfortable 6-person booths. The servers here are amongst the best, just really friendly and funny. They all seem like people I'd spend time with IRL, charming and personable. 

I will keep returning to Monty's whenever I have an excuse to visit Madison. At this point, I may not even need an excuse, Monty's is its own excuse.

Also-- check in here to get a free endless cup of jo!

Monty's Blue Plate Diner is my current breakfast based obsession in Madison. The atmosphere is delightful, food is well curated and prepared, and the prices are very affordable. Easily the most well rounded "American roots" style breakfast we've had around town so far.

We ended up at Monty's on a Saturday morning after the farmer's market because we didn't want to wait for a table at any of the downtown options. We walked in and immediately got a seat at the bar. If you're a Yelper make sure you check in to get a free bottomless coffee!

For a main course I ordered the sweet potato hash, which came with assorted fruit, a biscuit, and eggs cooked to your liking (scrambled with copious amounts of cheese please). The was cooked to perfection with just the right about of browning on it. The eggs were not wet or overcooked. The biscuit and fruit, well, you can't really mess that up. They were great too! The coffee was about what I expected from a diner. It wasn't Starbucks (don't you dare have that expectation, you Yelper-McSnooty face), but it got the job done.

Our service wasn't AMAZING, but it was acceptable. The diner was absolutely slammed at the time because it was brunch hour so I'll let it slide. I wasn't left waiting long enough that I was hangry, and my coffee was always topped off. As far as I'm concerned service gets a check-mark in satisfactory from me.

We enjoyed the meal so much that we returned Sunday morning for brunch with an out of town friend. The second meal I had almond milk French toast with cinnamon swirl bread. The toast was perfectly dipped and not soggy with the right level of crunch to it. Unfortunately, I was still quite hungry after this plate. The portion size seemed much smaller than that of the hash the day before.

I am looking forward to my return trips to Monty's for brunch, but we absolutely need to come back to try the pumpkin bourbon cocktail shake! Cheers!

As far as greasy-spoons go, this place is pretty good. If you're looking for gut-busting amounts of food you should go elsewhere. However, the food is all made on the spot and of decent quality. Fun menu for the whole family and the aesthetic is great.  Verging retro with some Madison flair.

Worth a try but Mickey's, Original Pancake House and Lazy Jane's edge out this place, in my opinion.

This is a great restaurant to go to in a charming neighborhood. Gramma in town? Take her, she loves home cooking! Post Critical Mass carbo load? Wheel on in! Conservative couple on 
the third date and need to fuel up before doing it for the first time? Jackpot! As a bonus: With it's proximity to the storied Barrymore Theater, it is not uncommon to dine amongst musical geniusii. 
Diner-esque feel and fare with lots of visual distractions (you may need them for the inevitable wait) You will more than likely hear screams of ecstasy after someone has the pie. Comfort food for the masses (Yes, you too my veggie sucking pals!) 

Hmmmmmmm. Do you like the idea good-looking salt of the Earth houseboys? Well, whomever does the hiring at Monte's does too. I have not seen one unattractive employee yet. Besides being beautiful, they are efficient in their positions. The waitstaff is friendly and quick, cooks have yet to fail my taste buds, and the bakers make some of the yummiest cakes in the state. 

For maximum food coma-ry, I'd recommend the (fake)meatloaf w/cashew gravy, mashed potatoes, a mimosa chased with a piece of Fat Elvis cake. Remember you are in Wisconsin and you don't have to have any regard for caloric intakes any longer, and eat til you either pass out or essplode,no judgment. In fact the fake meatloaf/cashew gravy is so fabulous, that I have 
sent a mole into the kitchens of Monte's to snag the recipe. Yes, I am that powerful/desperate.

Tried this place out for the Food Fight Foodie Week and it's great diner food and gives you a good family-style feeling when you're there. Portions were super generous and filling! 

With 4, we family styled and tried a good selection:
Biscuits and gravy (standard, no complaints); Grilled Vegetable and Spinach Salad - very good and quite interesting as a hot salad, but I thought the lemon vinaigrette and grilled veggies made the dish quite oily; Meatloaf of the Gods and The Ultimate Mac and Cheese - can't go wrong with either, both yummy! 

Dessert was stellar with French silk pie, Mississippi Mud pie, Fat Elvis Shake, and Silver Dollar Pancakes (switched blueberries for chocolate chips)! If you must get one I recommend the Mississippi pie!

Parking is a little bit of a pain and service was friendly but should be weary to not give out plates so quickly for a 3-course meal and time it out.

We were able to sit outside, on a perfect night. The server was great and very attentive despite having to cover the 6 tables outside. But enough about that, let's get to the food! It was fantastic! I don't normally eat vegetarian dishes but I decided to to try the "Meatless Meatloaf". I am so glad it did. It was very flavorful and the sauce had a nice peautnutty taste. The mashed potatoes were rustic style with the skins and very creamy and a very generous serving of broccoli was on the plate as well. My mom had the curry and I tried that and it was super yummy with a nice kick at the end. We were full after our meal so we did not get to try the desserts/malts but everything looked amazing when it came to the other tables. If we lived near by we would be back and I will be suggesting to others that they go here! It is a must do in Madison!

This place is cheap. Luckily, cheap does not mean crap here. I love the diner feel of this place - it makes me feel like I'm inside a Hopper painting. I had a giant plate of meatloaf, and it was not at all bad. Their sundaes are also enormous, so consider yourself warned. I will be going back for sure and will update this review as I explore more of their menu.

I could have sworn I wrote a review?

anyhoo...

went here on the suggestion of a few vegheads.  they used to have vegan milkshakes & ice cream... sadly, no more :(

dinner was tasty, though-- heathen vegan shoplifter sandwich & cherry pie!!! nothing Earth-shattering, but solid. 

and probably one of your vegan best options in Madison.

Abundant vegan options, even for breakfast!  Food is above average, service was great, prices really low.

The sweet potato hash with tofu scramble was especially good.

One of my Madison favorites.  Always something new to try.  Good staff, offbeat atmosphere, great service and food.  However I will note that not everyone I bring here has enjoyed their food... I think I talked it up too much.

We tried this place out for the first time on a Saturday in March. From the reviews I had read on here, I knew there would be a short wait. I think we waited about 20-30 minutes (which was a little longer than i was expecting). Unfortunately there was no good place to wait either.  We constantly felt we were standing in someone's way. The wait did give us a chance to admire their beautiful looking pies, which we did not have room to try after we had lunch. 
When it was our turn, someone called our names over a microphone and then told us  where to go sit. We found our seats and waited for the waiter. There were 3 menus at the table so we were able to start looking through what they had to offer. The waiter came and took our drink order but never brought us a fourth menu. He also never introduced himself. 
After looking over the entire menu the only thing that really jumped out at me was their milk shakes and ice creams. Nothing else really jumped out at me and made me think "Oh wow that is really different and sounds really good?". I think it is a good basic breakfast place to those who are vegetarians or gluten free! But for the rest of us it isn't anything spectacular. I had an omelette which was fine, though the biscuit that came with it was tasty. My friend had asked the waiter for a refill on his water which never came and my coffee never got refilled until we had finished eating after all the dishes and utensils were taken away so i couldn't stir my cream or sugar. 


To sum things up:
This place was just an average diner that didn't have a wow factor to anything.
Would be a good place for those seeking vegetarian/gluten free options and are just wanting  "normal/ordinary" breakfast/lunch options.

I would not venture back for a second time.

Its a great place.  Both me and my wife thought it had a great summer feel in the 50s.  What's nice about it is that it has a Madison vegetarian twist.  If we would've been hungrier the pies looked amazing but our bellies had reached their capacity.

Overall quality, its traditional american diner feel w/ a twist of Madison.  Great spot for a sit down lunch on a road trip.

I haven't been to Monty's for a while, but when I am there, I typically have my regular standbys that I enjoy - their burgers, their waffle fries (with a side of ranch, of course), their chocolate shake, and their breakfasts (served ALL day).

However, last night I was all about trying new things. Standbys be damned! So I ordered the Meatloaf Stacker sandwich (open face) with the gravy on the side (I'm not a big gravy fan) with their always fabulous waffle fries and an Oreo shake instead of Chocolate. Here's how it went down:

~ Sandwich: The meatloaf was good - fairly moist with a nice full flavor profile (wise addition of sausage). The mashed potatoes were dry and needed seasoning so I pulled those off and skipped them altogether. The sprinkling of fried onions on top was brilliant both flavor & texture-wise.

~ Waffle fries:  SO GOOD - ALWAYS!!!!!! Enough said.

~ Oreo shake:  It was delicious with lots of real Oreos. And I love that they give you the extra shake in that metal blending cup - so old school, so classy. I only wish they made their shakes just a bot thicker so it didn't get liquidy so quickly. Side note: if I had it to do over again, I would have gotten the chocolate shake instead as it's not quite as sweet at the Oreo, but hindsight.......

I want to end with acknowledging how much I appreciate the great customer service at Monty's.  I've enjoyed our servers each time I've been there. Last night was no different. Peach was our server and she was wonderful - attentive & fun & complimentary (she liked my purple glasses) and she totally lived up to her name.....she was a real peach. ;o)

Awesome! Awesome! Awesome! The only problem is that they were overfilled and we had to sit outside. We ordered takeout and ate it outside. The guy at the front, kind of served us like we ordered inside. My wife LOVED the meatloaf and the grilled cheese for my children looked outstanding. I had the Cobb Salad and it was good. I would have liked more dressing, but no complaints. I love this place and will return for breakfast in a few weeks, which is better than awesome.
Great cocktails and beers on tap and good diner breakfast options. Meat eggs veg and other options widely available.

Every time I go there it's just so mediocre. I don't know what anyone likes about this place. There's just nothing good about it, other than its food and it will keep you from starving. That's not what I want to pay for.

The service is excellent, the atmosphere a time capsule of a 50s diner & the food is some of the best diner fair I've ever had. 

The Meatloaf is called the "Meatloaf of the Gods," and it truly is. I don't even like Meatloaf and I literally savored each bite of this culinary masterpiece. It is extremely filling because it is made with nutrient rich local meat, savory vegetables & topped with the best gravy I've ever tasted. Yum!  For $10, how can't it be "As good as it gets?"

If you like pie, also make sure to get a slice. It is delicious!

I was disappointed with my experience, but I'm willing to give it another shot.

The main problem was our waiter. We had very slow service. We were seated outside and had to go in to ask for our menus. I ordered coffee and half-and-half, but I didn't get a spoon or something to stir it with, which I thought was odd. I just kind of swished it around... It was weird.

Our waiter failed to tell us the scrambler special and when we asked he told us it was artichoke, tomato and asiago. However, when it arrived the artichokes were not there. It was very disappointing. The breakfast potatoes were also a real let down. I love potatoes and they failed. However, the biscuit was delicious. 

We also ordered pie. Two of our party ordered the Fat Elvis - which does not come in a pie-form - so they were upset. Their other waiter must have made that mistake. I went for the key lime pie which was delicious. The Fat Elvis was replaced with a drumstick (?) which I guess was good, but I don't like peanut butter. 

Another thing is if you sit outside, they will give you plastic silverware. I didn't mind, but others in my party did. Also, they only take Visa and Mastercard. 

Overall, the food was good, but the service was not. Andrew K attempted to show off his humor ("Elvis has left the building"), but we found it rather obnoxious because we were sick of waiting. I'll give him some slack because there were a lot of people seated outside, but I feel he could have paid a bit more attention.

To prepare for this amazing meal, I made sure I took 2 Lactaid pills and ordered dairy-delicious, dairy-packed meals. I was well prepared and so so satisfied.

We arrived as a group of 8 on a Sunday morning. Though we had to wait a long time, the wait was pleasant because we were able to sit outside, and the hostess announced tables through a loud speaker. As soon as we sat down, we were immediately greeted and served drinks. Very fast, very reliable service.

I ordered the sweet potato hash with the bloody mary, and I shared my boyfriend's meal of the breakfast burrito and Porter shake. Porter shake: gigantic and amazing. They served the shake in a glass with whatever was leftover (including leftover porter) separately. So there was so much shake and then some to share. My bloody mary was spicy and savory, and delicious, but also a standard tasting bloody mary. Sweet potato hash: amazing. I will be coming back for this plate. Only complaint: I wish they served me the side of potatoes or bacon instead of fruit. Such a heavy meal deserves a heavy side (at least, that's what I believe).

Everyone's order arrived on time and amazingly made. No complaints, and absolute happiness and satisfaction all around. I will definitely be back.

What can I say? Tempeh tempeh tempeh, tempeh and eggs, tempeh and French toast, tempeh lettuce and tomato, tempeh is amazeballs. Beyond that this my fav for food fight, been coming here for several decades. I love it.

Here's another one:
Tempeh in the morning,
Tempeh in the evening,
Tempeh at supper time,
When you eat at Monty's
You can have Tempeh anytime!

Favorite late night pie fix. Anytime of the day breakfast option. For me it's a toss up between the Blue Plate Burger and Chicken in a pie, but lots of vegetarian option if that's what you NEED! Love the wait staff.

We went here because we have several vegetarians in the family, so there is something for everyone as they have very carnivorous meals as well. Be prepared for a long wait, often 30+ minutes.  The good news is they give you coffee while you wait.

Service is exceptionally wonderful: friendly and attentive.  I had the special of the day which was biscuits and gravy with a couple of eggs (see photo below).  The eggs were perfectly cooked, the potatoes were flavorful and the gravy was thick and savory.  The biscuits were just OK, I thought they could have been bigger and flakier.  My food also came out about 5 minutes after everyone else which was a little uncomfortable.

Everyone else thought their meal was excellent, especially the pie we had for brunch dessert!

Great place if you are OK with crowds and a wait.

The "ultimate mac & cheese" really is the ultimate. I don't know how to make mac & cheese with caramelized onions in it yet, but I will learn, dammit, because I have seen the LIGHT. The accompanying grilled garlic bread was alright, but a little chewy for my taste - I'm more of a Texas-toast-crusty-garlic-bread kinda girl.

Also, be SURE you get something sweet. It might feel weird to order a donut or a shake with a savory lunch or dinner meal, but you can't leave without it. Just trust.

I had something to celebrate and hadn't been able to eat meat since watching a food documentary a few weeks prior, so Monty's seemed like the appropriate celebratory location.  I ordered their special: teriyaki tofu with peas, coconut, peppers and peanuts, served with a side of fresh pita.  The description was a little clunky--there were other ingredients in the dish description that I've since forgotten--and I got a kick out of listening to the waitress explain it to other patrons.  During a short wait, I sipped a heavenly hot chocolate.  My husband isn't a hot chocolate fan but agreed that it was really, really good.  FYI: they'll make it with soy milk if you ask.  After the food arrived it took me two seconds to realize that the tofu was the best I'd ever tasted.  Tender, flavorful, caramelized on the outside.  The sauce was a little saltier than I prefer, but still quite good.  The pita had good texture and a nice, buttery taste.  My husband enjoyed the traditional-type burger he ordered.  Our only disappointment is that we didn't save room for dessert.

Other observations:
-Going early helped avoid parking lot anxiety--they get Busy here.
-Our red-haired waitress was friendly, intelligent, and overall awesome.  Noting that I had ordered soy milk hot chocolate, she advised that the teriyaki tofu meal is prepared with a small amount of dairy.
-Staff brought water to a puppy who was sitting outside with his humans.

Got a burger, fries, and a shake. Stay away from the burgers. They're springy and dense and remind me of rubber. Tasteless, also. The fries were delicious! The shake was amazing. So if that's all you want, then you're in good shape! They had a nice variety of pies but I was too stuffed to get any.

This place is always excellent.    I've never left unhappy.    Even amongst so many good offerings in Madison, this diner stands out.   Plan your arrival carefully though, as there is often a long wait for tables.

This place has the best atmosphere and freshest food I have ever had!!! Please mark this spot on you "to do list" -the staff is super friendly and the food makes us think we are at grandmas house! I got the Zucchini potato pancakes (an awesome breakfast idea) and she got the blue plate omelet -fantastic!!
Be sure to say hello to Sarah ! she rocks! She Has the best personality that we have come across yet!! 
Much love -E&A
WE WILL BE BACK!
Service was great and I like the atmosphere but I wouldn't say it's anything special (except for the the shakes and meatloaf - fit for the gods for sure!).

Absolutely amazing... 100% real food, and a menu that can fit almost any dietary need! My partner had the meatloaf (with luscious broccoli--- try saying that in the same sentence), superb homemade gravy, and real mashed potatoes with the skins on them... I had the Cobb salad, and if you are a foodie, you know that Cobb salad is a dangerous thing to put on a menu--- it is difficult to execute properly, and this was perfect. We will be back, again, and again, and again... wish we had found this years ago!

Impressive diner menu! Having a handful of quality Wisconsin beers on hand is always nice. Everything our server suggested was a great dish, especially the avocado BLT & the meatloaf. Although, the grilled cheese was like none I'm ever had. I think it had like 4-5 cheeses.

Blue plate omelette was delish, with avocado, pan fried potatoes and homemade biscuits. We also had the almond milk French toast. To top it off, local coffee, ground fresh with each pot! Must stop again.
Had the corned beef and sweet potato hash which were delicious! The coffee was great as well ;-)

Monty's is getting two stars, because meh...

I've been here 4-6 times, because people like it so much and I go for social reasons, but every time, meh...

I've tried something new every time, but I have yet to find something that is worth the calories.
It's all fine, but not special at all. 

The best thing I can say is, if you are hungry and you need food, this place has food.

May be I'm ordering the wrong thing, but with 4+ tries under my belt, I think me and Monty are just not a good match.

What I've tried:
WISCONSIN SALMON HASH
BREAKFAST BURRITO
CORNED BEEF HASH
MONTY'S CRISTO- will give that this was decent, but very greasy
MEATLESS LOAF OF THE GODS
+ maybe 1-2 more things that I can't even remember

best breakfast place in Madison.  I've been many many many times and it's delivered every single time.  Montys breakfast sandwich with the goat cheeseeeee mmmm so good.  And the biscuits and gravy... I could drink that gravy by itself and it would be satisfied.  Bravo.

Oh my gosh. This is the best place in Madison. I'm from out of town and I got excited when my friend told me about it. 

I'm a breakfast gal and they serve breakfast ALL DAY here! I was so happy! 

I got the Saturday Special. Biscuits and Fire-Roasted pepper gravy with two eggs over medium, a side of bacon and potatoes. 

Amazing. Every bite was mouth watering. See pictures. My friends and I split a banana cream pie and it was also sooooo good. Every bite. I wish I got my own slice. Haha. 

I wanted to try everything on the menu. Vegan friendly. Kid friendly. Milk shakes. Breakfast, great music. Outdoor seating. Countertop. What more could you ask for with this diner? 

Service was also EXCELLENT. 

Enjoy!

This place is awesome!  Come in the morning, Donovan is the best server ever.  The pancakes are great.  The corned beef hash is even better.  I've also had the sweet potato hash, donuts, French toast and they were all great.

My server wasn't good.  The coffee wasn't the best.  My fresh toast wasn't even cooked all the way. The eggs that they dipped the bread in to make it French toast was still runny!!!! I couldn't even eat it so I asked for a fruit platter but my waitress wasn't even paying attention to the table so I had to ask someone else who was just a bus boy.  She brought it out and then brought out the dip ten minutes later saying it was the cooks first day..... what ?!

There's nothing I can add to the reviews here other than to say this is truly a five star diner.  

5 star exterior, 5 star interior, 5 star clean bathrooms
5 star cheery cool and efficient people who work there
5 star artichoke salad with a 5 star "side" bean salad that you could take home and have for lunch the next day: it's BIG!

5 star shakes and burgers and other old school diner food in addition to all the 5 star new wave veggie & organic options

Next time I'm in Madison I'd like to try it for breakfast.
good diner food with lot's of tasty vegetarian options and with pie or cheesecake for dessert...

Best. Place. EVEEER. 
been going there for years and never had a single bad experience. everytime I go there i have higher expectations and they are always met. People here go out of their way to make sure that you like your food, waiters know evrything that goes on a sandwich down to the ingredients of the dressing. Best of all the prices are very reasonable and the atmosphere is so Willy-like. 
do yourself a favor and try the veggie sandwich, your life will never be the same again! I pretend not to like meatloaf but if someone I'm with orders it, I make sure they don't have any leftovers. that's how good this place is...
The building is amazing and the chow is better. Big portions of made with pride breakfasts. Beware! A slice of carrot cake serves two or more.

I love this place! The atmosphere, the food, and the staff are all great!! I highly suggest trying their breakfast - they serve it all day (: They also have incredible pies and other various bakery items!

While I still contend that most places in Madison with diner in the title are not, in fact, diners, I will say that Monty's is a delicious retro-themed restaurant. I tend to order the same thing (turkey club) because it's got real meat and I'm a sucker for a good sandwich. My dinner mate got the biscuits and gravy special and it had a definite twist on it that made the gravy reddish with a zip. 

I always want to order dessert when I come in, but am always too full. My last trip was on Pi Day, and while I picked Monty's specifically because I wanted pie, I was disappointed that on my one trip with dessert as a priority they were completely sold out. Better for my health, certainly, but a disappointment nonetheless - why do you have to look so delicious, dessert case?! I guess I'll just have to head back again and maybe start dessert first.

Sweet potato hash is fantastic!  The tofu scramble has a bit of a spicy kick and is a great option for vegans.  In fact, their veg dishes are just plain good. Service is very friendly and their cheesecake is very creamy and delicious.
Wonderful.  I am a vegiterian with meat eating and vegan friends.  They have menus for everyone.  They even have vegan brownies. Everyone loved their meals. Staff is friendly and attentive

I wanted to really like this place. The esthetic was vary chill and retro. The guy at front of house was plenty friendly, but things went downhill from there. I can understand, just getting out of a lunch rush, that a server might be tired, but ours wasn't super personable at all. Don't get me wrong, she attended to the table, but you could tell her mind was elsewhere. What really went wrong was when I ordered the vegan sweet potato hash. It looked awesome and tasted pretty good, until I tasted ham. I stopped chewing and in napkin was a chunk of ham as well as another chunk hidden further in the hash. I told the serve and showed her the pieces. I told her that I didn't really want anything in replacement because it had spiked some disordered fears for me. She took the plate away but offered no real apology for the mistake. I'm glad that she didn't charge me for my meal... However she still charged me for my coffee.... I know shit happens... But it sucks when your out from Oregon and you can't even get a decent vegetarian meal without having to worry.

I didn't particularly care for the food, but I loved the length of the vegan menu and I can't wait to come back and try the rest of it, even if it is just to be disappointed.

We waited for about a half hour and were seated likely as the last Friday rush made its way out. I had the sweet potato hash. I couldn't taste much besides the sweet potato, and even that was masked by the heavy spices added to the top. I wouldn't order it unless you're really into hash. The apple pie à la mode was solid (as in yummy, but also as in not runny). Prices were good, service was attentive. Remember to check in with Yelp to get a free coffee!

Came here with the gf after a crappy brewery tour. Great good. Got a mushroom n swiss burger that was very tasty. Love these diner type places. Not sure I'll be back as I live in MKE but if I'm ever in the area and have a craving, I'll be sure to stop back.
Been here many times with the wife and kids. Always great service and food.  My kids especially like the special cookies.  A great place for any meal.
Great breakfast.  Outdoor seating in the summer is very nice. They have good pie too!  Though it's a diner, the food is more than greasy spoon.

A late night dessert run with my pregnant bestie led to a Monty's revelation:
They now serve (organic, classy) Sassy Cow ice cream, have even nicer and more delectable cheesecakes and their brownie sundae puts the Ella's Sparkled Kazoo to shame. 

Post-brownie sundae, bestie's baby to-be kicked. 

I think it was the hot fudge.

I love Monty's. The atmosphere is kitschy and cool, and they have something for everyone (even the vegetarians and picky eaters).

The wait can be a little on the excessive side, so don't hold off until you're hungry. 

I never manage to save room for dessert, but I hear the pies are excellent.
Why people like this place is beyond me. My food was flavorless and was clearly not cooked with care. I got the impression that there are some serious issues in the kitchen.

This is one of my least favorite Food Fight locations-- ok, except for Cooper's, which I really hate-- although I think that might have something to do with the fact that I've never had breakfast here. The breakfasts that I've seen coming out look really tasty. 

+ A very nice space with classic diner fixtures. 
+ Like all FF joints, the management and service is really a notch above. Extremely friendly and accommodating. 
- No appetizers. I guess they want to turn tables?
- A grilled cheese with olive tapenade just didn't work. Too much cheese (something I thought I'd never say!), too much grease, and a flavor combination that missed the mark. 
- Mediocre burger. Nice size. Nice condiments. Bland, overcooked burgers. I've complained about FF's refusal to cook burgers to order before and I received a very reasonable response, but it doesn't change the fact that the burgers come out dry. I should probably stop ordering them.
- To my mind a diner should be open 24/7.

Do you have a place that you think about and you immediately need to go there because it's so good? Your stand-by. A place so good you try to mimic the recipes at home? Monty's Blue Plate Diner is that place for me. Great freshly-made food at very reasonable prices served in a unique former gas station by people who are always in a good mood. That's this place. And everybody will be happy - meat-eaters and vegetarians alike. The selections for vegetarians is just as diverse and large as the non-veg menu. My favorite is the Meatless Loaf of the Gods. Composed of shredded carrots and mushrooms (And I loathe ... no ... hate mushrooms, but not in this recipe surprisingly. Although I do pick out many.) covered in a wonderful cashew gravy with a side of skins-on mashed potatoes and steamed seasonal vegetables. So incredibly good AND so incredibly good for you! That's Monty's Blue Plate Diner - So incredibly good AND so incredibly good for you!
The best burgers - shakes - meatloaf.  Can't stop in Madison without going to the blue plate Diner

Love this place for a reasonably priced and delicious brunch!  If you're coming on a weekend, be prepared to wait a little-but don't let that dissuade you, because the food is delicious.  I personally loved the variety of vegetarian options as well as the use of local ingredients in the dishes.  The variety on this menu is also insane-there's everything from the house version of Eggs Benny to Indonesian curry.  I got the Vegetarian Hash with poached eggs, and I added avocado for only $1, a steal for a brunch place.  Loved the spiciness of the hash, which also had pieces of marinated Tempeh-so good!  The eggs were poached perfectly and the homemade biscuit that came on the side was buttery, flaky, and delicious.  Make sure to hit Monty's when you want a delicious, hearty brunch!

This place is AMAZING!!
I've had the falafel wrap, Monty's Blue Plate Burger with the walnut burger and tempeh bacon and both were fabulous!!!  I had to narrow my options down to my top 6 choices before ordering... I will go back many more times so I can try everything I want to order!!
And oh my gosh the pies!!  Fat Elvis (banana cake, peanut butter frosting filling and chocolate frosting) and Drumstick (Peanut butter silk pie with a fudge layer in the bottom) were both delicious!  
The staff is also very nice, helpful and passionate.

Awesome breakfast!!! Had the "something or other scramble" and it was amazing, kinda like an omelette that is scrambled but with more cheese!  Breakfast also comes with a super fluffy, light biscuit and some sliced, browned potatoes. Delicious, absolutely delicious. Plus the waiter took pity on us being so hungover and gave me some aspirin, so he automatically ranks high in my book.
The cupcakes are a must have as well. I tried the Fat Elvis and was amazed; banana cake stuffed full of peanut butter and frosted with plenty of chocolate! Now i see why everyone loves the bakery here.

My girlfriend and I love this place. We had a great experience on a nice fall morning. The patio was still open and the service was amazing. Meghan got the Monty's breakfast sandwich and it was unreal. The goat cheese made it. I had the Almond Milk French toast. It was cooked perfectly and came with Amish made maple syrup. Our server Chloe was one of the best servers I've had anywhere. She was funny and very prompt. This is a must stop for anyone. We will be back for sure!
Ok, nothing special. Service is great and people are very friendly. I would recommend market street dinner instead.

After "misunderstanding" communication, I got a call / message from the manager who DID took care of the issue I had. Better later than never. 
I WILL give it a try and update my review
50's diner feel with a surprisingly modern menu. Great for a "late dinner". Never had a bad meal here.

Well, there are times when you have to take one for "the team".   It was one of those twelve hour days when after not eating much, I was ready for some comfort food and a little decompression.  MPBD was a logical choice, and visions of possible options began to seem viable.  After some deliberation, the meatloaf was a logical choice.  The staff seemed somewhat distracted and non-attentive.  I looked at my watch and noticed that there was just fifteen minutes left before closing.  The dish arrived, and after a few bites, I realized that this order had been "nuked" for a minute maximum.  I determined this because of the difference in temperature between the meat and the extremity of the vegetable.  After about five minutes waiting for a server, the food was returned for "re-nuking".  Sadly, the dish was still in a tepid temperate range, but I was so hungry that it didn't matter.  The moral-if it's the end of the day (meaning their scheduled hours of operation), stay away.

We enjoyed lunch here on a trip to Madison and liked the decor and atmosphere. When I tried to find it again on Yelp and couldn't remember the restaurant name, I searched for Restaurants in Madison WI and added filters "American" and "Good for Lunch" -  but it didn't appear. Only found it after my daughter remembered the name of restaurant. It's surprising this restaurant, which has lots of good reviews, is so hard to find on Yelp.

Monty's offers many vegetarian options. For example, they offer the Reuben sandwich for meat eaters and the Sheldon for vegetarians. I am consistently disappointed when I visit Monty's. On the last visit, I my fries were cold and my glass was dirty and cracked. A companion ordered a plain cheeseburger and it was loaded with onions. The carrot cake was obviously old--the cake was dried and the frosting was crusty. Another companion got the German chocolate cake which was also dry. It's a cool place, but needs better food.

Such a great variety of food for those who are have allergies or other dietary restrictions. Although we had a bit of a wait, everyone in our group had a substantial number of meals to pick, and enjoyed what they decided to get. Plus, the wait staff keep the coffee coming! Cannot wait to return.

If I could give this place 10 stars I would. I've been coming here since opened and it is consistently the best. Breakfast all day, more than just burgers and fries, deserts, beer selection....I can't rave enough.

The meatloaf of the Gods is to die for and their Just Coffee roast (their own blend) is so amazingly good I have my mom buy it and send it up to me in Minneapolis. It's that good.

Some of the people that work there have been there since I was a kid. Its a neighborhood place where you're bound to run into people you know and I make a point to go there at least twice while I'm home to visit.

Yay Monty's!

Monty's is one of my favorite go-to restaurants, and not just because it's right in my neighborhood.

They're great for brunch, lunch, dinner, dessert, breakfast for dinner, and those times you just NEED a malt. I almost always sit at the counter, which is first-come-first-served, but even on the weekends, they get a crowd seated pretty fast. Service is usually great, and I think I've only had one not-good server in many, many visits. I also think the prices are really good for the quality and portions.

A few favorites: 
-either weekend special: I love the biscuits and red pepper, sausage gravy, and my husband almost always gets the steak with onion strings and compound butter.
-the meatloaf is super tasty, as are the potatoes and gravy on the side.
-the Florentine is my usual, especially if I don't want something too heavy
-the Sheldon, a veggie Ruben is delicious, even if you eat meat
-I am obsessed with their waffle fries--well worth the upgrade--though their regular fries are also great.
-their coffee is really good

Still great. Thanks to Yelp and Monty's for the free check-in coffee. Service good despite the full house. Our server forgot a glass of milk, felt terrible amd immediately comped it. GREAT service.  We'll be back.
Great place, I visited there this weekend and the service was blazing fast. I had the goat cheese chicken sandwich and it was excellent!
Yummy sweet potato hash, yummy eggs. Biscuits are decent! Boyfriend was happy with his meal as well (simple eggs, bacon, potatoes, etc.) Service was quick and friendly.

Love this place! My favorite? Bloody Mary of course! I'd say it's the best Bloody Mary in town. Food is always delicious. Staff is always friendly and helpful. In three years of going to Monty's Blue Plate Diner we never had a negative experience.

We have been looking for a new breakfast go-to spot since Bluephies closed and I think we found it! The food was amazing, as were the drinks, our waiter, and atmosphere! The only downfall was that  the poached eggs in my eggs moray were not runny but they were still phenomenal. The Bloody Mary was the best I have had in a long time! We will certainly be back soon!

Been here twice for breakfast.  Both times my husband and I have gotten blueberry pancakes and a poached egg dish with mornay sauce.  The pancakes are incredibly fluffy and flavorful.  The original Eggs Mornay was delicious.  The eggs were runny, ham salty, English muffins slightly toasted, and mornay sauce was decadent.  On our 2nd visit I ordered the Mediterranean Sunrise, with which I was disappointed.  The flavor of the olives and capers were a bit overpowering (which is probably just the nature of the dish) but the eggs were overcooked.  Other tasty dishes we or our dining companions had and enjoyed include the Ham and Cheese Omelette (soooo cheesy), Country Breakfast, and Fruit Plate (with fresh fruit... and we know fresh, coming from California).  Service was slow but the food was great.  We can't wait to go there again (I'd vote 4 1/2 stars rather than 4 if I could)

Customer service....AMAZING. 
I can't stress how great the customer service was. 
I came here with a group of about 7-8 people for breakfast, and for some reason some of the cousins I came with decided to be a bit picky from the beginning, and our server was so good at dealing with it! 
The restaurant is pretty spacious inside, and they also have outdoor seating. We didn't have a wait or anything.
There were a lot of options on the menu, which brings me to another great thing about this place, they had vegan food, that was so tasty! Two of my cousins are vegan, so it was great that we found this place.
For starters we had the donuts, which are freshly made daily, SO GOOD! We had the ones with sprinkles! 
We all tried to get different things so we can try each others food. I tried the banana walnut pancakes, so so great, probably one of my favorite entrees. I also tried the omelette, we substituted bacon for chicken, and it turned out so good. My least favorite was the burrito, I wasn't too crazy about it, but it was still decent! My all around favorite items for this place were the breakfast potatoes and biscuits, wow. I normally don't get potatoes during brunch because I really don't like them that much, but these potatoes are seasoned so well, we all couldn't stop talking about them! Another item we really liked were the biscuits, I had 2 biscuits with butter and jelly, and I am not ashamed! 
If I ever come to Madison again, I'm paying this place a visit. Amazing service and food!

My friend and I go out for brunch st least once a month, and we used to eat here about as often as I could convince her to make the extra drive. We stopped by recently and I was a little shocked at how the mighty have fallen. There's almost always a wait, which I expected, but what I didn't expect was standing in front of the person at the register, waiting an awkward few minutes to be acknowledged. A table clear, seated quickly, friendly waitstaff, prompt coffee. Except we had to grab her and ask for normal cream as all that was left was flavored coffee mate. Whoops--we missed the fact that there was no silverware to stir the coffee. Had to ask for that too. Well, maybe my old fav breakfast would save it. Alas, no. 

Biscuit rubbery, not flaky, sweet potato hash unbelievably over spiced, fruit side had browning pineapple and turning melon. Ugh. But the scrambled eggs were perfectly done, although I had to add pepper and salt, weird considering the hash. 

For the first time ever, I didn't bother taking leftovers home. I don't think I'll be back anytime soon, not with so many other great neighborhood options.
Everything I have ever tried here is delicious! The cupcakes are to die for!

Came here on the recommendation of a friend. We showed up roughly around 11am. The place was packed (it's a sunday, after a badger game, I get it). We put our name in with the hostess who stated it would be 20 minutes. 45 minutes later, we were seated. I get it, you can't make people leave...but over estimate the wait time. 20 mintes, I can hang out, I can look at a menu, I can make small talk with strangers. 45 minutes? I can leave and get a cup of coffee in someplace else and then come back for breakfast. 

There was no apology, just a shout and a point to our table. Again, I get it, not a 5 star experience. Our server was prompt, coffee was good and he was generous with refilling our beverages. Menu selection looked good. We ordered and our food came out very quickly, which after waiting so long was nice. I had the Blue Plate Special omlete.  Decent. Nothing over the top, but very good; avacados were a little sparse, but hey, it's November and that shit is expensive.  We also ordered a short stack to share. I went to pour the maple syrup...and immediately my fingers stuck to the handle of the syrup carafe.  Gross. The potatoes that came with the meal seemed very (very) seasoned. I didn't try them. They just looked too salty and underdone. But no harm no foul, I will just know not to order them again.

All in all, I would come here again. Probably not on a weekend though. The bakery items looked delish, so that's a definite possibility.

I'd been here years ago, and it hasn't changed. Diner food, with a healthy twist. 

The building is cool, but we sat outside. Service was great for our large group at a busy time. Baby-friendly, which is always nice. I had a GBLT, a very good BLT with guacamole. Good bun, good bacon, fresh veggies. Sided with a very good coleslaw.

Sweetie had a Cobb salad, which she really liked. We would definitely go back.

Fun authentic 50's dining atmosphere, kid friendly, delicious eggs, brunch options, Mexican options, Greek options, vegan options, great service, mimosas....you could literally take anyone here and they'd be blown away.  If you're looking to make everyone happy (even the fussiest of eaters) while still satisfying your own Non-conventional brunch palate, Monty's blue place will certainly not disappoint.  When I first sought out monty's, I was vegan.  I loved the tongue scramble.  Years later, I am a big egg lover, and the eggs monay, wow.  You can't go wrong.  Also, if you're thinking about ordering the chilaquiles,  DO IT.

Last time I was there we had a table for four people. We ordered: one Reuben, one Sheldon (Reuben's vegetarian cousin) as is, two vegan Sheldons. What can I say, my friends and I like kraut. 

But yeah. The Sheldon can be made vegan, and even without cheese (gasp) it's really delicious. Someone else mentioned that it was dry, but I order this almost every time and am never disappointed. 

The fries are awesome. Good (but expensive) Bloody Marys. They have vegan pie slices and can make VEGAN MILKSHAKES. 

:)
Good solid diner. Great selection of pies and desserts. Can sometimes be really busy which turns into a long wait for both a table and service. But the food is worth a little patience.

Great local diner, that features lost of creative dishes-like zucchini pancakes.  Awesome bakery and great, home cooking.  While i'm prone to go with breakfast items, the lunch offerings have also always been good.  I don't think you can really go wrong here.  Decor screams old-time diner, maybe even at the expense of feeling a little bit forced.  All the same, this place should be a regular stop for anybody in madison.

I liked the 1950s-diner ambience of this joint. It was crowded and bustling when we went, though we didn't have to wait for a table, unlike people in larger groups. It seems to be a popular weekend brunch spot.

The service was friendly and prompt and our waiter picked up that I was vegan (without me telling him) and helpfully told us that some things (such as the rolls) weren't dairy-free. He substituted toast and English muffins for us.

I found my vegan tofu scramble with potato hash to be decent, but nothing spectacular. My friend thought the same of his "Sloppy Faux" sandwich which came with waffle fries. The prices are reasonable at around $7-10 a dish and the portion sizes are good. They do offer at least eight or nine vegan-friendly dishes from scrambles to burgers to meatloaf.

Madison needs a place like this which offers vegan brunch foods so I appreciate Blue Plate is around. The vibe is good and they have parking. But the quality of the food could stand to improve a bit.

Always around a 15-30 min wait to get in on the weekends, but always worth it. Usually great service by the wait staff, food is always prepared well, and prices are reasonable. Salmon hash is delicious. French toast comes in large quantities and is made with thick and fluffy bread. Breakfast burrito could be bigger, but it's tasty.

My impression of Monty's is very conflicting. On one hand, I want to say Monty's is an awesome place with great food. On the other hand I want to say Monty's is overrated. 

Let me explain. 

I love Monty's because of the options. If you are a vegetarian or vegan you aren't confined to the world of salads. There are many delicious and satisfying options. If you don't restrict your diet in any way, there are many great meaty and chalorically rich options for you too. Watching carbs? Get a sandwich in a wrap. Looking for a healthy lean meat option? Choose one of the several good chicken dishes. 

I personally steer towards the lean meat or veggie dishes and have never been disappointed. It's really hard to find a restaurant that caters to my needs as well as my boyfriend's nonrestrictive diet needs. This place does it well and at a pretty decent price. 

Though, I don't personally think Monty's is overrated, I feel that the point needs to be made. Whatever you order will be fresh and pretty tasty. However, say you order The Meatloaf of the Gods, it may not be what you expect if you are the type of person that is looking for traditional 'the-way-mom-made-it' meatloaf slathered with ketchup. If you are looking for an extensive breakfast menu consisting of traditional American breakfast combos (i.e. - a dish that contains ALL of the following: pancakes, eggs, hash browns, 3 kinds of meat and toast), Denny's or Perkin's may be a better option for you. 

They put their own spin on the more traditional dishes and have created an awesome list of in-house specialties. Whether you eat meat or not you MUST try The Meatless Meatloaf of the Gods. It's amazing. Like your beef? Definitely try the Blueplate Burger! Don't like beef so much but still want a burger? Try the Blueplate Burger with a locally made walnut burger. 

No matter who you are, Monty's is worth a try.

Oh my why didn't I review this place, like, a year ago?  

What's not to like about Monty's.  The only bad thing (which is really a great thing) is all menu choices, especially if you're a vegetarian.  It's sort of scaled-up-diner-food-meets-comfort-food, then add a fair share healthy options.  And great prices.  And great service.  Although it's not on Willy St. it still has the same friendly neighborhood atmosphere.  

So I've been to Monty's twice, both times late morning, and was seated and served quickly.  The first visit a friend and I split the spinach and feta omelet which was great and large enough for both of us, and a third friend had the salmon hash.  After our meal Monty himself (well, not sure if it was the Real Monty, so lets say the chef) came out to ask us how our meal was.  The second visit I went with a lunch item and ordered chicken fried steak, also great and the portions were easily enough for two people.  Once again Monty came out and greeted his diners!  Ordered a piece of Fat Elvis cake to go, which is banana cake layered with peanut butter fudge icing and topped with chocolate icing. Yum!

Monty's Blue Plate Diner in Madison, WI

This place is one of my new favorite Madison spots! I love that immediately when you walk if you are greeted by a wall of desserts! I knew at first sight that this place was for me. I had visited a few times in the past just for the desserts and let me tell you... the dessert is amazing!!!! I have had the caramel walnut dutch apple pie a al mode twice now. I have also had the snickers pie twice and french silk. I just can not stress enough how important it is that the world experience these desserts. They are life changing!

The dessert is good but I don't say that to down play the other food. This last time I ordered the meatloaf stack. I think you can guess that I loved it as well. This place can do no wrong in my book. My meal looked like a tower of delicious beauty! The foundation was a modest slice of bread uplifted by the glorious meatloaf cooked to perfection directly on top of it. The next layer was the mashed potatoes. Now these taters were divine--seasoned and buttery followed by the crispy shoestring onion rings with the most lovely batter providing just the right amount of crunch and texture to the dish. The icing on the cake, wasn't icing at all (obviously) but the most delicious brown gravy I have ever tasted. This dish couldn't get any better. However, I do hope to try a few other items on the menu next time I visit. It shouldn't be long before I do again. 

In terms of the environment, of course the waiter we had was just the most precious little thing. He said he started in October and we were his first guest to tend to outside due to construction forcing the location to close their outside seating. The construction is still going on, but the seating is out for patrons to enjoy a meal or a quick dessert. 

If you want great service, great food, and absolutely great dessert... go as soon as you can to Monty's Blue Plate Diner!

I can definitely see the appeal of Monty's. This delicious and clean diner serves up some tasty eats with a twist. It didn't take long for my buddy Corey D to share his love and thus I had to experience it for myself.

If you're not carrying a child, you must sample their drink menu. Looks super fantastic. Please have one for me. But beyond the cornucopia of boozy beverages lie various menus that will satisfy just about every craving. Sweet, savory, both...take your pick. 

During my visit, I sample the hash...but due to Corey's insight, I kindly asked if they could make my plate half sweet potato hash and half corned beef hash. Yes they can, and yes they did. The hash was nicely crisped and the corned beef perfectly salty. Portions were sizable without being gigantic, and honestly, I kind of appreciate that. No one needs to start their day with 6 pounds of corned beef hash. Yikes.

The sizes were just fine - I appreciate the substitution of fruit. Gotta add some healthy in your meal! My main gripe is for their biscuits. Mine was uber dry and crumbly. Bummer on the biscuit, but I'm sure I'll manage. 

Next time I make it up to Madison, I'd happily swing back into Monty's for another scrumptious breakfast.

Had the GBLT old soggy bacon,  had to ask for mayo because they put none on the sandwich. It was basically a lot of lettuce and tomato. The waffle fries were overvooked to the point they were too hard to eat.  Wanted to love this place but I was severly disappointed.

Loved this place, from the off-the-beaten path location to the old-school diner atmosphere to the awesome gluten free options to the friendly service and good prices. I had a reuben made gluten-free and was in heaven. SO delicious, with the equally awesome bean salad. Menu is huge - from sandwiches to comfort entrees like meatloaf (vegan too!) to salads and breakfast.

Went here last night after an exhausting day taking care of a newborn. Thankfully my baby slept through our entire dinner despite how loud the place is. The decor is simple but spacious and the service is really good and fast. We were seated immediately (on a Saturday night! ) and were served water by the waitress right away. She was friendly and always nearby her customers. My husband had the Mediterranean omelet  (can't remember what It's called). It had feta cheese,  mushrooms and spinach with potatoes on the side and a biscuit.  It was so good I wanted to steal his plate.  I got the meatless meatloaf.  It was very filling and the gravy was good but the  portion was way too big. By the time we were done we had no room for the amazing looking cheesecake. I guess we will have to come back to try dessert.  Oh and the couple next to us ordered an ice cream Sundae, it was ridiculously huge and looked awesome. Good for sharing!  I definitely recommend this once for simple diner food done well.

Great brunch, good service. 

Dinner is fancier diner food that might be a little overpriced for what it is.

Monday is hard for everyone. 
So if you ever come home from work disoriented (cuz it's Monday), Monty's there for you to take a good care of your Monday night meal. 

My bf and I had fantastic vegan 'breakfast for dinner' spread last night. The hash with tofu scambles + waffle fries. It was good, unexpectedly fabulous. 
The portion size is generous. I took home the left overs and lunching on it as I write this review. Bonus.

Monty's fruits pies are all vegan (i didn't know this). Pies are so-so for my taste, but not bad.

Monty's is rockin! Monty should be very proud what this and Food Fight in general have become. I've been to most Food Fight restaurants, but this is the first review I've dished out for this rockstar group.

Back to Montys.. it's kick ass.. from when you walk into the door up until paying your bill and walking out. Service is on point, food is fast and delicious, prices are fair, and the pie... oh my god the pie. I've given most of their pies a shot, and have never been disappointed. Have had to run a few extra miles but well worth it ;)

If you're EVER around the Atwood area, give Montys a shot. You may have to wait a bit, but trust me on this one.. it's well worth the wait.

Thank you and keep up the great work.

My hubby and I have been on a diner kick lately! About one week ago we visited Monty's for dinner. When I lived on the east side I would go there often for lunch. It has been years since I had the chance to check out what was on the menu. I was not disappointed. I had the mac and cheese and it was wonderful. Fresh and full of comfort food goodness. The service was great and we will be back for sure!

Craving a chocolate malt, I stopped in on a walk around 3 pm on a Friday afternoon. The place was largely empty, and spotless. I haven't been to Monty's in several years, after suffering from 'stomach issues' after dining here back then, I couldn't bring myself to chance it again.

No issues this time, I'm happy to report. I ordered a triple chocolate malt to go. Chocolate (Sassy Cow!) ice cream, chocolate milk and chocolate syrup. Really good, and worth the $7 price tag. Definitely killed the craving, and put a happy spring in my step for the rest of my errand walk around the Atwood area.

The service was fast and friendly, as there were more than enough employees waiting around for the afternoon and evening dinner rush to begin. Maybe next time I'll be brave enough to try the food again :-)

Awesome spot for breakfast lunch and everything in between! My family and I normally eat at the downtown eateries but came across this gem on Yelp and had to try! 
Of course we couldn't pass up a chocolate malt to start. I enjoyed an omelet while my dad ordered a classic cheeseburger. You can't go wrong with either their extensive breakfast or lunch choices!

Monty's is amazing. Try to get breakfast at Monty's every time I'm in town. Which over the past 15 years has been a lot. Love the atmosphere, the staff, the cleanliness of the place and most importantly the food!

My table ordered: and I sampled it all.

- chicken pot pie with mashed potatoes
(fantastic, but a bit heavy on the rosemary)

- BLT with red fried potatoes
(came with Guacamole. Nice surprise and flavor)

- Chicken soup with side salad
(good homemade taste & look)

- Blueberry Pancakes with bacon
(Fluffy, moist, loads of berries, crisp bacon)

- French toast with sausage
(great cinamon sugar, smaller portion, tasty sausage)
Great service and atmosphere.  The food is good - comfort food for the soul.
Great veggie options. Desserts are a must!

The reviews on this place are legit, probably one of the best breakfast spots I've tried since using yelp. I was seated almost immediately and the service was very prompt and friendly. Yankee women love a southern accent....

I had the tex mex omelette, sweet potato hash, bacon, and fruit. It was all spot on. You must try the sweet potato hash, it was great and something different.

If I'm ever back in Madison for whatever reason, I will definitely swing by for breakfast.

So delicious. Great stop, on recommendation from a friend. Son had the vegan banana walnut pancakes... he said they were the best he's ever had. Daughter loved the med plate...hummus was delish! 2 had burgers... meat tasty and grilled nicely. We will be back!

They have a bit of everything...I never get super excited to go to Monty's but it is never disappointing.  Possibly except for the 30-45 minute wait.

This last time, I went in seriously craving me some pie.  I ended up filling up on their mac and cheese.  No room for pie.  All of their pies at the time also just did not sound exactly to be what I wanted either.  I was craving a fruity cherry pie or something and it was just turning to fall so it was either chocolate or fall flavors.  Not their fault, but a curse of my pie needs.

The food is good.  I am not a huge breakfast person so pancakes are not usually my thing but they do have a few options I do eat, like breakfast potatoes and sometimes I even venture out of my comfort zone for the eggs.  I honestly do not think I have tried the same thing twice because they have so many options.

There are definitely hits and misses at Monty's. As a pesco vegetarian, I appreciate a restaurant where I have more than 3-5 options The hits would include the vegetarian meatloaf dinner, carrot curry soup, the salmon ceasar salad, almost all of their baked goods, and almost all of their breakfast items. The misses include the vegetarian reuben (called the Sheldon), it's just too dry.  Ditto on the vegetarian BLT.  The waits at weekend brunch and lunch time are long.  At times, I have experienced legendary slow service so dine with only people you can stand being around for 2 hours or more.  Despite the negative, I enjoy it, and I  take people who are new to Madison here, and they love it too.

Yum! Monty's was absolutely adorable. After eating dinner there I can say with certainty this will become one of my new regulars. Right when I walked in I knew it would be a place I would enjoy. The atmosphere was that of an older, trendy diner and had a quick moving, upbeat, friendly staff making the atmosphere even more enjoyable. My friend got the artichoke sandwich, delicious, and I got the chicken in a pie, right from grandma's kitchen. Afterwards we ordered a red velvet cupcake which was to die for, and all for under $15. We shared great conversation and didn't feel at all rushed, our waitress was great. She made recommendations and shared jokes with us, not seeming to put up a front at all. I will be going back sooner rather than later.

Been several times and always the same. Fun space, menu reads very well and you expect to get a great meal, but food is totally plain and unexciting. All hat, not cattle.  Don't waste the time or money, many better options around town.

Always great! I love breakfast and breakfast is ALWAYS  great here!  Giant pillowy biscuits, fresh organic eggs...had an omelette with spinach, feta cheese, and mushrooms, fried potatoes and coffee, my boyfriend had the meatloaf of the Gods... Oh my... You've got to try this! 
There's usually a little wait for a spot on Saturday but it's well worth it.  
Even walked here by myself once and sat at the cute little diner counter and felt completely comfortable and got just as good service. 
Then there's dessert... For that sweet tooth you give in to on the weekend...great cookies, cheesecakes, and bars- shakes and ice cream.  Can't wait to come back!
