I had attempted to go to Monty's Blue Plate Diner the last time I was in town, but it was so crowded that I was deterred and ended up at Ella's Deli for possibly the worst omelet of my life.  This time, I was determined to wait it out at Monty's for as long as it took - which ended up being only ten minutes at around 11:30 a.m. on a Sunday.  The wait was well worth every second.  My breakfast companion and I had the meatless meatloaf - a melange of carrots and other vegetables, covered in a cashew and sage gravy - and a caponata omelet, filled with a stew of perfectly-cooked, still-easily-recognizable vegetables and a pesto sauce made from basil grown out back.  Each bite of each dish was a delight.  I took home a slice of Reese's peanut butter cheesecake which I am hoping my son will find to be too rich for him because, uh huh!  That means I get to polish it off.  Can't wait to get back to Madison for another go-round at Monty's!

Always loved this place, but last time we tried it had a terrible experience.  Wanted to order fish and was told they no longer served it.  About 5 minutes later the same waitress brings out a huge fish plate for the lady next to us.  We are like " What the HECK" ????  Needless to say if we are not good enough to eat what anyone else gets, then we are taking our business else where.  The food that we got was not that great this time anyway.

Eh it was okay. Maybe I should have ordered breakfast as that looks like that's what they are known for. But I was there at lunch time and craved a burger so that's what I ordered. It was ok nothing special to brag about. I would probably go there again but for sure going to try the breakfast.

Was staying on UW campus for a wedding so decided to venture a bit off and check out what else Madison had to offer. 

When we got to montys there was quite a crowd so must be serving up some good stuff. Our group of 6 only had to wait about 15 mins so not bad! The menu was really varied and had something for everyone. I ordered the wknd biscuits and gravy special, really tasty. The gravy was on the untraditional side with southwestern flare featuring  red and green peppers in it. My bf got the guac blt with waffle fries and others in the group got a Reuben, the country breakfast, and a burger. Oh and of course some yummy spicy bloody Mary's. 

Service was quick and friendly and were in and out in less than an hour! Definitely recommend.

Came here once for dinner, and I was seriously impressed! I eat everything, but I love seeing places that have veggie and vegan/gf options. Monty's is the epitome of a classic comfort food diner, and they've gone so far as to have an amazing selection of vegan and vegetarian dishes on their menu. Comfort food + vegan? Yes, please! 

The service was great when I was there; our waitress was very attentive and the food came quickly.  The prices are a bit steep, but you do get a lot of food. 

I will be back for more delicious classics with interesting veggie/vegan twists! I recommend checking out their non-meat options even if you do eat meat...they're awesome!
We got there were told it about 45 minutes wait, but there were seats at counter. We had lunch , food was great and service was great.
I've been here a couple times. The food is outstanding. 2nd best biscuits this side of the Mason Dixon Line. And a cheese curd in my Bloody Mary? Yes, please and thank you. Can't wait to go back!

Okay, I straight up ordered the "heathen vegans shoplifter's delight" because of the name.  

I'm not proud of my devil may care attitude when it comes to ordering food, but reckless abandon at Monty's has proven fruitful.

Delightful meal.  Everything about it matched the hippy dippy quarky way of MadCity life.  Service was a shade slow and it wasn't crowded by any means, but I had good company.  Who cares.

Monty's is one of those places that is WAY over hyped and I think that doesn't help it.

I've been here ONCE. One time. Ever. And I've never gone back. I lived 2 blocks away for three years and I now live on the end of Willy (still relatively close) and still have not gone back. It's been around 4 years since my first visit.

The food was by no means terrible. The service was fine. I was WAY put off by having to eat outside when it was 1,000 degrees out. It's ALWAYS busy. Always. They don't have enough places to sit and I would imagine not nearly enough places to park. The food was mediocre, at best. The service left PLENTY to be desired. We waited FOREVER to be sat, then waited forever to order, then waited forever to get our food.

Then our food wasn't even good and the bill was way too high for the meh experience we had.

I would really like to try it again. On paper, it's everything I love. Greasy spoon. Local. Close to my house. Vegetarian friendly. But the experience I had there was enough to keep me from ever going back, sadly.

Maybe I'll work up the courage to give it another chance at some point.

Big plates of food. Awesome staff. So, so many shake/malt options. 

This is the place I usually come after my flight has landed in Madison. The food isn't aiming to be some crazy, new, cutting edge concoction. It's homey and it's familiar. 

I've been to a lot of diners. Not every diner does it right, but this one does. If you want tasty food, and ample servings of it, at a good place then this is the place to go.

I loved this place! I went at night and got dessert to go - the Elvis cake is unbelievably good! My friend's giant cupcake was also great.

Since we liked the dessert so much we decided to go back and get brunch the next morning, which was also great. My friend loved her eggs with fresh salsa and home fries and the caramelized onion macaroni and cheese I had was a thing of beauty.

I will definitely return!

This diner is super cute. The home made biscuits alone are worth going to Monty's. I went on a Saturday morning (in December) and there was no wait. I had the caponata & pesto omelette and my friend had a country breakfast. The portions were big and the food was great. If you like a classic breakfast in a simple, but cool setting, this is a great place to go.

We got seating at a booth for four people right when we got in. Our waitress was very attentive and friendly and we got our water very quickly. I ordered the roast turkey platter, which came with turkey breast, cranberry applesauce, broccoli, mashed potatoes, a dinner roll and gravy. The meal was okay, the gravy was extremely over powering. But the friends I ate with really enjoyed their meals. One thing I did like about this place was that they had and entire vegan menu - - and their vegan brownie was really good! We'll come back here soon for either breakfast or late night dinner to check out the breakfast food!
Old school -- I enjoyed the meatloaf and there are some really great options if you are dining with a vegetarian.
This place has awesome decor. Great parking. Awesome staff. Mediocre food.

On the return drive from the north, we wanted a fun, local diner with great food. Yelp recommended the BPD as all of the above.

When you walk in you are immediately presented with a series of sinister pies. All shapes, sizes and flavors. Man I gotta save room for that. We went to our booth and were immediately surrounded by families and folks just having desserts: exactly what we were looking for.

For dinner, we had a very delicious chicken pie (how comforting, yet nuked perhaps?) and a vegan burger that was amazing! I have honestly never had such a delicious vegan burger. After reviewing the menu I quickly realized there were many vegan options. Excellent!

In all, our simple dinner came to $22 for both. We skipped the dessert simply because we ran out of room in our tums.

Monty's Blue Plate Diner is consistently good.  They use fresh and local ingredients; they put a lot of thought in their menu.  It is always hard to decide what to get when I stop by.

I found myself here the other morning before the Marquette Waterfront Festival and enjoyed the Eggs Mornay.  It's their take of the Eggs Benedict but instead of a Hollandaise sauce it's the cheesy cousin, Mornay.  The eggs were poached nicely, sitting on top of a thin but hearty slice of ham and English muffin.  The fried potatoes are seasoned with a tiny kick and slightly crunchy on the outside but soft enough to cut easily.

I topped the meal with a cup of coffee.  My server was very attentive with a water or coffee refills (almost to the point where I was going to hide my glassware).  But I would take that kind of service over never seeing a server.  I tipped her well for her efforts.

Monty's is still one of my favorite breakfast places!! Breakfast food is consistently delicious. My most favorite dish is the blue plate special omelette with salsa, cheese, avocado and bacon. Bread is from Madison sourdough, I think? Lots of breakfast options for meat lovers and vegetarians. Coffee is fantastic. Service is usually great. It's breakfast food that is wonderfully homemade with fresh ingredients. It's not a hole in the wall greasy breakfast joint, but it's equally as good!
Went here on 07/17/16 with some people before going to the Overture to see Kinky Boots! The food was amazing and the service was great!

I'm sad to say that after a really great first experience over one year ago, Friday night's dinner at Monty's was very disappointing and I probably won't come back any time soon.  The host at the counter was not friendly.  My sandwich came on bread that was literally hard as a rock and then my husband was done eating before I even started my dinner because I sent it back and waited for new bread. The bread the second time around was greasy and the sandwich itself was dripping in grease.  GROSS.  My husband ordered the fish fry and they forgot part of his order.  It was just a bad day for Monty's....I might be back for dessert someday.
This is a great place with an old time vibe. Service is fantastic and the food is definitely elevated!
One of my favorite places to eat.   Zucchini Pancakes are awesome!!!  We mostly eat breakfast here but I'm sure lunch and dinner are just as good.

The neighborhood's excellent food quality sets a very high bar.  Monty's sandwiches half as good as Alchemy's.  Monty's chili half as good as Weary Traveler's.  Monty's vegan options almost as good as Green Owl's.  Monty's ice cream treats are half as good as the Chocolate Shoppe's.  All of those places are within a mile and none of them make you wait like Monty's.  If you like highbrow breakfast food, Marigold is generally better (but still crowded).  If you like middlebrow or lowbrow breakfast food, there's no need to pay $11 a plate.

Two nice things must be said about Monty's.  (1) The pie quality is above average with good selection.  (2) Hopefully, the crazy lines at Monty's drive people to other nearby places with better offerings.

In a one-bar town, Monty's would probably score four stars.  Alchemy, Weary Traveler, and Chocolate Shoppe are walking distance and Marigold is two miles.  And that's if you're not even considering Laotian across the street, or Vietnamese and Thai up the street.  Standing next to tall people makes me look even shorter; Monty's is so close to so many marvelous dining options that it just does not shine the way it used to before the competition heated up.
Visited with my family for first time. I have vegan diet and they don't, but we ALL enjoyed our meals. Will be back!

The food at Monty's is fine but the service is bad. Every time I've gone there, I've had slow, inattentive servers who seem very confused.  To give you an idea of how displeased I am with the service, every time I go there I plan to get a piece of pie. I never do because the food takes so darn long to get to me.

That said they are an excellent place for getting vegetarian options and breakfast all day. They have lots of pies although they are a bit pricey.

The food is amazing!
It was my first time here. Saw the food ordered by the people next to us. That biscuit and gravy looks so good and so creamy~
I ordered the Wisconsin Salmon Hash (in the breakfast item). It's like having hash browns but with LOTS of salmon in it. Never thought that they could mix so well together. For every bite, you get that smell from the potatoes but at the same time you get a mouthful of yummy salmon.
My friend ordered the turkey sandwich with waffle fries, which also tasted very nice.
The pies and cakes from the front desk also look so yummy. But we were already too full to care for dessert :( will definitely try that next time!

We stopped in on our way home to Chicago from Wisconsin Dells.   We had a 45 minute wait as it was a Sunday.  We were seated at 12 noon.   I ordered 1/2 corned beef hash and 1/2 Sweet Potato hash.  The corned beef was dried out in small cubes.  Tasteless.   The sweet potato hash was very tasty with just the right amount of spice.   Scrambled eggs were perfect.  Biscuit was fluffy and moist.  Service was good.    I understand the restaurant is very popular and we stopped after reading all of the positive reviews.  Next time, we will try another spot.
We stopped here on a road trip from Minneapolis to Chicago.  So glad we did. The meatloaf was the best ever.

I had high expectations for this diner, but unfortunately, I was highly disappointed with my meal. I ordered the Vegetarian Hash, which is actually vegan. It came with tofu scramble and a tempeh-laden potato hash. I was very excited to try this as the description sounded amazing and it looked SO good in the pictures. There was no flavor! How on earth do you mess up potatoes, onions, and tempeh! Those flavors just naturally compliment each other. Not here. And my hash had mushrooms in it, despite there being no mention of mushrooms on the menu's description. I hate mushrooms! The tofu was also flavorless.  To add insult to injury, they piled 4 slices of dry ass toast atop this dish. Like, why? 

The only good thing about this visit was the vegan milkshake. My shake consisted of vegan chocolate chip ice cream, chocolate sauce, and a cherry on top. They didn't have vegan whip cream but I didn't really miss it. The shake was thick, rich, and delicious. They also give you a lot for the money. That shake was worth an extra star all by itself.

I would come in just for one of their delicious vegan milkshakes, but that's about it.

Hands down the best diner I have ever been to... It all started a year back when my wife was looking for a place to treat me on my birthday and she came across Monty's...Ever since, it is first place that comes to our mind to enjoy a good weekend brunch. I always end up ordering a minimum of two items on the menu, not because the quantity is less but I just get greedy for having more. My personal best on the menu is their Tofu scrambler which has this never before kick ass taste.
I got violently ill an hour after eating here. I will never go back and would caution others to consider the same.
I went here reading positive reviews but my experience was exactly the opposite. Their food is absolutely okay...nothing exceptional about it.

A great diner experience!  They have a huge menu with a lot of variety.  I tried the Meatloaf of the Gods and it was delicious!  The meatloaf was tender and flavorful.  They finished it off on the flat top so the pieces had some texture on the outside.  Their gravy is on point, and they also have homemade ketchup which is awesome.

The decor is your classic diner feel with booths and the big display with desserts, etc.  The staff was friendly and the service was good.  This is definitely a must try if you're over on the east side.

I have only good things to say about Monty's! If you like unpretentious food that is filled to the brim with flavor you will also like Monty's. We had the meatloaf and chicken in a pie at our table. I think I said "yumm" no less than 9 times...really it couldn't be helped! The turtle cheesecake I got to go was also pretty spectacular. I appreciated the service as well. Our server was friendly and available without being overbearing. It was the perfect dinner.

Stopped here on the way home from the Dells because you bastards said it was good and guess what!? I AGREE!

Aside from the fact that it was freezing cold in there, I realllllllllly enjoyed the hell our of this place. First of all, the menu is composed of a bunch of awesome dishes; I wanted to order everything on the menu. It was as if they had scanned the portion of my brain that deals with Amanda eating habits and wrote a menu based on the data collected from the scan. Fettucini Alfredo and a turkey dinner!? Blue Plate, you shouldn't have! I'll order both!
Actually, I got a turkey sandwich with avocado on it. I realllllly like avocado. I really like turkey sandwiches, too, and let me tell you Blue Plate did not disappoint. Everything was mad good from the salad to the fries to the sandwich.

Cheap prices, good portions... If you're in the area I definitely suggest you hit this place up. Mail me the leftovers!

Monty's was and always is, pretty grand. 

Are you looking for a greasy spoon diner? Monty's is your place. Are you looking for an affordable restaurant with MANY vegan options? Monty's is your place. 

On our most recent visit, I decided to go full vegan and order off that menu (yes, there's an entire menu of vegan options). I got the vegetarian hash and added almond cheese to the tofu scramble. Others at the table tried everything from the sweet potato hash to the chilaquiles. We also ordered some drinks and pies for dessert. 

Monty's is in an old gas station and there are cute, blue tables to sit outside when it's nice out. Overall, it's a very quaint little diner. 

The only thing that's frustrating is that there's almost always a wait and it gets very crowded in the waiting area. I did look up the menu online before going and it looks like the website had some outdated prices for some of the menu items.
How can you call yourself a diner when you don't even have real maple syrup?

I had just moved from Colorado, back here, to the midwest. So of course, I ordered the meatloaf.

I told the server that it was better than my mom's, and that's no hyperbole -- it's DAMN good!

I will most certainly be coming back.

I FINALLY made it to Monty's! And I was not disappointed. I was surprised at the line being that we went around 10:30am on a Wednesday but the 10 minute wait was not the end of the world. The staff was friendly and we were waited on in a very timely matter. I opted to try the french toast which was mouth watering delicious. I also tried ordering a donut but was disappointed to find out they are only served on the weekends! 
All their desserts looked delicious but they were a little to expensive for my college budget so I had to pass. I will definitely be back to try some dinner food or explore other menu items!

We love Monty's! Our son has egg and dariy allergies and we love all the vegan options they have. Breakfast is the trickiest meal for our son because almost all breakfast foods contain eggs and dairy. But there are several options for our entire family. Our son's favorite is the tofu scramble with their potatoes. Come early on a Saturday or Sunday the wait can get long but worth it.

One of my favorite things is the blue plate special omelette with bacon, avocado, cheese and salsa on top. I also really enjoy the vegan hash and in not even vegan!

I also like to come for lunch. Their meatloaf is delicious and the vegan sandwich with portobello mushrooms, avacados, and lemon tahini dressing.

I'm just sad Monty's isn't closer to our house.

Monty's goes back a very long time in Madison and is a great place to get a home-cooked style meal.  I used to go with my parents as a kid, and now as an adult I've started to rediscover how much I loved their food.

Nestled in the eclectic Atwood Ave neighborhood, Monty's presents a 50's style diner with yummy lunch specials like meatloaf (very good meatloaf), sandwiches, and a wicked good brunch.  They also have ridiculously delicious chocolate shakes, so don't be afraid to splurge while you're there.  

One of the other great things about Monty's is the atmosphere; the area around it is filled with little mom and pop shops, the Barrymore theater, and relics of an older time.  Take a stroll around if it's a nice day and your bound to find something you like.  If not, I'm sure you probably enjoyed the food as all the dishes I've ever had were great and the portions were generous.

There are a few drawbacks though that held me back from giving a 5 star review.  First, there is usually a very long wait.  The place is popular, but I don't feel that the food and eastside location (I live far westside) always justifies the overall experience.  Secondly, the service is hit or miss.  I've had some waitresses who were prompt and polite, making me feel right at home, and others who were sarcastically rude to the point where people in my party almost had to say something.  Furthermore, the kitchen doesn't always look clean, as trays of biscuits have been left sitting out and flies have been a buzzing.

Setting all those things aside though (which I know may be hard for some), the blue plate is a Madison delight that should not be missed.  The food is so good you'll be stuffed in a recliner when you get home pining for more.

THEY HAVE PIES AND CAKES. 

But how can you have any pudding if you don't eat your meat???

Ahem, the "meat":
Bacon and cheddar omelet with american fried potatoes.
Scrambled egg whites with sweet potato hash of peppers, onions, and zucchini.
Spinach, onion, mushroom, and feta omelet with fresh fruit.
homemade BISCUITS :o 

Now you can eat your pudding.
NEVER had a bad meal at Blue Plate.  Great for any meal of the day.  Service always good whether you are at a table, at the counter, or outside on the patio.  Plenty of vegan and gluten free choices.

Awesome place to get brunch. Have a good menu for vegans and vegetarians as well.  The breakfast burrito is to die for and I had some spectacular biscuits and gravy there as well. Their dinner is also pretty good, but I'd definitely go for brunch. They also have amazing pies. The interior is a cool blue diner feel. Expect a wait for brunch, but it's worth it!

I had that chicken pot pie and it was wonderful!  My husband ordered soup and forgot to order a salad, but the soup was so huge that he wouldn't have been able to eat a salad.  My son had a burger and loved the fries.  Really a nice place with attentive wait staff.  Get there early though, because they were out of every kind of pie that my husband wanted.  The shakes were amazing!
I love Monty's and all the creative, new touches on diner classics.
Delicious Food.  Big portions.  Amazing service.  Maybe just slightly overpriced, but not really considering the quality and size.

Their banana pie and carrot cake are SUPER!!!!!!!
and if you happen to buy the whole container, you are required to give a 5-dollar deposit which will be returned if you bring it back.

Oh Monty, finally!
This morning, though I am still a little bit ill, I came only for you :) (and for me:))
Waiting for less than 10 minutes, we were seated by the window. A very nice spot. 

I decided quickly: I wanted to have a dish of scramble "something" (hahaha, I found this funny, I was wondering what "something" meant. I asked the server and she said it is for broccoli, pepper, some cheese (and God knows what else!-- too many to list! :D) and has no meat (yay!)
Hubby ordered a dish of pesto omelet! Both came with homemade biscuit- I'm in love with this biscuit right away! We enjoyed our brunch soooooooooooo much. 
I told the waiter: The food is excellent! I wanna come back soon!

The food is a five.
The service is a five.
Yes, full score for you, Monty. 

Sshhhhh, don't forget to also order their coffee and the donut.
The coffee is really an eye opener and the donut is ridiculously huge but so GOOD.

Monty has made my Saturday happy! and I really need that after one week of my illness :(
Mahalo, Monty!

Monty's is a Madison favorite.  Breakfast all day.  Fantastic comfort food.  Friendly service.  Veggie options.  While nothing spectacular, it's consistently pretty damn tasty.  Of note: popular breakfast (expect to wait) and the Meatloaf of the Gods.

When I was in Madison as a student I loved to go to the Blue Plate with friends because they always had options for the meat eaters and the vegetarians. As a former vegetarian, I think I first came here when I was a vegetarian. It was a long time ago. The diner theme is part of the aesthetic here, and my favorite dishes are the meat loaf, and the breakfast scrambles. My friend and I got two big breakfasts and the service was good on what looked like a crazy-busy Sunday brunch-rush. The coffee dude was keeping our cups full and warm as our server was moving past us bringing out amazing plates of super fresh food, yet always checking with us to see how we were doing. Busy, high quality standards, and lots of great cakes and pies if you have any room. I used to get the pie/cake to go, but not this time. 

It is just wonderful to see a place that was good over 10 years ago, still keeping its standards high and keeping people like me wishing they still lived in Madison! Great place. Great food. Great people.

Update on July 7th, 2015: Monty's you never disappoint. Still in love with this place! :)

Vegetarian's/ Vegan's Eden ~ Many options to select from!
I don't know why I haven't written a review for Monty's even after being here so many times but finally here it is...
What we have eaten here so far:
Vegetarian Hash, Vegetarian Chili, Chicken in a Pie, German's Chocolate and all of their pies! (my favorite the Key Lime)
Tofu Scrambler - The BEST DISH in house. The best tofu scramble I have ever eaten. This is definitely on our every order.
And their potatoes are one of the best I have ever had! What do you put in your seasoning?!
I don't even have to rate each and every item because they are all so good!
Service: 5
Servers are always friendly, helpful, and fast!
Price: Absolutely reasonable.

Had the vegan banana walnut pancakes.  Delicious!

Service was fast and polite.

My partner had the morning bun.  VERY GOOD.

They were out of the homemade donuts by 11:00AM :( - get there early to try those!

I knock off one star because they were really good but not the best.

Gosh, for the dozens of meals I've had here, I'm surprised I haven't rated this place yet.  I used to live just down the block, on Jenifer St.  That was about six years ago, but to this day I can recall several legendary menu items from heart.  The Meatloaf of the Gods.  The Meatless Meatloaf of the Gods.  The Reuben.  Reuben's vegetarian cousin, the Sheldon.  The Mediterranean Sunrise breakfast.  The potato-zucchini pancakes with sour cream and cranberry-applesauce.  Each of these was a delicious new step for me in discovering the foodie scene in Madison when I lived there.

So when I visited recently with my old roommate from Jenifer St., Monty's was the natural choice to grab a bite to eat.  To my initial dismay, the menu had been updated... no more Sheldon!  This was my favorite vegetarian Reuben sandwich back in the day.  I asked the waiter about it, and he offered to get a Sheldon made for me, no problem!  When it arrived, it was exactly as I had remembered it.  Delicious tofu and sauerkraut on rye bread with a side of Thousand Island dressing.  After a long day, I couldn't think of anything more satisfying.

Monty's is a true gem that stands tall, even among Madison's robust food culture.  Every time I go here, my expectations are exceeded.  I can't recommend it enough.

I flew into Madison with only two hours of sleep & no food, so excited to spend time with my Darling Daughter (DD). Our first stop was Monty's Blue Plate Diner.  When you enter the diner the first thing you see is the dessert case. They have their own bakery (examples: pies, cakes, giant cupcakes, donuts, pecan rolls, etc). Then you notice the casual, friendly atmosphere with booths & tables. My hubby will love the fact they serve breakfast all day, everyday & they have a To Go menu.
Our server, Keith W, was personable, prompt, & so helpful in describing the different dishes. DD & I each ordered a coffee with donut ($2.79 per order) DD ordered Florentine, one of their specialities.  (Sautéed spinach, onions, tomatoes and two poached eggs on top of crusty sourdough bread and finished with Mornay sauce & American fried potatoes  $8.99). I ordered Eggs Mornay: Two poached eggs with smoked ham on a toasted English muffin, topped with Mornay sauce & served with American fried potatoes $8.99.
You can order any one of six different hamburgers (five can be made gluten sensitive and one is Vegetarian) between 11am until closing. But that's not all.... They serve 11 different Entrees, 14 sandwiches, 5 salads & at least 3  soups! And I know all of that sounds wonderful, but I haven't even started to describe the specialty shakes, malts, sundaes and fountain drinks. My brother is a huge Elvis fan, so he'll probably love the "Fat Elvis Shake": vanilla ice cream, peanut butter, sliced bananas, & a splash of chocolate syrup ($6.99)! Yum!

Even though I had takeout, I really loved the inside of Monty's- it reminded me of the diners back home in New Jersey. I loved that they had homemade pies & cakes lining the glass display cases. I have been here twice and tried to get a table, but the wait was too long both times. 

I had the Chilaquiles, a favorite of mine, and theirs was really yummy:
Berkshire pork simmered in a tomatillo chili verde served over crispy corn tortillas with two eggs, pico de gallo, and feta cheese

It was a huge portion, too, so I had it for two meals. Would definitely go back here, and would like to eat in next time!

This was the third restaurant I every visited in Madison, back in 2004.  It remains a go to for relatively healthy diner food.  Great vegetarian options as well as delicious burgers.   Save room for desert!  The cakes and pies are wonderful, and you can also get yourself a milkshake that truly lives up to America's Dairyland standards.

I love Monty's. I've been coming to Monty's for years now, and if you haven't checked it out yet, you are seriously missing out. 

The restaurant itself it super cute. Small diner with booths and some tables, as well as counter service. Blue lighting up on the ceiling ties into the the Blue Plate theme. A collection of adorable tea pots up the walls. Love it. 

The food is amazing. Monty's offers food for everyone: carnivores, veggies, vegans, gluten sensitive.... Whatever you're diet or needs, they got you. 

I've had several dishes and I have enjoyed them all. I think my favorite to date though would be the Eggs Mornay. The Mornay sauce is so creamy and delicious! 

Both of the french toast options are delicious. The Huevos Rancheros are done very well. Honestly I don't think I have ever had anything other than breakfast here, but the hamburgers I have seen served look AMAZING. Big and juicy. On the last visit, the BF got the chicken pot pie, which also looked fantastic. Done a little differently than most pot pies - it looked he was served a slice of a large pot pie, instead of a little single serving. Pretty neat! He gobbled it up and said it was great. 

Overall, Monty's is a staple to Madison's Atwood neighborhood and I love it. Again, if you haven't tried it yet, please do. You will not be disappointed.
Walnut Burger is the way to go.. Their bean salad as a side option is Delish. Not expensive, long waits on weekends in the mornings but worth it.

My girlfriend and I stopped here for dinner last night and we were both impressed with the quality and the price of the diner food. The beef is local, from Black Earth, and the coffee is their own blend. The cupcakes were awesome!! Our waitress was really friendly and prompt also.

I love Monty's and come here every time I come into Madison!  As a vegan it offers a large amount of vegan choices and it's so tasty.  Staff is friendly, atmosphere is great!  Everything I've ever had off the vegan menu is AMAZING!!!
